news_article: UK's biggest companies' CEOs will earn more in compensation after 34 hours of paid work by Wednesday than the £31,461 (₹31.4 lakh) median worker will earn in 2021, a London-based think tank said. In 2020, CEOs took 33 hours to beat median annual pay. Top CEOs' pay is 120 times that of the typical UK worker, the think tank said.

news_headline: Users to lose access to WhatsApp if new privacy policy not accepted by Feb 8
news_article: WhatsApp has started sending an in-app notification asking users to agree to its updated terms and privacy policy, which come into effect on February 8. Users will lose access to the app if they don't accept the new terms by then. WhatsApp also asked the users who would prefer to delete their accounts to visit its Help Center.

news_headline: What data will WhatsApp get under its updated terms and privacy policy?
news_article: Under WhatsApp's new terms and privacy policy applicable from February 8, it'll temporarily store the media forwarded within a message on its servers. WhatsApp also explained how it works with other Facebook companies and shares data on transactions, account registration and mobile devices with them. WhatsApp Business accounts may provide WhatsApp with information about interactions with users.

news_headline: Billionaire Jack Ma is laying low, not missing or captured: Reports
news_article: Alibaba's billionaire Co-Founder Jack Ma is not missing but laying low for the time being amid China's crackdown on his business empire, CNBC reported. The 56-year-old has not been seen in public since he spoke at a Shanghai forum in late October where he criticised the country's financial regulators. CNBC added that Ma hasn't been "captured" or "taken".

news_headline: Chinese state news agency calls for shorter work hours in tech companies
news_article: State-affiliated Chinese press agency Xinhua News Agency has called for shorter working hours in the country's tech companies following the death of an employee at an e-commerce firm. Workers' legitimate rights and interests should not be sacrificed and employers may be breaking the law in encouraging health-sapping overwork, it said. The employee had collapsed while walking home from work.

news_headline: Tesla car navigates 576 km in Full Self-Driving with no human help in US
news_article: A Tesla driver made a six-hour-long journey from Los Angeles to San Jose, travelling almost 576 km, in the Full Self-Driving mode with almost no human interventions. The driver claimed that they refrained from steering the car, accelerating or braking, except to make one stop to charge the car. They took control once to avoid large debris on road.

news_headline: Amazon, JPMorgan and Berkshire's healthcare venture to shut in Feb
news_article: The healthcare venture of Amazon, Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway and JPMorgan Chase, Haven, is shutting down next month. The venture was created in 2018 to provide better healthcare services and insurance at a lower cost to workers and families at the three firms. However, the firms will continue to collaborate informally to address the specific needs of their employees.

news_headline: Malaysian researchers develop drone from pineapple leaves
news_article: Malaysian researchers have developed an eco-friendly drone made out of the fibre found in the pineapple leaves. The drone is easier to dispose of, compared to those made out of synthetic fibres, Professor Mohamed Thariq Hameed Sultan said, adding that it can degrade in two weeks. It can fly up to 3,280-feet high and remain airborne for about 20 minutes.

news_headline: Apple to launch AirTags item trackers, AR device in 2021: Analyst
news_article: Apple plans to release AirTags item trackers and an AR device in 2021, according to analyst Ming-Chi Kuo's note, obtained by MacRumors. AirTags are Apple's rumoured Bluetooth tracking devices that would help users keep track of their personal belongings, such as their keys and backpacks. AirTags will reportedly be managed through a new Items tab in the Find My app.

news_headline: Bitcoin has emerged as gold's rival, could rise to $1,46,000: JPMorgan
news_article: Bitcoin has emerged as a rival to gold and could trade as high as $1,46,000, JPMorgan strategists said on Tuesday. Bitcoin is likely to outshine gold as millennials become a more important component of the investment market over time, they added. The digital currency's prices have more than tripled in the past six months and touched $34,800 on January 3.

news_headline: Amazon overtakes Boeing as Washington state's largest private employer
news_article: Amazon has become Washington state's largest private employer, overtaking airplane manufacturer Boeing, reported Seattle Times. Amazon added 16,500 Washington-based jobs, bringing its total to 80,000 in the state. In comparison, Boeing ended 2020 with 58,800 employees, an 18% reduction since the start of 2020. Boeing has reportedly also been the state's largest employer post-World War II.

news_headline: Twitter acquires social podcasting app Breaker to help build Spaces
news_article: Social podcasting app Breaker on Tuesday announced that it has been acquired by Twitter. As part of the deal, Breaker's team will join Twitter to help build its new audio-based networking project, Twitter Spaces, Breaker Co-founder Leah Culver said. Breaker was founded in 2016 and is led by CEO Erik Berlin and CTO Culver.

news_headline: Optical fibre laying speed must go up 4 times to achieve PM's vision: TAIPA
news_article: In order to achieve Prime Minister Narendra Modi's vision to connect every village in India with broadband, optical fibre laying speed needs to increase nearly 4 times, Tower and Infrastructure Providers Association (TAIPA) said. Cables will have to be laid out at a speed of over 1,251 km a day, up from the existing 350 km a day, it added.

news_headline: Iran tests domestically produced drones in military exercises: Report
news_article: Iran launched military exercises featuring a number of domestically produced drones. Its armed forces are to test combat drones used as bombers, interceptors and in reconnaissance missions in the two-day exercises in central Semnan province, Fars news agency reported. Iran has also resumed 20% uranium enrichment at an underground nuclear facility.

news_headline: Pune metro to use human waste treatment tech at metro stations
news_article: The Maha Metro and DRDO signed an MoU for adopting Biodigester Technology for treating human waste and recycling water consumed in Pune metro rail. Maha Metro MD said this will help "conserve a significant amount of water in a state where water scarcity is increasing every day". The technology is an "efficient and economic" onsite alternative to conventional sanitation techniques.

news_headline: Pokèmon Go creator Niantic acquires US online gaming startup Mayhem
news_article: Pokémon Go creator Niantic announced the acquisition of Mayhem, a San Francisco-based startup focused on online gaming communities. The terms of the acquisition were not disclosed by Niantic. The "majority" of Mayhem's team will be joining Niantic. Its CEO Ivan Zhou will join Niantic's Social Platform Product team, while the rest of the team will join Platform Engineering.

news_headline: Facebook page of website that spent $46 mn on FB ads 'deleted without reason'
news_article:
Canadian content curation site Shared's CEO Jordan Nabigon said Facebook has deleted his company's main Facebook page without warning in October, and without providing an explanation. 
Nabigon has spent nearly $46 million on Facebook advertising between 2006 and 2020 for Shared and his other company Freebies. Facebook told Nabigon that the page was deleted "due to safety and security reasons".

news_headline: IBM appoints Trump's ex-economic adviser as Vice Chairman
news_article: The former economic adviser to US President Donald Trump and former Goldman Sachs Group President, Gary Cohn, has been appointed as Vice Chairman of IBM. He will be part of IBM's executive leadership team and will also act as an adviser to IBM CEO Arvind Krishna. IBM shares jumped about 1.2% following the news.

news_headline: Qualcomm CEO Steve Mollenkopf to retire after 26 years at the company
news_article: US chipmaker Qualcomm on Tuesday announced that its CEO Steve Mollenkopf is retiring, ending his 26-year journey at the company. Mollenkopf, who will remain at Qualcomm as a strategic advisor for an undisclosed period of time, will be replaced by Qualcomm President Cristiano Amon. "I am immensely proud of all that we have accomplished at Qualcomm," Mollenkopf said.

news_headline: Cyber crimes causing increased bilateral trade disputes: MEA
news_article: The Ministry of External Affairs has warned the Commerce Ministry of the increasing cyber crimes against Indian exporters which are causing increased bilateral trade disputes. The authorities cannot do much to reverse the transaction, the Directorate General of Foreign Trade (DGFT) said. The victims end up being Indian exporters who have neither the goods nor the payment, it added.

news_headline: Xiaomi accepts faulty update that bricked many Mi A3 devices
news_article: Chinese smartphone manufacturer Xiaomi on Tuesday said it was aware of the faulty, recently released Android 11 update that bricked several Mi A3 devices. The company has since halted the rollout of the update. Xiaomi added that users would be provided with a free solution regardless of whether the smartphone model is within warranty or not.

news_headline: Instagram tests carousel-like setup for Stories on desktop
news_article: Instagram is testing a new design for Stories on its website which features a carousel-like setup rather than one single tile per story. Users will still be able to navigate through the Stories by manually clicking through them or letting them play automatically. Instagram had released the layout to a "small group" of users last month.

news_headline: Russia likely behind government agency hack: US intel agencies
news_article: US intelligence and law enforcement agencies said the recent hack of government departments and corporations was "likely Russian in origin". They added that the purpose of the hacks was "intelligence gathering" rather than an attempt to disrupt or damage government operations. Earlier, President Donald Trump had blamed China for the data breach which reportedly infiltrated thousands of US firms.

news_headline: Alipay, WeChat Pay, 6 other Chinese apps banned in US
news_article: US President Donald Trump has signed an executive order banning transactions with eight Chinese apps, including Ant Group's Alipay and WeChat Pay. The order states that data collected by these apps could be used by China to track the locations of federal employees and contractors. US must take "aggressive action" against these app developers to protect national security, it added.

news_headline: Govt working on PLI scheme for AI, IoT, VR devices, drones: Report
news_article: The government is reportedly working on a Production Linked Incentive (PLI)-like scheme for new technology devices such as drones and devices based on artificial intelligence (AI), virtual/augmented reality (VR/AR) and Internet of Things (IoT), reported The Economic Times. The scheme will aim to boost domestic production, similar to the phone components PLI scheme unveiled recently.

news_headline: Team India's playing XI for 3rd Test against Australia announced
news_article: The BCCI on Wednesday announced Team India's playing XI for the third Test against Australia which will take place in Sydney from tomorrow. Rohit Sharma has replaced Mayank Agarwal in the side and will open alongside Shubman Gill. Further, Navdeep Saini has been included in the side as the third fast bowler.

news_headline: Australian baby store issues clarification over Kohli, Pandya's 'bio-bubble breach'
news_article: After Virat Kohli and Hardik Pandya were accused of breaching bio-bubble after being spotted without masks at a baby store in Sydney, the store's owner Nathan Pongrass has issued a clarification. "At that stage, there were no restrictions in New South Wales...[Despite that] our staff was not allowed to touch them and shake hands with them," he said.

news_headline: Top-ranked sumo wrestler Hakuho tests COVID-19 +ve after losing sense of smell
news_article: Hakuho, a top-ranked sumo wrestler, has tested positive for the coronavirus, officials in Japan said. The Japan Sumo Association (JSA) announced on Tuesday that the fighter had a PCR test after noticing problems with his sense of smell. This comes on the day Japan announced a record 4,670 new coronavirus cases.

news_headline: Footballer's ₹3-crore Lamborghini damaged after accident in UK, pic surfaces
news_article: Sheffield United's French striker Lys Mousset's £300,000 (₹3-crore) orange Lamborghini was damaged after it collided into parked cars on Abbeydale Road South. A picture of the wrecked car emerged online, after which Sheffield United said that they are making internal inquiries. South Yorkshire Police have confirmed that two men in their 20s were arrested on suspicion of drunk driving.

news_headline: 'Wine & dine with Team India' scam busted in Australia, fans cheated of over ₹60 lakh
news_article: A fraudster cheated fans of over ₹60 lakh after promising them a fake 'wine and dine with Team India' at a Sydney restaurant. The fraudster had left flyers on cars parked at Sydney Cricket Ground during the last ODI and promoted the event, saying it's scheduled for January 5. The restaurant said that the fraudster conned them by missing meetings.

news_headline: Kohli invested in gaming platform which became Team India's kit sponsor
news_article: Captain Virat Kohli invested in online gaming platform Mobile Premier League (MPL) in February 2019 which became the Indian cricket team's official kit sponsor and merchandise partner in November last year. Kohli was allotted Compulsory Convertible Debentures (CCDs) for ₹33.32 lakh in Galactus Funware Technology, which owns MPL, according to records accessed by The Indian Express.

news_headline: Latest Test rankings out, NZ become number one team for the first time in history
news_article: The ICC released the latest Test rankings after New Zealand defeated Pakistan by an innings and 176 runs in the second Test to register a 2-0 series whitewash. New Zealand have displaced Australia from the top of the rankings to become the top-ranked team for the first time in history. New Zealand have now won six consecutive Test matches.

news_headline: No confinement to hotel rooms: Cricket Australia on Sydney, Brisbane bubble rules
news_article: Amid the controversy over alleged breach of bio-bubble rules by some Indian cricketers in Melbourne, Cricket Australia has issued a clarification on the bio-bubble protocols in Sydney and Brisbane. It said that the players would not be bound to their respective hotel rooms. The players would be allowed to use the entire hotel's facility and the training grounds.

news_headline: Wasim Jaffer shares 'hidden message' for keeper Pant ahead of 3rd Test, post viral
news_article: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter to share a 'hidden message' for Team India wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant ahead of the third Test against Australia. Sharing a collage of four pictures, Jaffer wrote, "Easy one for you...Pant #decode...Cc: @ashwinravi99 @imjadeja." Decoding the message, a fan tweeted, "Pant should sing Butta Bomma when Ashwin and Jadeja are bowling and stump Warner."

news_headline: Get a life: Dodda Ganesh to trolls for linking Ganguly's heart attack with oil ad
news_article: Ex-India cricketer Dodda Ganesh has criticised trolls for linking Sourav Ganguly's heart attack with a refined oil advertisement the BCCI President had done. "No cooking oil can guarantee you...good healthy heart. People who're using Ganguly's present medical condition to take the mickey out of him and drawing pleasure...need to get a life...Heart attack can happen to anyone. Period," he tweeted.

news_headline: Ganguly can run a marathon, fly a plane or even get back to cricket: Doctor
news_article: Cardiac surgeon Devi Shetty, who examined Sourav Ganguly at a hospital in Kolkata, has said that the BCCI President's heart has not suffered any damage after the mild cardiac arrest. Shetty added, "This event will not affect his lifestyle or lifespan. He can participate in a marathon, fly a plane, or even get back to cricket if he wants."

news_headline: How does the WTC points table read after NZ's 2-0 win over Pakistan?
news_article: New Zealand defeated Pakistan by an innings and 176 runs in the second Test to register a 2-0 whitewash in the two-match Test series. New Zealand have now accumulated 420 points from 11 matches and are third on the World Test Championship points table, with 70.0% points earned. Pakistan are sixth on the points table, with 30.7% points earned.

news_headline: Natarajan would add variety as a left-arm pacer: Gilchrist
news_article: Ex-Australia wicket-keeper Adam Gilchrist feels Natarajan should get the nod over Navdeep Saini for the Sydney Test since "he would add variety as a left-arm pacer" to the bowling line-up."[Natarajan] would also leave some handy footmarks for Ravichandran Ashwin to exploit," Gilchrist added. Natarajan was added to the Test squad after pacer Umesh Yadav injured himself during the second Test.

news_headline: Practice for an hour, no access to physios: Saina criticises BWF over restrictions
news_article: Indian shuttler Saina Nehwal criticised the Badminton World Federation (BWF) for restricting training time and denying access to physios despite testing negative for coronavirus in Thailand. "No Time for warm-ups/taping/cool downs/stretches...we are talking about the best players in the world competing isn't it?" she said. "We want to play...in good condition. Please sort this," she added.

news_headline: Fan, who attended Boxing Day Test at MCG, tests positive for COVID-19
news_article: The Melbourne Cricket Club (MCC) on Wednesday confirmed that a fan, who attended Day 2 of the Boxing Day Test between India and Australia, has tested positive for coronavirus. According to MCC, health department has recommended that spectators who were in Zone 5 in The Great Southern Stand on December 27, between 12:30 pm and 3:30 pm get themselves tested.

news_headline: Warner playing Sydney Test shows Australia's desperation: Deep Dasgupta
news_article: Former India cricketer Deep Dasgupta has said that if David Warner plays the Sydney Test, it'll show Australia's desperation and it'll be a great sign for Team India. "Warner has already mentioned that he can't lunge...it will be comparatively easier for bowlers to plan against him," he added. Warner had suffered a groin injury during the second ODI against India.

news_headline: Pakistan playing school-level cricket due to PCB's policies: Shoaib Akhtar
news_article: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar criticised Pakistan team for playing "school-level cricket" in the Test series against New Zealand. He blamed Pakistan Cricket Board's (PCB) policies for the situation. "They (PCB) keep bringing in average players...they keep making average teams...leading to average results," he said in a video. "Whenever Pakistan will play Tests, they will be exposed," he added.

news_headline: Ganguly will continue to be our brand ambassador: Adani Wilmar Dy CEO on Fortune oil ads
news_article: After Adani Wilmar removed all ads of its Fortune Rice Bran cooking oil featuring Sourav Ganguly across platforms, its Deputy CEO Angshu Mallick said that a "temporary break" has been taken and Ganguly will continue to be their brand ambassador. Social media users had trolled the ad campaign for promoting heart health after Ganguly suffered a mild cardiac arrest.

news_headline: Pele updates Instagram bio to claim Ronaldo hasn't broken his record
news_article: After Cristiano Ronaldo went past Pele in the list of most official goals on Sunday, the ex-Brazil footballer updated his Instagram bio to dispute the record. In his updated bio, Pele added 'Leading Goal Scorer of All Time', claiming he has scored 1,283 goals in total. Officially, however, Ronaldo (758) is in the second spot while Pele (757) is third.

news_headline: Even a school won't give Misbah a coaching job: Ex-Pak pacer Aaqib
news_article: Former Pakistan pacer Aaqib Javed, who is currently the head coach of the Lahore Qalandars, has said that Pakistan head coach Misbah-ul-Haq and bowling coach Waqar Younis were given the roles with the national side even without having prior coaching experience. "Looking at Misbah's coaching, I don't think even a school will give him this job," he added.

news_headline: Sourav Ganguly wants to stay back for another day: Hospital
news_article: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly, who is fit now and was scheduled to be discharged today from the hospital, will now be discharged on Thursday since he wants to stay back one more day, the hospital said. The former India captain underwent an angioplasty on January 2 after he was admitted to the hospital due to discomfort in his chest.

news_headline: Not annoyed but with life normal outside quarantine is challenging: Rahane
news_article: India captain Ajinkya Rahane said the team is "not annoyed" with strict quarantine rules but it's "challenging" since life seems to be "normal" outside their Sydney hotel. "We know that life in Sydney is normal but players are stuck in their rooms which is okay. We know how to handle it...we are prepared for any kind of situation," Rahane said.

news_headline: Saini's extra pace makes him a better choice at Sydney: Nehra
news_article: Ex-India pacer Ashish Nehra said that Navdeep Saini should be Team India's first choice for the third pacer's slot in Sydney. "Saini was first choice and Shardul Thakur and T Natarajan both came in as replacements," Nehra stated, adding that Saini's extra pace and "mean bouncer" also makes him more suited to play Sydney Test.

news_headline: Ex-Pak women's captain Sana Mir tests +ve for COVID-19
news_article: Ex-Pakistan women's captain Sana Mir tested positive for coronavirus while being part of the PCB commentary box for the Quaid-e-Azam trophy final in Karachi, which ended in a tie on Tuesday. Mir had shown symptoms of fever on Day 3 of the match and was then isolated in a hotel. PCB clarified there was no contact between broadcasters and players.

news_headline: Umpire's Call not ideal but it doesn't bother me: Tim Paine
news_article: Australia Test captain Tim Paine said the provision of Umpire's Call in the Decision Review System (DRS) isn't ideal but his team is okay with it. "It doesn't bother me to be honest, there is so much talk about it whether we like it or we don't. It's irrelevant...while it's there, teams are going to use it," said Paine.

news_headline: Czechs wave empty beer mugs to protest against COVID-19 lockdown
news_article: Hundreds of people gathered in Prague, Czech Republic to protest against the closing of pubs in the country following the COVID-19 lockdown. The Czech Republic re-imposed COVID-19 measures ahead of Christmas due to a surge in infections. Protestors lit candles inside beer glasses and set them in a line stretching about a kilometre from the city centre to government buildings.

news_headline: China blocks entry to WHO team studying origins of coronavirus
news_article: China has blocked the arrival of a team of investigators from the World Health Organization who are researching the origins of the coronavirus, claiming that their visas had not yet been approved. Two scientists had already left their home countries for Wuhan. One of them was sent back home, while the other was remaining in a third country in transit.

news_headline: China used 'unorthodox weapons' along LAC in Ladakh: Defence Ministry
news_article: China used "unorthodox weapons" and amassed a large number of troops along the LAC in eastern Ladakh, the Defence Ministry has stated in its year-end review of 2020. "India categorically conveyed to China that any attempt to unilaterally alter the status quo... is unacceptable and that India is determined to protect its sovereignty and territorial integrity," the review added.

news_headline: Drunk man refuses to wear mask, taxi driver takes him directly to police station
news_article: A taxi driver in Canada took a drunk passenger directly to the police station after he refused to wear a face mask or follow COVID-19 safety measures. The drunk passenger repeatedly tried to touch the taxi driver's face. The man, who at first refused to leave the cab, was taken into custody and fined nearly C$700 (over ₹40,000).

news_headline: Gulf states sign 'solidarity and stability' deal to ease 3-year crisis
news_article: The Gulf countries signed a "solidarity and stability" agreement aimed at easing the three-year-old dispute with Qatar during an annual Gulf Cooperation Council summit, Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed Bin Salman said. There is a need for Gulf countries to unite to confront Iran, he added. Saudi Arabia, Egypt, Bahrain and the UAE had imposed an embargo on Qatar in 2017.

news_headline: Ad showing man eating bat sandwich being investigated in Australia
news_article: An advertisement that shows a man eating a bat sandwich is being investigated by Ad Standards, Australia's advertising watchdog. Released by outdoor equipment retailer, Boating Camping Fishing store (BCF), a man in the ad jokes that the COVID-19 pandemic was caused by someone eating a bat. The ad, uploaded in December on YouTube, has been viewed nearly 2.6 lakh times.

news_headline: Chinese state news agency calls for shorter work hours in tech companies
news_article: State-affiliated Chinese press agency Xinhua News Agency has called for shorter working hours in the country's tech companies following the death of an employee at an e-commerce firm. Workers' legitimate rights and interests should not be sacrificed and employers may be breaking the law in encouraging health-sapping overwork, it said. The employee had collapsed while walking home from work.

news_headline: UK COVID-19 variant detected in 41 countries/territories: WHO
news_article: World Health Organization has said that the new coronavirus variant that emerged in the UK has been detected in 41 countries/territories so far. UK identified the new COVID-19 variant that it said is 70% more transmissible on December 14 last year. Several countries have suspended travel from Britain in a bid to contain the spread of the new strain.

news_headline: Efforts against COVID-19 enter 'wartime mode' in China's Hebei
news_article: The efforts to contain the spread of coronavirus in China's Hebei province have entered "wartime mode", official media reported on Tuesday. The province has reported 19 local infections and 40 asymptomatic cases between January 2 and 4, according to official data. These are the first coronavirus cases that the province has reported since June.

news_headline: US could soon administer 1 mn COVID-19 vaccines per day: Fauci
news_article: America's top infectious disease expert Anthony Fauci said US could soon be administering at least a million COVID-19 vaccines per day. "Any time you start a big program, there's always glitches. I think the glitches have been worked out," he added. Fauci called President-elect Joe Biden's plan to vaccinate 100 million Americans in his first 100 days an "achievable goal".

news_headline: Disappointed China hasn't granted entry to COVID-19 probe team: WHO
news_article: WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said he was very disappointed that China hasn't still granted permission to international experts to visit Wuhan to probe COVID-19 origin. He added that WHO officials are already on their way to China and that agency is "eager to get the mission underway". Tedros further said that China has assured speeding up of internal procedure.

news_headline: Pence told Trump he lacks power to challenge election results: NYT
news_article: US Vice President Mike Pence has told President Donald Trump that he doesn't have the power to block congressional certification of President-elect Joe Biden's victory in the election, The New York Times reported. This comes after Trump claimed that Pence "has the power to reject fraudulently chosen electors". Pence will preside over a joint session of Congress on Wednesday.

news_headline: Iran tests domestically produced drones in military exercises: Report
news_article: Iran launched military exercises featuring a number of domestically produced drones. Its armed forces are to test combat drones used as bombers, interceptors and in reconnaissance missions in the two-day exercises in central Semnan province, Fars news agency reported. Iran has also resumed 20% uranium enrichment at an underground nuclear facility.

news_headline: Russia likely behind government agency hack: US intel agencies
news_article: US intelligence and law enforcement agencies said the recent hack of government departments and corporations was "likely Russian in origin". They added that the purpose of the hacks was "intelligence gathering" rather than an attempt to disrupt or damage government operations. Earlier, President Donald Trump had blamed China for the data breach which reportedly infiltrated thousands of US firms.

news_headline: There are frictions and frustrations on Indo-US trade front: Envoy
news_article: In his farewell speech, outgoing US Ambassador to India Kenneth Juster said that there are "frictions and frustrations" on the trade and investment front between the two countries. "Despite persistent efforts, we were unable to conclude even a small trade package," he added. "Moreover, there are growing restrictions in India on...access for certain US goods and services," he further said.

news_headline: White police officer who shot Blake won't face charges: US prosecutors
news_article: Prosecutors in the US state of Wisconsin said that they would not charge white police officer Rusten Sheskey who shot African-American man Jacob Blake in August last year. Kenosha County District Attorney Michael Graveley said that prosecutors determined that Sheskey acted in self-defence. Blake was left paralysed from the waist down after being shot seven times in the back.

news_headline: South Korea is holding $7 bn in Iranian funds hostage: Iran
news_article: Denying that it's holding a South Korean ship and its crew as hostages, Iran said, "[South] Korea's government...is holding $7 billion, which belongs to us, hostage on baseless grounds." The Iranian funds have been frozen in South Korean banks due to US sanctions. South Korea said that it would send a delegation to Iran to try to free the ship.

news_headline: Action within 72 hrs for derogatory remarks against army: Pak
news_article: Pakistan's Interior Minister Sheikh Rashid Ahmed has said action would be initiated within 72 hours against anyone found using derogatory language against the Pakistan Army. Ahmed's remark came after Pakistan Democratic Movement (PDM) chief blamed the army for the country's "political and economic crises". The PDM has alleged the army installed PM Imran Khan through a manipulated election in 2018.

news_headline: Ex-Republican US President Bush to attend Biden's inauguration
news_article: Former Republican US President George W Bush will attend the inauguration of President-elect Joe Biden and Vice President-elect Kamala Harris on January 20, his chief of staff said. Bush had also attended Barack Obama and Donald Trump's inaugurations. However, It's unclear if President Donald Trump, who is refusing to concede defeat in the presidential election, will attend the inauguration.

news_headline: Brazil is broke, I cannot do anything: President Bolsonaro
news_article: Responding to supporters asking for economic relief, Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro said, "Brazil is broke...I cannot do anything". "I wanted to modify the tax reduction table, but there was that press-fueled virus that we've there, that press without any character," he added. Bolsonaro has blamed country's economic collapse on lockdown measures pushed by state governors to combat COVID-19.

news_headline: Pak's Hazara block highway to protest killing of 11 coal miners
news_article: Members of Pakistan's Shia Hazara community have continued to block a highway for the third day in Quetta to protest the killing of 11 coal miners from the community. The protesters have refused to bury the victims, whose bodies are being kept at the sit-in, until the killers are brought to justice. The Islamic State claimed responsibility for Sunday's attack.

news_headline: Over ₹101 cr lottery prize goes unclaimed in Germany
news_article: A lottery winner has failed to collect €11.3 million (over ₹101 crore) in prize money by its deadline on December 31, 2020. The winning ticket was announced on April 1, 2017. "Even after a long search, we still sincerely wish we could have been able to pay out the lucky fellow," Georg Wacker, managing director of state-owned Lotto Baden-Württemberg, said.

news_headline: Over 50 HK activists arrested under national security law: Reports
news_article: Over 50 Hong Kong pro-democracy activists were arrested on Wednesday on suspicion of breaching city's new national security law, media reported. The Democratic Party said the arrests were related to an independently organised vote to elect democratic candidates for a legislative election last year. Hong Kong government, China had warned at the time that it would violate the new law.

news_headline: S Korea sends delegation to Iran to seek release of seized tanker: Reports
news_article: South Korea is sending a delegation on Wednesday to Iran to try and negotiate the release of its chemical tanker and detained crew, Yonhap news agency reported. Iran had seized the tanker on Monday after alleging that it was polluting the Gulf waters. The seizure comes amid tensions over Iranian funds frozen in South Korean banks because of US sanctions.

news_headline: Georgia votes in runoff elections to decide US Senate control
news_article: Voters in Georgia state began voting in two Senate runoffs on Tuesday that would determine whether Democrats or Republicans would control the US Senate. Democrats need to win both races to gain Senate control from Republicans. The runoff elections became necessary when no candidate secured over 50% of the votes in November, which is compulsory under state law.

news_headline: Won't get COVID-19 vaccine now, priority groups must be vaccinated first: MP CM
news_article: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Monday said that he has decided not to get vaccinated against COVID-19 for now, as the first shots should be administered to the priority groups. He said, "My turn should come afterwards, we have to work to ensure that priority groups are administered with the vaccine."

news_headline: PM Modi inaugurates 450-km Kochi-Mangaluru natural gas pipeline
news_article: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday inaugurated a natural gas pipeline from Kerala's Kochi to Mangaluru in Karnataka's Dakshina Kannada district via video conference. PM Modi said, "It is an honour to dedicate the 450-km pipeline to the nation. This is an important day for India, especially for people of Karnataka and Kerala."

news_headline: TMC MLA Laxmi Ratan Shukla resigns as West Bengal Minister
news_article: TMC MLA and former cricketer Laxmi Ratan Shukla has resigned as the Minister of State for Sports and Youth Services in West Bengal. He has also resigned as the Howrah district president of the party. "He wrote in his resignation letter that he wants to give more time to sports and will continue as an MLA," CM Mamata Banerjee said.

news_headline: Who will get vaccine with question marks on reliability: Manish Tewari
news_article: Congress leader Manish Tewari on Tuesday said the Centre has "politically misused" the COVID-19 pandemic. Without naming the vaccine, Tewari said, "In their quest to prove their 'Atmanirbhar Bharat' they have licensed a vaccine whose phase 3 trials are not complete." He added, "Who is going to get himself vaccinated with a vaccine that has question marks on its reliability?"

news_headline: Reminded of Jallianwala tragedy: Chadha as farmers tear-gassed in Rewari
news_article: AAP MLA and national spokesperson Raghav Chadha on Monday compared Haryana CM ML Khattar to British General Reginald Dyer. This came after Haryana Police fired tear gas canisters on a group of marching protesters in Rewari on Sunday. "I was reminded of April 1919, when General Dyer ordered opening fire on innocent people who congregated at Jallianwala Bagh," said Chadha.

news_headline: PM inaugurates National Atomic Timescale and Bhartiya Nirdeshak Dravya
news_article: PM Narendra Modi on Monday inaugurated National Atomic Timescale and Bhartiya Nirdeshak Dravya via video conferencing and dedicated them to the nation. The National Atomic Timescale generates Indian Standard Time with an accuracy of 2.8 nanoseconds. Bhartiya Nirdeshak Dravya supports testing and calibration of laboratories for quality assurance at par with international standards, said the PMO.

news_headline: BJP MP Pragya Thakur appears in court in Malegaon blast case
news_article: BJP MP Pragya Thakur, one of the seven accused in the 2008 Malegaon blast case, on Monday appeared before the special court of the National Investigation Agency (NIA) in Mumbai. The court, however, adjourned the hearing for Tuesday and asked her to be present in court whenever required after she sought exemption from daily appearance on health and security grounds.

news_headline: WB CM Mamata stands in line to collect health scheme card, pics surface
news_article: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday stood in a queue along with other locals to collect her ‘Swasthya Sathi’ smart card from a distribution centre in Kolkata. Banerjee had earlier urged ministers of her government to collect the card. The scheme provides health cover of up to ₹5 lakh per annum to a family for secondary and tertiary care.

news_headline: Shoes hurled at Vijayvargiya, Mukul Roy's vehicles during BJP roadshow
news_article: Shoes were hurled at the vehicles of BJP leaders Kailash Vijayvargiya and Mukul Roy on Monday when they had gone for a roadshow in Kolkata's Watganj area. The roadshow had to be shortened after police denied permission for it. "Some TMC workers hurled shoes and stones at us. Our workers showed restraint," Vijayvargiya claimed.

news_headline: PM Modi should take first shot of COVID-19 vaccine: Bihar Cong leader
news_article: Bihar's Congress leader Ajeet Sharma has said PM Narendra Modi should take the first shot of COVID-19 vaccine. Sharma said heads of state in Russia and America took the first shots of the vaccine to remove people's doubts. He added PM Modi and the senior-most BJP leader should "win the trust of the people" by taking the first vaccine shots.

news_headline: Odisha Minister Pratap Jena among 13 booked for murder of BJP leader, aide
news_article: The Odisha police has registered a case against 13 people, including state Law Minister Pratap Jena, after 75-year-old BJP leader Kulamani Baral and his associate were hacked to death in Cuttack district. The case was registered on the basis of a complaint by Baral's son, who alleged that his father was killed at the behest of Jena.

news_headline: Stand-up comedian Munawar Faruqui's arrest shames us all: Tharoor
news_article: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has said the arrest of stand-up comedian Munawar Faruqui "shames us all". Tharoor tweeted, "As a democracy; as a country mature enough to enjoy a laugh; as a society that does not discriminate...In none of these categories can we hold our head high." Faruqui and four others were arrested for allegedly insulting Hindu deities in Indore.

news_headline: Sourav Ganguly was under 'pressure' to join politics: CPI(M) leader
news_article: Senior CPI(M) leader Asok Narayan Bhattacharya has said some people "wanted to use [BCCI President] Sourav Ganguly politically", which "probably exerted pressure on him". "He should be known as Sourav the sporting icon," Bhattacharya, who is Ganguly's longtime family friend, further said. "I had told Sourav last week he shouldn't join politics and he didn't oppose my views," he added.

news_headline: Uttarakhand BJP chief calls 79-yr-old Cong leader 'budhiya', criticised
news_article: Uttarakhand BJP chief Bansidhar Bhagat has received criticism from several Congress members after he called 79-year-old Congress leader Indira Hridayesh a "budhiya" (old woman). Bhagat, who was responding to Hridayesh's claims that several BJP workers were in touch with the Congress, had said, "Why would they contact you, old woman? What would one want to do with a sinking ship?"

news_headline: AAP to contest all seats in upcoming Gujarat local body elections
news_article: AAP on Sunday said that it will contest all seats in Gujarat's upcoming local body elections. AAP MLA Atishi released the first list of 504 candidates for the elections, likely to be held in February. "Not just the local bodies' polls, but AAP will also contest the Vidhan Sabha elections in Gujarat as well as other polls," she said.

news_headline: My supporters will never allow Stalin to become TN CM: MK Alagiri
news_article: Former DMK leader MK Alagiri said incumbent DMK chief and his younger brother MK Stalin can "never become Tamil Nadu's Chief Minister". "My supporters won't allow you," Alagiri, who was expelled from DMK seven years before over alleged anti-party activities, added. He further said, "I can't tell if I'm starting a party or not...and whether it'll be soon or later."

news_headline: TDP leader murdered in Andhra Pradesh, 2nd such killing in a week
news_article: Telugu Desam Party (TDP) leader Puramsetti Ankulu was allegedly murdered in Andhra Pradesh's Guntur district on Sunday night. His body was found at an under-construction apartment complex. A TDP leader alleged that it was a "cold-blooded murder" by Yuvajana Sramika Rythu Congress (YSRC) party. Another TDP leader Nandam Subbaiah was killed in Proddatur last week.

news_headline: Former Maharashtra minister Vilas Patil Undalkar dies at 82
news_article: Maharashtra's former minister Vilas Patil Undalkar passed away aged 82 in Satara on Monday. He reportedly died after following a brief illness. Popularly known as kaka, Undalkar won from Karad South Assembly seat seven times till 2014. Ajit Pawar said that Undalkar will be remembered for his "vital contribution to the development of rural Maharashtra".

news_headline: Shiv Sena leader survives after being shot at in Mumbai
news_article: Shiv Sena's shakha pramukh from Mumbai's Bhiwandi, Deepak Mhatre, was shot at by bike-borne assailants on Saturday night. Mhatre, shot outside his residence, has survived the attack. The police said, "There is suspicion that the attack may be linked to the upcoming gram panchayat elections in the area as Mhatre is one of the hopeful aspirants in the race."

news_headline: Bill to terminate Pak as major non-NATO ally introduced in US Cong
news_article: Republican Congressman Andy Biggs has introduced a bill in the US Congress to terminate Pakistan's designation as a major non-NATO ally. The status allows benefits like access to excess US defence supplies and participation in defence research and development projects. Pakistan was named a major non-NATO during the Bush Administration in 2004.

news_headline: BJP leader Krishnendu Mukherjee's car shot at in Bengal's Asansol
news_article: Bengal BJP leader Krishnendu Mukherjee's car was allegedly shot at while he was returning from Kolkata to Asansol. "Three unidentified persons, suspected to be TMC goons, stopped my car near my house and tried to open doors. When they failed to do it, they opened fire," Mukherjee said. However, TMC said the incident might be fallout of Mukherjee's old rivalries.

news_headline: Modi govt's apathy, arrogance has claimed lives of 60 farmers: Rahul
news_article: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said that Modi government's apathy and arrogance have claimed lives of over 60 farmers. "Instead of wiping their tears, GOI is busy attacking them with tear gas," Rahul said. He added, "Such brutality, just to promote crony capitalists' business interests. Repeal the anti-farm laws."

news_headline: Baseless and false: Owaisi on TMC calling AIMIM 'B-team of BJP'
news_article: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi slammed Trinamool Congress (TMC) for calling his party the "B-team of BJP", and said such accusations are "baseless and false". Speaking to the media after meeting a prominent Muslim cleric in West Bengal, he added, "We did not contest the Lok Sabha elections in 2019. Then how come BJP won 18 seats in Bengal?"

news_headline: I appeal to Centre to accept all demands of farmers: Delhi CM
news_article: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said, "I appeal to the Centre to accept all...demands of the farmers and repeal the three black farm laws." "Salute to the resolve of the farmers staying firm on the roads despite rains and cold," he added. The seventh round of talks between the Centre and farmers' representatives took place on Monday.

news_headline: Farmers' protest fight between langar & lathi: Congress' Shergill
news_article: Describing the BJP as "an agent of the East India Company," Congress leader Jaiveer Shergill on Monday said the ongoing farmers' agitation is a "fight between the langar and the lathi." Shergill urged the Centre to repeal the three "black" farm laws, and added, "The BJP is anti-farmer, tyrannical, dictatorial and its brutal face has been exposed."

news_headline: Designer Swapnil Shinde comes out as transwoman, changes name to Saisha
news_article: Designer Swapnil Shinde took to Instagram to share pictures after coming out as a transwoman. "I [believed] I was attracted to men because I was gay, but it was...six years ago that I finally accepted to myself, and today...I accept to you. I'm not a gay man. I'm a Transwoman," a post read. The designer also changed name to 'Saisha'.

news_headline: Hilary Duff says her eye started to look weird due to COVID-19 tests, shares pics
news_article: American actress Hilary Duff took to Instagram Stories to reveal that she developed a painful eye infection from taking too many coronavirus tests while working. Sharing pictures, Duff wrote, "My eye started to look weird...and hurt...a lot. So...took a little trip to the emergency room." She added that she had to take antibiotics for treatment.

news_headline: Twitter user claiming to be doctor calls Madhavan alcoholic, addict; actor responds
news_article: A Twitter user claiming to be a doctor took a dig at actor R Madhavan, saying it's disheartening to see Madhavan "ruining his brilliant career, health and life over alcohol and drugs". The user added Madhavan's face and eyes indicate he's an addict. Madhavan replied, "So that’s your diagnosis? I'm worried for your patients. Maybe you need doctor's appointment."

news_headline: Doctor's open letter goes viral after TN govt allows 100% capacity in theatres
news_article: A doctor's open letter addressed to Tamil Nadu government and actors Vijay and Simbu has gone viral after the state allowed 100% capacity in theatres. "The pandemic isn’t over and we've people dying till today to the disease. A 100% theatre occupancy is a suicide attempt," he wrote. He added, "This is a blatant barter system, trading lives for money."

news_headline: 'Bond Girl' Tanya Roberts dies aged 65 a day after being wrongly declared dead
news_article: Actress Tanya Roberts, who starred in the James Bond film 'A View to a Kill', died aged 65. Roberts' representative on Tuesday confirmed to Variety that she died on Monday night due to a urinary tract infection that spread to her kidney, gallbladder, liver and blood stream. Pingel, however, had mistakenly told outlets the actress had passed away on Sunday.

news_headline: 3-month-old baby of actress who featured in 'Harry Potter' films contracts COVID-19
news_article: English actress Jessie Cave's three-month-old baby has tested positive for coronavirus and is receiving treatment in a UK hospital. "This strain is super powerful and contagious so I do hope that people take extra care in the coming weeks," she wrote on Instagram as she shared a picture from the hospital. Cave played Lavender Brown in the 'Harry Potter' franchise.

news_headline: Kim preparing to divorce Kanye West, report says 'She has had enough'
news_article: Reality TV personality Kim Kardashian is preparing to file for divorce from her husband, rapper Kanye West, according to reports. "He knows that she's done. She has had enough, and she told him that she wants some space to figure out her future," wrote People while quoting a source. Kim and Kanye got married in 2014 and have four children.

news_headline: I like women's bodies but not their brains: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma
news_article: On being asked about his statement to actress Suchitra Krishnamoorthi when he had said 'I like women's bodies but not their brains', filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma commented that he still maintains his stance. "Brain does not have a gender...sexual aspect is very...specific," he added. "A woman has an extra thing which is her sensuality...which I admire," Varma further said.

news_headline: Idea to remake 'Biwi No 1' in my mind but not at the moment: David
news_article: Director David Dhawan has said that the idea to remake 'Biwi No 1' is there in his mind but "not at the moment". He said, "It's too early... I need a little rest. These kids are doing their job now and my wife needs me more than anyone for some time. Maybe I'll come up with something original."

news_headline: It was like being home again: Pine on working in Wonder Woman 1984
news_article: Chris Pine, who reprised his role of Steve Trevor in 'Wonder Woman 1984', shared his experience of working on the sets of the film and said, "It was like being home again, going to work with people you really like." Talking about working with Gal Gadot, he said, "Gal is...very open being; that smile of hers just lights up [a]...room."

news_headline: Arjun Rampal's sister summoned by NCB, set to appear before agency today
news_article: Arjun Rampal's sister Komal Rampal has been summoned by Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) in Mumbai at 11 am on Wednesday. Notably, this comes after the NCB questioned Arjun and his partner Gabriella Demetriades as part of an investigation in relation to alleged drug links in Bollywood. "I have never been on the wrong side of the law," Arjun had said.

news_headline: 63rd Grammy Awards postponed to March 14 amid rising COVID-19 cases
news_article: The 63rd Annual Grammy Awards has been rescheduled to March 14 amid rising COVID-19 cases in Los Angeles, the Recording Academy said. "The deteriorating COVID-19 situation...with hospital services being overwhelmed...have all led us to conclude that postponing our show was the right thing to do," it added. Grammy Awards was earlier scheduled to be broadcast on January 31.

news_headline: Warner Bros didn't even want to read my script: 'Wonder Woman' director
news_article: 'Wonder Woman 1984' director Patty Jenkins said that Warner Bros Pictures didn't even want to read her script in 2004. "They wanted to hire me as a beard...wanted me to walk around on set as a woman, but it was their...vision," she added. "The was an internal war on every level about what 'Wonder Woman' should be," Patty further said.

news_headline: Rapper Dr Dre hospitalised after reportedly suffering from brain aneurysm
news_article: Rapper Dr Dre has been hospitalised with a possible brain aneurysm at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in Los Angeles, according to Deadline. The rapper-producer was reportedly rushed by ambulance to Cedars' ICU on Monday. Dre took to Instagram on Wednesday to share an update and wrote, "I'm...getting excellent care from my medical team. I'll be out of...hospital and back home soon."

news_headline: We saw too much pain, ugliness, hatred in 2020: Arjun Rampal
news_article: Actor Arjun Rampal, on being asked if 2020 was the worst year of our lives, said that a lot of "pain, ugliness, hatred, uncertainty and helplessness" were seen in the past year. He also mentioned that alongside these, "grace, love, nobility, generosity and humility" were experienced too. Rampal went ahead and praised Sonu Sood's efforts in the times of need.

news_headline: Actors from big families haven't made it, including Sohail: Wife on nepotism
news_article: Sohail Khan's wife, fashion designer Seema Khan, recently spoke about nepotism and said, "Talent has to speak." "We've actors in the industry, who've hailed from big families, who haven't made it, including my own husband," she added. "Nepotism doesn't mean you're going to make it. At the end of the day, you've to be sincere, keep trying," Seema further said.

news_headline: He was misunderstood: Dialogue writer on Saif's humanising Raavan comment
news_article: Manoj Muntashir, who has penned the dialogues and lyrics of 'Adipurush', has reacted to Saif Ali Khan's remark wherein he said the film will portray 'Raavan' in a "humane" manner. Manoj said Saif was misunderstood and there's nothing offensive in the film. "[Raavan] will be seen in all his shades...He'll be shown as...flamboyant king, who was also cruel," he added.

news_headline: Hoping 'Shamshera', 'Bell Bottom' will pull people into theatres: Vaani
news_article: Actress Vaani Kapoor, who'll be seen in films like 'Shamshera', 'Bell Bottom' and 'Chandigarh Kare Aashiqui' this year, has said she's hoping that these films will "pull people into theatres". "The industry has been heavily affected by the virus and we'll need to bring people back to the cinemas," she added. Vaani further said all three films are "extremely diverse".

news_headline: Playing Mr Bean is stressful and exhausting: Rowan Atkinson
news_article: Rowan Atkinson has said he finds playing Mr Bean "stressful and exhausting". The 65-year-old actor further said he doesn't enjoy playing the character anymore, adding, "The weight of responsibility isn't pleasant...I look forward to the end of it." Rowan, who's currently working on an animated Mr Bean movie, said it's easier for him to perform the character vocally than visually.

news_headline: Getting stereotyped on TV is no less than a nightmare: Aakanksha Singh
news_article: Actress Aakanksha Singh, who played the role of a mother in the show 'Na Bole Tum Na Maine Kuch Kaha', has said it's really difficult to break a certain image on television.  "Post that show, I was only getting similar characters...I still get such offers on TV. Getting stereotyped on TV is no less than a nightmare," Aakanksha added.

news_headline: Anubhav Sinha to produce Hansal Mehta's next film: Reports
news_article: Anubhav Sinha will reportedly produce Hansal Mehta's next film, which will also mark the first collaboration of the two filmmakers. The yet-to-be-titled film is being touted as a big-scale commercial thriller. Earlier, there were reports about the two joining hands for a pandemic anthology. Anubhav is currently working on his upcoming film 'Abhi Toh Party Shuru Hui Hai'.

news_headline: People targeted me more than CBFC: Pahlaj Nihalani on getting sacked
news_article: Commenting on getting sacked and replaced by Prasoon Joshi in 2017, former Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) chairman Pahlaj Nihalani said that people targeted him more than the board itself. "Why they are not targeting CBFC now?" Nihalani commented. "I had opposed obscenity, nudity...use of abusive language, but the same system and guideline are there," Nihalani added.

news_headline: Hina Khan wins Best Actress at Montgomery International Film Fest
news_article: Actress Hina Khan has won the Best Actress Award for her film 'Lines' at the Montgomery International Film Festival, USA. She posted a picture of Certificate of Achievement on Instagram and wrote, "This month I complete 12 years in the industry and I couldn't be more proud of myself as my film 'LINES' is getting an overwhelming response overseas."

news_headline: Haven't got this much recognition from any other project: Priyanshu on Mirzapur 2
news_article: Actor Priyanshu Painyuli, who played the role of Robin in 'Mirzapur 2', said, "What [the show] did for me is special." He added, "I haven't got this much recognition from any other project of mine." Priyanshu further said he never imagined that his character Robin and his dialogue 'Yeh Bhi Theek hai' will resonate so well with the audience.

news_headline: I feel I could have avoided some films at the beginning of my career: Tusshar
news_article: Tusshar Kapoor, on being asked if he regrets doing any film in his career, said that he doesn't regret and added, "But...there are some films I did in...beginning...which I feel I could have avoided." However, he added that "the not so good experiences" have taught him a lot. "You learn that this isn't something (you want to do)," Tusshar said.

news_headline: Tesla to start operations in India in early 2021, confirms Nitin Gadkari
news_article: Union Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari on Monday told The Indian Express that Elon Musk-led electric vehicle company Tesla will start operations in India in early 2021. He said Tesla will start operations first with sales and then maybe look at assembly and manufacturing. Some recent reports claimed that Tesla will launch Model 3 in India in June 2021.

news_headline: Honda Motorcycle offers voluntary retirement amid demand slowdown
news_article: Honda Motorcycle and Scooter India is offering voluntary retirement to employees amid slowing demand due to COVID-19, according to a letter. Employees who are above 40 years or have completed 10 years of service, as of January 31, 2021, are eligible for the scheme. The first 400 employees who opt for retirement would get an additional ₹5,00,000, the company said.

news_headline: Ford cancels plan to give control of India business to Mahindra & Mahindra
news_article: US carmaker Ford on Thursday said it is calling off its automotive joint venture with Mahindra and Mahindra due to the challenges caused by the pandemic. Under the deal, Ford was expected to transfer its local operations, including two factories, into a joint venture that would be majority-controlled by Mahindra. Ford said its independent operations in India will continue.

news_headline: Car designer Dilip Chhabria of DC Design arrested in case of alleged cheating
news_article: Renowned car designer Dilip Chhabria has been arrested in connection with an alleged cheating and forgery case, Mumbai Police said on Monday. Chhabria is the Founder of Indian design firm DC Design that makes concept cars and custom special order vehicles. One of his cars was also seized and Crime Branch said that there were more accused in the case.

news_headline: Bajaj Auto becomes world's most valuable two-wheeler company
news_article: Pune-based Bajaj Auto has said that it has become the world's most valuable two-wheeler company as its market capitalisation crossed ₹1 lakh crore. Bajaj Auto achieved this milestone as it celebrates the 75th year of its operations. Bajaj Auto on Monday reported an 11% increase in total sales at 3,72,532 units in December 2020.

news_headline: Why has Mumbai Police arrested car designer Dilip Chhabria of DC Design?
news_article: Mumbai Police revealed that car designer Dilip Chhabria, Founder of DC Design, has been arrested in DC Avanti car financing and forgery scam of at least ₹40 crore. Police said Chhabria was selling multiple cars with the same engine and chassis numbers. He's also accused of taking multiple loans on one car and then selling car to a third party.

news_headline: COVID-19 was black swan event for CV segment: Tata Motors
news_article: COVID-19 was a "black swan event" for commercial vehicle (CV) segment as it followed axle load norms, low freight demand and BS-VI impact, Girish Wagh, President, Tata Motors CV Business Unit, said. "It aggravated the slowdown the segment was already going through," he added. However, Wagh said, the company expects fourth quarter sales to outperform fourth quarter of last year.

news_headline: Tesla car navigates 576 km in Full Self-Driving with no human help in US
news_article: A Tesla driver made a six-hour-long journey from Los Angeles to San Jose, travelling almost 576 km, in the Full Self-Driving mode with almost no human interventions. The driver claimed that they refrained from steering the car, accelerating or braking, except to make one stop to charge the car. They took control once to avoid large debris on road.

news_headline: Mustang EV's roof doesn't come off: Ford EV head in apparent dig at Tesla
news_article: Ford's electric vehicles head (EV) Darren Palmer, in an apparent dig at Elon Musk's Tesla, said his company's electric car Mustang Mach-E's "roof doesn't come off when you wash it". He said its "doors fit properly, the plastics and other materials color-match and the bumpers don't fall off". Earlier, roofs of Tesla Model Y vehicles flew off on two instances.

news_headline: Tesla responsible for 2/3 of all my pain combined: Elon Musk
news_article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has tweeted, "Tesla is responsible for 2/3 of all the personal & professional pain in my life combined. But it was worth it." He added that at Tesla's start he thought it had "(optimistically) a 10% chance of surviving at all". Musk praised Tesla's team for producing and delivering nearly half a million cars in 2020.

news_headline: Tesla to start delivering its China-made Model Y SUVs this month
news_article: Tesla has started selling China-made Model Y SUV and will deliver them to customers this month. The starting price of a Model Y in China is now $52,028.16, according to its China website. Tesla recently launched its largest Supercharger station in China. The new station has 72 stalls of Tesla's V2 Supercharger, which can output 150 kW.

news_headline: Tesla opens its largest Supercharger station in Shanghai
news_article: Tesla has unveiled its largest Supercharger station in Shanghai, China, with 72 charging stalls. The electric vehicle (EV) manufacturer has defeated its own record of single-point EV super-charging station with 56 stalls that it opened in California in 2020. Tesla has also been expanding its network of service centres and is planning to add one centre every week in 2021.

news_headline: 7 Tesla EVs imported to Nepal in 2020
news_article: Around seven Tesla electric vehicles (EVs) were imported to Kathmandu, Nepal, in 2020, despite the fact that Tesla has not officially launched in the country yet. The vehicles were imported from South China EXIM by automobile dealers Shreema Distributors and ARETE International. Five Tesla cars have been sold so far, an official from ARETE International said.

news_headline: BMW to build quarter of million more EVs than planned between 2021-23
news_article: BMW is "significantly increasing" the number of EVs and plans to build "a quarter of a million more electric cars than originally planned" between 2021-2023, CEO Oliver Zipse said. BMW wants roughly every fifth car it sells to be powered by an electric engine by 2023, Zipse added. He also stressed the need to speed up charging infrastructure's expansion.

news_headline: Tesla beats 2020 delivery estimates, falls short of Musk's target
news_article: Tesla on Saturday reported 4,99,550 vehicle deliveries during 2020, bettering Wall Street estimates of 4,81,261 vehicles, according to Refinitiv data. However, annual deliveries fell slightly short of CEO Elon Musk’s target of 5,00,000. Musk had set the target before the COVID-19 pandemic struck, and maintained it even as its only US plant was forced to shut for several weeks.

news_headline: Tesla Full Self-Driving's safety to be above avg driver's in 2021: Musk
news_article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk tweeted he is confident Tesla's "Full Self-Driving will work at a safety level well above that of the average driver this year". He said this in response to a post talking about Musk being confident that Tesla will be able to achieve level five autonomy next year. Tesla recently released an update featuring in-car video games.

news_headline: Entertainment will be critical when cars drive themselves: Elon Musk
news_article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk, while discussing in-car gaming in autonomous vehicles, tweeted, "Entertainment will be critical when cars drive themselves." Tesla recently released an update that featured three new in-car video games. Musk said an online multiplayer version of one of the games will be added and asked people what Tesla should do with in-car gaming in an autonomous world.

news_headline: Tesla Model Y debuts as police patrol vehicle in New York
news_article: Tesla Model Y debuted as a police patrol car in New York. It is reportedly the first-ever Model Y to be equipped as a police vehicle worldwide. The Model Y will serve as the police car assigned to the Detective Division of police. It has been outfitted with lights, sirens and radio to aid the police in its activities.

news_headline: Tesla Model 3 deliveries to start in India by June: Report
news_article: Tesla will start delivering Model 3 Sedan in India by June next year, The Economic Times reported. The expected price of the electric sedan is about ₹55-60 lakh and its bookings will commence from next month. Earlier in October, Tesla CEO Elon Musk had confirmed Tesla's entry in India in 2021.

news_headline: Volkswagen shares first glimpse of mobile EV charging robot
news_article: Volkswagen has shared the first glimpse of the prototype of a fully autonomous mobile electric vehicle (EV) charging robot. The robot starts up by either using an app or through communication with the car itself and independently steers the vehicle to be charged. The robot is also capable of charging several vehicles at the same time.

news_headline: Fiat Chrysler to invest $250 million in India unit
news_article: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles (FCA) has said it will invest $250 million in India to launch four new sport-utility vehicles (SUVs) over the next two years, taking its total investment in the country to over $700 million. The company will produce and assemble the new SUVs at its car plant in Maharashtra, which it jointly owns with Tata Motors.

news_headline: Tesla signs five-year deal with Chinese company for lithium supply
news_article: China's Sichuan Yahua Industrial Group has signed a five-year deal with Tesla to supply battery-grade lithium hydroxide to the EV manufacturer. The total value of the contract was put at $630-880 million over 2021-25 in a filing to the Shenzhen Stock Exchange, Reuters reported. Ganfeng Lithium, one of the world's largest lithium producers, also supplies the commodity to Tesla.

news_headline: Tesla stock that gained 740% in 2020 gets divided price targets for 2021
news_article: JPMorgan analysts have rated Tesla stock "underweight" and given it a price target of $90 for 2021, an 87% drop from current levels. On the other hand, Goldman Sachs has a "neutral" rating for Tesla, with a 12-month price target of $780. Tesla opened at $84.90 on January 2, 2020, and gained 740% over the year to close above $700-mark.

news_headline: Tesla short sellers lost $38 bn in 2020 as shares surged 730%
news_article: Tesla short sellers lost over $38 billion in mark-to-market losses this year as the electric vehicle maker's shares surged over 730%, according to data from S3 Partners. The next-biggest loss for short sellers was on Apple at $7 billion. This "is the largest yearly mark-to-market loss I have ever seen," Ihor Dusaniwsky, Managing Director of S3 Partners said.

news_headline: Indian auto sector to see stronger growth in 2021: Nomura
news_article: Global brokerage firm Nomura expects India's auto industry to register stronger growth next year. The personal vehicle segment, however, will recover to pre-COVID-19 levels only in 2023-24, the brokerage said. The auto industry faced an unprecedented challenge owing to the pandemic during the first half of 2020-21, Automotive Component Manufacturers Association (ACMA) had said.

news_headline: Jeff Bezos names Blue Origin's landing ship after his mother
news_article: Jeff Bezos on Wednesday unveiled Blue Origin's latest landing ship and revealed that it has been named after his mother, Jacklyn Bezos. "New Glenn's first stage will come home to the Jacklyn after every flight," he wrote in an Instagram post. The 600-foot ship has been designed as a floating landing point for the first-stage booster of New Glenn rocket.

news_headline: India's highest meteorological centre opens in Leh at 3,500 m above sea level
news_article: Union Minister Harsh Vardhan on Tuesday inaugurated India's highest meteorological centre established at 3,500 m above sea level in Leh by the India Meteorological Department (IMD). It will provide specialised weather forecasts for traffic movement on highways, agriculture and defence personnel. After Itanagar in Arunachal Pradesh, the Leh centre is the second MC located in the Himalayas.

news_headline: Firework that lasted for 150 yrs: NASA on pic of super-massive star Eta Carinae
news_article: The official Instagram page of NASA has shared the picture of Eta Carinae, a doomed super-massive star 7,500 light-years away that went through a "Great Eruption" in the 1840s that made it the second-brightest visible star in the sky for over a decade. "Have you ever seen a slow-motion firework show that lasted...over 150 YEARS?" wrote NASA.

news_headline: NASA shares video of galaxies that 'appear to be locked in a cosmic dance'
news_article: The National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) has shared a video of two galaxies, NGC 3314A and NGC 3314B, in the constellation Hydra, saying, "The galaxies appear to be locked in a cosmic dance." "They're separated by tens of millions of light-years, with one closer to us than the other," NASA wrote.

news_headline: Doctors hear Mexican song while checking pulse in 65-year-old US man's feet
news_article: A 65-year-old US man, who had undergone hip-replacement surgery, visited a hospital after experiencing a fall and dislocating his hip. When doctors assessed pulse in his feet using a Doppler device, they heard a Mexican song playing through the device's speaker. Doctors assume that Doppler might've picked up a radio signal that was being received by the patient's prosthetic hips.

news_headline: Intact Ice Age-era woolly rhino discovered in Siberia
news_article: Paleontologists have found one of the best-preserved specimens of an Ice Age-era woolly rhino to date in Siberia. The rhino is believed to have lived in the late Pleistocene era, anywhere between 20,000 and 50,000 years ago. It was discovered with all its limbs, some of its organs including part of the intestines, its tusk and a lump of fat.

news_headline: 2011-2020 warmest decade on record: World Meteorological Org
news_article: The decade from 2011 to 2020 is the warmest recorded decade ever, according to the World Meteorological Organization (WMO). "This year is on track to be one of the three warmest on record and may even rival 2016 as the warmest on record. The six warmest years have all been since 2015," the WMO tweeted.

news_headline: NASA takes pic of 'Wolf Moon'; shares the story behind the name
news_article: NASA shared a picture of 'Wolf Moon', the 13th and final full Moon of 2020 that will be visible for about three days. NASA said the Algonquin tribes of what is now the northern and eastern US named it 'Wolf Moon' as packs of wolves howled hungrily outside villages in winter. Another name for it is 'Ice Moon', NASA said.

news_headline: Cancer drug outperforms remdesivir against COVID-19 virus: Study
news_article: Researchers said pralatrexate, a drug originally developed to treat lymphoma, has outperformed remdesivir drug against SARS-CoV-2 in lab settings. Haiping Zhang of the Shenzhen Institutes of Advanced Technology and others screened 1,906 existing drugs for their potential ability to inhibit replication of SARS-CoV-2. Pralatrexate and azithromycin successfully inhibited replication of the virus.

news_headline: Japanese university to develop wooden satellites to cut down space junk
news_article: Japan's Kyoto University is teaming up with Japanese forestry company Sumitomo to develop wooden satellites to shoot into orbit by 2023 in a bid to cut down on space junk. Kyoto University professor and astronaut Takao Doi said wooden satellites, while burning on re-entry after falling out of orbit, release less harmful particles than metal satellites.

news_headline: Puerto Rico commits $8 mn to rebuild collapsed Arecibo telescope
news_article: Puerto Rico Governor Wanda Vázquez Garced has signed an executive order approving $8 million to rebuild the world's second largest radio telescope at the Arecibo Observatory. The order stated the reconstruction as a matter of "public policy". The Governor has also declared the observatory site a historic zone. The telescope had collapsed due to structural problems on December 1.

news_headline: IIT-B researchers create AI model to identify malaria parasites
news_article: Researchers from IIT-Bombay have created an AI-based model using proteomics technology that can help differentiate between two major species of malaria parasites, P falciparum and P vivax. These species are not differentiable using the rapid diagnostic tests (RDT), Shalini Aggarwal, who was part of the study, said. The researchers are currently working on developing a diagnostic kit prototype.

news_headline: SpaceX will try to 'catch' boosters returning from space: Elon Musk
news_article: Elon Musk said that SpaceX will "try to catch" Super Heavy rocket boosters returning from outer space instead of making them land. This will be done with the help of a launch tower arm, he added. Currently, the return of Falcon 9 boosters involve touching down on a boat or a launchpad using "legs" that are built into the rocket.

news_headline: Sinking land may affect 635 million people worldwide by 2040: Study
news_article: The gradual sinking of land could affect 635 million people globally by 2040, according to new research funded by UNESCO. During the past century, land subsidence due to groundwater depletion occurred at 200 locations in 34 countries. Researchers said most of the 635 million inhabitants in subsistence-susceptible areas are located in Asia, with a total exposed GDP of $9.78 trillion.

news_headline: 10 costliest disasters of 2020 caused $150B worth of damages: Report
news_article: The ten costliest weather disasters this year worldwide caused insured damages worth over $150 billion, NGO Christian Aid reported. They claimed at least 3,500 lives and displaced more than 13.5 million people. Five of the most costly extreme weather events were related to Asia's unusually rainy monsoon. Only 4% of economic losses from climate-impacted events in low-income countries were insured.

news_headline: Researchers discover new Indian Muraingrass species in Western Ghats
news_article: Researchers from Pune's ARI and the University of Goa claim to have discovered a species of Indian Muraingrass along the Western Ghats. They said the species has fought harsh conditions to survive in the ecologically-sensitive region. The species was identified after morphological studies of samples collected from laterite surfaces in the outskirts of Goa's Bhagwan Mahavir National Park.

news_headline: 153-yr-old Patna Met Centre gets centennial observing station status
news_article: The WMO has awarded the status of 'centennial observing station' to the Patna meteorological observatory. "With this recognition, Patna has joined a niche club of cities having a long-term record of scientific observation in the field of meteorology, climatology and applied science," Centre's Director Vivek Sinha said. Patna meteorological observatory was established in 1867.

news_headline: US aquarium agrees to delay 5 beluga whales delivery amid lawsuit
news_article: US-based Mystic Aquarium has agreed to delay acquisition of five beluga whales for research amid a lawsuit by an animal rights group trying to stop the delivery. The lawsuit said the whales would be harmed by the trip from their home. It added that they will also be harmed by being torn from long-term relationships with others of their species.

news_headline: China's Mars probe travels 400M km in 163 days, to enter Mars' orbit in Feb
news_article: China's first Mars exploration mission Tianwen-1 travelled more than 400 million kilometres by January 3 and is expected to enter Mars' orbit next month, China's space agency said. It was about 130 million kilometres from Earth and about 8.3 million kilometres from Mars. After entering Mars' orbit, it will spend two-three months surveying potential landing sites.

news_headline: New mutations in malaria parasite behind preventive drug resistance: Study
news_article: LSHTM researchers have said new mutations that enhance resistance to a drug used to prevent malaria in pregnant women and children are already common in countries fighting the disease. Mutations in two genes in the parasite plasmodium falciparum offer resistance to sulfadoxine-pyrimethamine, but recently, mutations related to resistance were discovered in a third gene, pfgch1.

news_headline: Scientists make film that absorbs sweat's moisture, helps power devices
news_article: NUS scientists have developed a film that is "extremely effective in evaporating sweat" from the skin and then absorbing the moisture from sweat. The film can rapidly release water on exposure to sunlight and can be "regenerated" and reused for more than 100 times. Scientists also made a wearable energy harvesting device comprising eight ECs, using the film as electrolyte.

news_headline: ISRO chief K Sivan's tenure extended by one year
news_article: The Centre on Wednesday extended the services of ISRO chief K Sivan as Space Secretary and Space Commission Chairman by a year. Sivan was provided the extension since the space programme's flagship projects, Gaganyaan and Chandrayaan-3, are still pending. His tenure will now be up to January 14, 2022, or until further orders, whichever is earlier.

news_headline: Sunquakes may originate over 1,000 km beneath Sun's surface: NASA
news_article: NASA scientists suggested seismic activity on the Sun during solar flares, sunquakes, might be originating from 1,126.5 kilometres beneath its surface. Earlier, scientists believed magnetic forces or heating of Sun's outer atmosphere caused sunquakes. Scientists' new conclusion came after observing a sunquake with unusually sharp ripples produced from a moderately strong solar flare in 2011.

news_headline: India's 40th scientific expedition to Antarctica to leave from Goa on Jan 5
news_article: India's 40th scientific expedition to Antarctica will leave on a ship from Goa on January 5 with 43 members, less than the conventional strength, due to COVID-19. The vessel will sail from Goa's MPT to Cape Town, from where it will reach Antarctica in about 18 days. Two helicopters will be added to the expedition at Cape Town.

news_headline: 2020 8th warmest year in India in 121 years: IMD
news_article: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has said that 2020 was the eighth warmest year India recorded in the last 121 years.
