Last year, the annual mean land surface air temperature average was 0.29°C above normal, for the period average considered between 1981 and 2010. However, it was much lower than 2016 (+0.71°C), which remains the warmest year recorded since 1901.

news_headline: Robots created in-house deployed by Central Railway to combat COVID-19
news_article: Central Railway is using robots and robotic devices designed and created in-house for the thermal screening of passengers, helping the frontline staff in dealing with passengers and treating coronavirus cases. The robots are called Febri Eye and Captain Arjun. A mobile app called CheckIn Master with OCR and QR code scanning facility was also launched to help ticket checking personnel.

news_headline: Facebook restores Kisan Ekta Morcha page as #ShameOnFacebook trends
news_article: Facebook on Sunday had briefly blocked Kisan Ekta Morcha's page on Facebook and Instagram, where several farmers’ groups post updates of their ongoing agitation against the new agriculture laws. The page was restored after around 3 hours, as #ShameOnFacebook and #ZuckerbergShameOnYou started trending on Twitter. Facebook claimed the page had gone against its community standards on spam.

news_headline: Fake COVID-19 vaccine sites tricking people into sharing information: US
news_article: US' Department of Justice has warned that scammers are setting up fake websites posing as pharmaceutical companies involved in the manufacturing of COVID-19 vaccine to trick people into sharing their personal information. The warning was issued after it seized and shut down two websites claiming to belong to COVID-19 vaccine maker Moderna and Regeneron, which sells treatment for coronavirus.

news_headline: Microsoft says it will kill passwords by 2021
news_article: In a blog post, Microsoft said it will kill passwords and move to stronger Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for its customers by 2021. It said that passwords are a "hassle" and that almost 80% of cyberattacks are directed at passwords. The company added that it has combined strong MFA with a PIN or user biometrics and also introduced other "passwordless" authentication.

news_headline: YouTube has over 2,000 videos of animal cruelty, charity finds
news_article: Animal welfare charity Lady Freethinker's three-month investigation has revealed that there are nearly 2,053 videos on YouTube that show animals being deliberately harmed for entertainment. The videos were posted across 146 channels and have around 1.2 billion views, the charity said, adding that they were in violation of YouTube's community standards.

news_headline: US trade blacklisting will hurt our research and development: SMIC
news_article: China's chipmaker SMIC has said that being put on US' trade blacklist will pose a significant "adverse impact" on its research and development of 10-nanometre and more advanced chip technology. SMIC added that it doesn't expect any major negative impact on its short-term operations and finances. US has blacklisted over 60 Chinese firms, including SMIC, to "protect US national security".

news_headline: Google could face US antitrust lawsuit over its app store fees: Report
news_article: Google could face an antitrust lawsuit from three US states over the 30% fee it takes from developers for subscriptions and in-app purchases on its Play Store, Bloomberg reported. Vice President of Product Management at Google Sameer Samat said if developers don't agree with Google's business terms, they can choose other app store platforms to distribute their apps on Android.

news_headline: Hackers targeted 36 mn remote staff in India between Jan-Nov: Report
news_article: About 36 million people working remotely in India were targeted by hackers between January and November, Kaspersky reported. The number of attacks in the same period last year was around 18 million. As per the report, some 3.3 billion attacks on Remote Desktop Protocols were made worldwide, as compared to 969 million attacks detected last year.

news_headline: Wistron could not cope with rapid scaling up of manpower: Govt report
news_article: Apple supplier Wistron's Karnataka plant couldn't cope up with the rapid scaling up of manpower, Reuters reported quoting a government report. Its manpower rose to 10,500 workers from the permitted 5,000 in a short span of time. Wistron also failed to fix a glitch in its attendance system which caused employees' presence to be registered incorrectly, the report added.

news_headline: China might be behind the cyberattack on US govt agencies: Trump
news_article: US President Donald Trump has suggested that China may have been behind the SolarWinds cyberattack that targeted US government agencies. "Russia, Russia...is priority chant when anything happens because Lamestream is...petrified of...discussing the possibility that it may be China (it may!)," he wrote. He also said that voting machines could've been hit by the cyberattack during the elections.

news_headline: Google blocks certificate on browser used for monitoring in Kazakhstan: Report
news_article: Some browser makers, including Google, banned a certificate used by the Kazakhstan government to monitor citizens, ZDNet reported. The certificate was being used to intercept and decrypt HTTPS traffic from Nur-Sultan's residents, Kazakhstan's capital. On December 6, local internet service providers were forced to block foreign sites unless users had the certificate installed on their devices.

news_headline: Musk inquires about possibility of converting 'large' amounts to Bitcoin
news_article: In a Twitter exchange, Tesla CEO and world's second richest person Elon Musk asked a Bitcoin investor if "large transactions" were "even possible" through the cryptocurrency. Musk was responding to MicroStrategy CEO Michael Saylor who had asked Musk to convert Tesla's balance sheet to Bitcoin. Bitcoin's value has been surging after passing $20,000 for the first time last week.

news_headline: US to back $1.9 bn to replace equipment from Huawei, ZTE: Report
news_article: US lawmakers will back $1.9 billion to fund a program to replace telecom network equipment from companies which have been identified as national security threats by the US government, Reuters reported. The program will be a part of the $900 billion COVID-19 relief fund. Earlier in June, China's Huawei and ZTE were designated as national security threats by the FCC.

news_headline: Dogecoin surges 25% after Elon Musk tweets about it
news_article: Dogecoin, a meme-inspired cryptocurrency, increased by about 25% in value after Elon Musk, the second richest man in the world tweeted about it. "One word: Doge" was his tweet, which was followed by Musk changing his Twitter bio to "Former CEO of Dogecoin" as a joke. Musk tweeted about Dogecoin in July too, which sent its value up 14% then.

news_headline: Apple temporarily shuts California, London stores due to COVID-19 surge
news_article: Apple has temporarily closed all 53 stores in California in the US and over a dozen in London owing to a surge in COVID-19 cases. Apple has reportedly also closed its stores in Mexico, Brazil and many more across the US. Apple had reopened the vast majority of its over 270 US stores recently, although mostly by appointment only.

news_headline: Skype gets 'Together Mode' to put users together in a virtual space
news_article: Microsoft has introduced 'Together Mode' in Skype that uses AI to segment a user's face and shoulders and place them together with other people in a virtual space. The feature is already available in Microsoft Teams. It doesn't require users to have the Skype app as it works through the web version without the need for an account.

news_headline: Facebook shuts anti-vaccine groups claiming govt will put chips in Israelis
news_article: Israel has said that, at its request, Facebook removed four groups that had disseminated texts, photographs and videos with "deliberately mendacious content designed to mislead about coronavirus vaccines". Such content included arguments that vaccines would be used to plant government tracking chips in recipients' bodies. Facebook said the groups were removed under its policy regarding vaccines.

news_headline: Some Instagram, Messenger features temporarily disabled in Europe
news_article: Facebook has temporarily disabled some features of Instagram and Messenger for its users in Europe in a bid to comply with EU's ePrivacy Directive. It has confirmed that features like polls on Messenger and Instagram, stickers on Instagram and personalised replies on Messenger will be unavailable. "We're still determining the best way to bring these features back," Facebook told BBC.

news_headline: Dozens of Al Jazeera journalists' iPhones hacked using Israeli spyware
news_article: Dozens of Al Jazeera journalists have been hit by a cyberattack using spyware sold by Israeli private intelligence firm NSO Group, according to researchers at Citizen Lab. The spyware used a vulnerability in iPhone's iMessage to spy on victims without them opening malicious links. The attack is likely to have been ordered by Saudi Arabia and UAE, according to researchers.

news_headline: Twitter updates labels to confirm Joe Biden as next US President
news_article: Twitter has updated its labels for US presidential election-related misinformation to show Joe Biden as the confirmed President-elect. Before this, Twitter's labels called any claims to victory as disputed or misleading. The updated Twitter label says, "Election officials have certified Joe Biden as the winner of the U.S. Presidential election."

news_headline: NATO checks its systems post cyberattack on US govt agencies: Report
news_article: NATO is checking its computer systems after a suspected Russian cyberattack on the US government agencies and others, AFP reported. A NATO official said NATO hasn't found any evidence of compromise on its networks and its experts continue to assess the situation for identifying and mitigating any potential risks. NATO used SolarWinds' software in some of its systems, official added.

news_headline: 200 victims of suspected Russian hacking identified: Report
news_article: At least 200 organisations, including the US government agencies and global firms, have been hacked as part of a suspected Russian cyberattack that used a backdoor in SolarWinds' software, Bloomberg reported. Around 18,000 SolarWinds' customers received a malicious update that included the backdoor. However, US President Donald Trump has said China, not Russia, might be responsible for the attack.

news_headline: Hack response will go beyond just sanctions: Biden's Chief of Staff
news_article: Incoming White House Chief of Staff Ron Klain on Sunday said President-elect Biden’s response to the extensive hacking campaign uncovered last week would go beyond "just sanctions". The US suspects Russian hackers to be behind the attack that penetrated more than six US government agencies and left thousands of American companies exposed. Russia has denied any role in the hacking.

news_headline: Zoom being probed in US over interactions with Chinese govt
news_article: Zoom has said the US SEC and two US Attorney's offices have been investigating it for months. It said it has provided information to multiple US prosecutors and regulators on interactions with China and other overseas governments. The US has charged a former China-based Zoom executive with disrupting video meetings commemorating Tiananmen Square crackdown's 31st anniversary at China's request.

news_headline: Cameraman captures Jupiter, Saturn in sky during New Zealand-Pakistan T20I, pic goes viral
news_article: During the second New Zealand-Pakistan T20I at Seddon Park in Hamilton, the cameraman captured a photograph of planets Saturn and Jupiter in one frame. "We forget how amazing those Outdoor Broadcast cameras are till you see something like that," a fan tweeted. On Monday night, Saturn and Jupiter will be closest in the sky in over 400 years.

news_headline: Rahul Dravid must be rushed to Australia: Vengsarkar after India's defeat
news_article: Ex-India chief selector Dilip Vengsarkar has said BCCI must rush ex-captain Rahul Dravid to Australia to help Team India following their Adelaide Test defeat against Australia. "No one can guide the batsmen better on how to play the moving ball in those conditions," he added. "His presence will be a huge boost to Team India in the nets," he stated.

news_headline: Latest Test rankings out after India's defeat, Kohli closes gap on 1st-placed Smith
news_article: The ICC on Sunday released the latest rankings for Test batsmen following India's defeat against Australia in the first Test in Adelaide. Team India captain Virat Kohli has managed to fractionally close the gap on first-placed Steve Smith from 25 points to 13 points. Kohli gained two points, whereas Smith's 1 and 1* lost him 10 points in the table.

news_headline: Best player in 2nd Australia-India Test to get a special medal, pics released
news_article: Cricket Australia has announced that the best player in the Australia-India Boxing Day Test will be awarded the Mullagh Medal, named after Johnny Mullagh, who was the captain of the 1868 cricket team. The team was the first Australian sporting team to tour internationally. The medal is a recreation of the original belt buckle worn by the 1868 team.

news_headline: Shaw shares motivational quote after criticism over failure in 1st Test vs Australia
news_article: India opener Prithvi Shaw, who scored 0(2) and 4(4) in the first and second innings respectively in the first Test against Australia, took to Instagram Stories to react to criticism over his failure. He shared a motivational quote that read, "If sometimes people demotivate you for something you try to do that means you can do that but they can't."

news_headline: I am hoping that Prithvi Shaw makes no runs at all: Australia opener Joe Burns
news_article: On being asked to give an advice to his counterpart Prithvi Shaw, Australia opener Joe Burns said, "I wouldn’t give him any advice as I am playing against him." Burns added, "I am hoping that he makes no runs at all. I actually don't know what form he has been in. I haven't been following him."

news_headline: Dan Christian slams 5 sixes, smashes the second-fastest fifty in BBL history
news_article: Sydney Sixers all-rounder Dan Christian, on Sunday, smashed the second-fastest fifty in the history of BBL after reaching his half-century off 15 deliveries against Adelaide Strikers. The 37-year-old, who got out on the 16th ball of his innings, smashed five sixes and four fours. Chris Gayle's 12-ball fifty against Adelaide Strikers in 2016 is the fastest BBL half-century ever.

news_headline: Latest ICC Test rankings for bowlers out; Ashwin jumps 1 spot, Hazlewood 4
news_article: The ICC on Sunday released the latest rankings for Test bowlers. Australia fast bowler Josh Hazlewood, who recorded the most economical five-wicket haul by an Australian in 73 years after registering figures of 5-3-8-5 against India in the second innings of Adelaide Test, jumped four spots to be ranked fifth. Meanwhile, Ravichandran Ashwin jumped one spot to be ranked ninth.

news_headline: Vihari should bat at number four or five in Virat's absence: MSK Prasad
news_article: Former chief selector MSK Prasad feels Hanuma Vihari should bat up the order in Virat Kohli's absence in the Melbourne Test, starting December 26. "I would prefer Vihari batting at No. 4 or 5 in the next few Tests...He is a gutsy boy and I have confidence that he will do well if given the challenge," said MSK Prasad.

news_headline: Prithvi Shaw's early dismissals added pressure on India: Gilchrist
news_article: Former Australia wicket-keeper Adam Gilchrist said Prithvi Shaw's early dismissals 'put India on the back foot' against Australia in the first Test. Shaw could only manage to score 0 and 4 in the Adelaide. "While he is a talented youngster, his performance will put the selectors in a dilemma as they plan for the Boxing Day Test," Gilchrist said.

news_headline: Women boxers Simranjeet, Manisha bag gold for India at World Cup in Germany
news_article: India's Simranjeet Kaur and Manisha Moun won gold in the women's 60kg and 57kg category respectively at the Boxing World Cup in Cologne in Germany. While Manisha beat India's Sakshi 3-2, Simranjeet got the better of Germany's Maya Klienhans 4-1. India finished second in the medal tally after claiming three gold, two silver and four bronze medals in the competition.

news_headline: If Ishant is fit, send him to Australia now: Gavaskar on Shami's injury
news_article: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said that if Mohammad Shami is not playing then it's going to be "trouble" for India in the upcoming Tests. "If Ishant Sharma is fit, I am suggesting to send him to Australia now...so that he can be ready for the Sydney Test," he added. Shami reportedly suffered a fractured arm in Adelaide.

news_headline: Babar Azam, Imam-ul-Haq ruled out of first Test against New Zealand
news_article: Pakistan captain Babar Azam and opener Imam-ul-Haq will be missing the upcoming first Test against New Zealand due to thumb injuries. While Babar fractured his right thumb, Imam injured his left thumb during training sessions last week. In Babar's absence, wicketkeeper Mohammad Rizwan will lead Pakistan in the first Test and will become his country's 33rd Test captain.

news_headline: Can use Rishabh Pant just as a batsman: Murali Kartik ahead of 2nd Test
news_article: Ex-India cricketer Murali Kartik said wicket-keeper Rishabh Pant can be included "just as a batsman with the X-factor" for the second Test. "Pant hasn't done anything wrong as a batsman so you can play him as a batsman and don't take the gloves from Saha," said Kartik. Australia dismissed India for 36 in the second innings of the first Test.

news_headline: Lewis Hamilton wins BBC’s Sports Personality of the Year
news_article: Formula One champion Lewis Hamilton was named as BBC's Sports Personality of the Year on Sunday. Hamilton beat Liverpool midfielder Jordan Henderson and British jockey Hollie Doyle to win the prize in a public vote. The other three members of the six-person shortlist were boxer Tyson Fury, snooker player Ronnie O'Sullivan and cricketer Stuart Broad.

news_headline: You believed in Shaw despite his form, 2 innings shouldn't change that: Ajay Jadeja
news_article: Amid calls to drop Prithvi Shaw for the Melbourne Test, ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja has backed the 21-year-old, stating that two innings shouldn't change the belief selectors showed in him. "You played him...knowing [that] he didn't have a great run in [practice] games...IPL...you went with him looking at the future. A couple of innings shouldn't change that," he stated.

news_headline: Indian batting capable of fighting back: Afridi after Adelaide Test
news_article: Ex-Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi has backed Team India's batting to bounce back after the Adelaide Test. "Brilliant display by Cummins and Hazlewood...really enjoyed top-quality Test match fast bowling after long time. Indian batting is still capable of fighting back," he wrote on Twitter. Afridi, however, also added that it'll be tougher for Team India in upcoming Tests without Virat Kohli

news_headline: Never thought I would again see India get dismissed for 42 or less: Viswanath
news_article: Gundappa Viswanath, who was in the Indian team that got dismissed for 42 against England at Lord's in 1974, said he never thought he would see India getting all out for 42 or less again in his lifetime. "They have to just leave this behind...The Indian team have played enough cricket to get this out of their system," said Viswanath.

news_headline: Told Shaw during IPL to pay attention to fitness to train mind: Kaif
news_article: Talking about Prithvi Shaw's performance in Adelaide Test, former India cricketer Mohammad Kaif said that difficulty was bound to come as the 21-year-old was playing his first pink ball Test and that too on Australian soil. "Coming to fitness...I told Shaw [during IPL] that when you pay attention to your fitness...you also train your mind," he added.

news_headline: Aus have got a bit of sniff, they're going to go even harder now: Ponting
news_article: After India lost the first Test, former Australia skipper Ricky Ponting said that hosts have a "good chance" to go for a clean sweep. "Now that they've got a bit of a sniff they're going to go even harder next game," he added. On India's playing XI, Ponting said Rishabh Pant has to be in the middle order.

news_headline: Pakistan suffer 2nd straight defeat vs NZ, lose T20I series 0-2
news_article: Pakistan on Sunday suffered their second straight defeat against New Zealand as Kane Williamson-led side chased down their 163-run total in the second T20I. NZ pacer Tim Southee was named Player of the Match for picking four wickets in his four overs, giving 21 runs. NZ had chased down Pakistan's 153-run total in the first T20I.

news_headline: Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar named Delhi head coach for 2020-21
news_article: India captain Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma has been appointed as the head coach of the Delhi Ranji team for the upcoming 2020-21 domestic season. Sharma was the bowling coach of the team last season when KP Bhaskar was the head coach. Sharma is a Dronacharya awardee and he has also coached ICC Associate team Malta.

news_headline: If Rohit Sharma is fit, he'll slot at top order: Gavaskar
news_article: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said that Rohit Sharma should open Team India's innings once he's available. "Rohit is a better Test player than Mayank Agarwal and Prithvi Shaw. If he's fit then he'll straightaway slot at the top of the order," he stated. Before the start of the series, Rohit had stated he was ready to bat at any position.

news_headline: Wriddhi can do wonders, need to give him one more chance: Ojha
news_article: Ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha feels dropping wicket-keeper Wriddhiman Saha on the back of one bad batting performance is unfair and he should be given "one more chance". "I feel Wriddhi can do wonders...If you look at Prithvi Shaw, he is totally out of this tournament, he is not there mentally. I don't find the same thing with Saha," said Ojha.

news_headline: Gatka, Kalaripayattu, Thang-Ta, Mallakhamba included in Khelo India Games
news_article: The Sports Ministry has approved the inclusion of indigenous sports Gatka, Kalaripayattu, Thang-Ta and Mallakhamba in the Khelo India Youth Games 2021. While Gatka originates from Punjab, Kalaripayattu has its origin in Kerala. Mallakhamba is Madhya Pradesh's state sport and Thang-Ta is Manipuri martial art. Yogasana has also been included in the tournament.

news_headline: India suspends all flights from UK till Dec 31 over 'out of control' COVID-19 strain
news_article: The Ministry of Civil Aviation has announced that all the flights originating from UK to India will be temporarily suspended till 11:59 pm, December 31. This suspension will be in effect from 11.59 pm, December 22, the ministry added. The decision has been taken after UK reported a new coronavirus strain, calling it "out of control" and 70% more transmissible.

news_headline: Redouble control in Europe: WHO after new COVID-19 strain found in UK
news_article: The World Health Organization (WHO) has urged European countries to "redouble their control and prevention approaches" to coronavirus after a new COVID-19 strain was found in the UK. Several European countries have decided to suspend all flights from the UK in response. WHO also urged its members to "increase...sequencing of SARS-CoV-2 viruses where possible" and share the data internationally.

news_headline: New mutant coronavirus strain is out of control: UK govt
news_article: UK Health Secretary Matt Hancock has said the new mutant strain of coronavirus is "out of control", adding that it is an "enormous challenge" to keep it under control.  "Cases have absolutely rocketed, so we’ve got a long way to go. I think it'll be very difficult to keep it under control until the vaccine has rolled out," he added.

news_headline: Italy finds patient with new COVID-19 strain which UK said is out of control
news_article: Italy's health ministry on Sunday said it has detected a patient infected with the new strain of COVID-19 which the UK said is "out of control". The patient and his partner returned from the United Kingdom in the last few days with a flight that landed at Rome's Fiumicino airport. Both of them are now in isolation, the ministry said.

news_headline: What does UK say about the new COVID-19 variant found there?
news_article: UK PM Boris Johnson has said the new COVID-19 strain found in the country is seen to be 70% more transmissible than the existing strains, leading to rapid spike in new infections. However, there's no evidence to suggest it's more lethal or causes more severe illness, he stated. UK government's scientific advisor said the variant contains 23 different genetic changes.

news_headline: Couple holds 10,000 people drive-thru wedding in Malaysia; pics surface
news_article: A couple held 10,000 people drive-thru wedding in Malaysia amid COVID-19, with pictures of the ceremony surfacing online. The newly-weds were seated outside a government building in Putrajaya while guests drove past in their cars. "Me and my family are very honoured. Thank you all for understanding and adhering to all procedures," the groom's father, a politician, said.

news_headline: Miss Belarus 2008, who was jailed for protesting, released after 42 days
news_article: The winner of Miss Belarus 2008 beauty pageant Olga Khizhinkova who was arrested for participating in an anti-government protest has been released after 42 days. After her release, Khizhinkova explained how she'd slept on the floor with no heating and had wrapped herself in clothes to keep warm. She also said that she has no plans to flee the country.

news_headline: Nepal's Parliament dissolved two years ahead of its normal tenure
news_article: Nepal President Bidya Devi Bhandari has accepted Prime Minister K P Sharma Oli's proposal to dissolve the Parliament two years ahead of its normal tenure. This comes amid a power tussle within the ruling Nepal Communist Party. Oli took the decision after a meeting at his residence as talks with party co-chairman and leader Pushpa Kamal Dahal Prachanda failed.

news_headline: UK Health Secy compared to Woody from Toy Story after his video goes viral
news_article: Social media users compared UK Health Secretary Matt Hancock to Toy Story character Woody after a video of him sitting down in Parliament went viral. "It seems like a fun...way to sit on a sofa/chair...People say Matt Hancock isn't interesting, but maybe he's trying to be and sitting like Woody is one way to do it," a Twitter user said.

news_headline: Thai men and women hold crop top protests with anti-monarchy slogans on belly
news_article: Some protest leaders in Thailand dressed in crop tops and paraded at a Bangkok shopping mall in a jibe against King Maha Vajiralongkorn to demand the repeal of the law against insulting the monarchy. Several activists also had anti-monarchy slogans written on their belly. Pictures of the king wearing a crop top had gone viral online a few years ago.

news_headline: Airline flies 69 passengers to wrong destination in Nepal: Report
news_article: Nepal's Buddha Air on Friday flew 69 passengers to Pokhara instead of Janakpur, The Kathmandu Post reported. Birendra Bahadur Basnet, Buddha Air's managing director, told the Kathmandu Post that they have formed a committee to investigate the incident. The ground staff and the flight attendant reportedly failed to brief the captain and co-pilot that the flight's number had been changed.

news_headline: Australian states impose travel restrictions on Sydney residents
news_article: All Australian states and territories have imposed travel restrictions on Sydney residents as a COVID-19 cluster in the city grew to around 70. The Australian Capital Territory (ACT) Health Department said, "If you're not an ACT resident and have been in greater Sydney...our message is simple: don't travel to...ACT." Sydney's Northern Beaches area has been put under a five-day lockdown.

news_headline: Saudi, Turkey, Morocco ban int'l flights over UK coronavirus strain
news_article: Saudi Arabia has decided to close its land and sea borders, and suspend all international flights temporarily for a week over the new coronavirus strain in the UK, the official Saudi Press Agency stated. Turkey has also temporarily suspended flights from England, Denmark, the Netherlands and South Africa. Besides these nations, Morocco has suspended air travel with the UK.

news_headline: Thailand to test thousands after seafood market COVID-19 outbreak
news_article: Thailand on Sunday began testing tens of thousands of people for coronavirus after an outbreak linked to a seafood market was reported in Samut Sakhon province. Four coronavirus cases were reported there on Friday which rose to 689 by Sunday, the Health Ministry said. Up to 40,000 people will be tested in Samut Sakhon and nearby provinces, an official said.

news_headline: Some Instagram, Messenger features temporarily disabled in Europe
news_article: Facebook has temporarily disabled some features of Instagram and Messenger for its users in Europe in a bid to comply with EU's ePrivacy Directive. It has confirmed that features like polls on Messenger and Instagram, stickers on Instagram and personalised replies on Messenger will be unavailable. "We're still determining the best way to bring these features back," Facebook told BBC.

news_headline: Hack response will go beyond just sanctions: Biden's Chief of Staff
news_article: Incoming White House Chief of Staff Ron Klain on Sunday said President-elect Biden’s response to the extensive hacking campaign uncovered last week would go beyond "just sanctions". The US suspects Russian hackers to be behind the attack that penetrated more than six US government agencies and left thousands of American companies exposed. Russia has denied any role in the hacking.

news_headline: Dozens of Al Jazeera journalists' iPhones hacked using Israeli spyware
news_article: Dozens of Al Jazeera journalists have been hit by a cyberattack using spyware sold by Israeli private intelligence firm NSO Group, according to researchers at Citizen Lab. The spyware used a vulnerability in iPhone's iMessage to spy on victims without them opening malicious links. The attack is likely to have been ordered by Saudi Arabia and UAE, according to researchers.

news_headline: China might be behind the cyberattack on US govt agencies: Trump
news_article: US President Donald Trump has suggested that China may have been behind the SolarWinds cyberattack that targeted US government agencies. "Russia, Russia...is priority chant when anything happens because Lamestream is...petrified of...discussing the possibility that it may be China (it may!)," he wrote. He also said that voting machines could've been hit by the cyberattack during the elections.

news_headline: Germany brings home 5 'ISIS brides', 18 children from Syria
news_article: Germany has brought home five "Islamic State (ISIS) brides" and 18 children, including seven orphans, from Kurdish-run camps in northeastern Syria in a "humanitarian" recovery operation. Of these, three women reportedly face terror charges in Germany. The operation had gone ahead in "precarious" circumstances after "months of intensive preparations", German Foreign Minister Heiko Maas said.

news_headline: Afghan lawmaker survives bomb attack in Kabul, 9 killed
news_article: At least nine people were killed in a bomb blast targeting a lawmaker in Kabul on Sunday, officials said. Lawmaker Khan Mohammad Wardak survived the blast but is among 20 injured including women and children, Afghan Interior Minister Masoud Andarabi said. Several houses around the blast site were severely damaged, a government spokesperson said.

news_headline: China appoints new military commander for India border
news_article: Chinese President Xi Jinping has appointed General Zhang Xudong as the commander of the Western Theater Command that overlooks China's border with India. The change comes amid a standoff between China and India in eastern Ladakh. Reportedly, General Zhang has previously served in Shenyang Military Region (now under Northern Theater Command) and Central Theater Command.

news_headline: 80 children freed after new abduction in Nigeria: Police
news_article: Nigerian Police and a local community self-defence group rescued over 80 students after gunmen briefly abducted them on Saturday night, a police spokesperson announced on Sunday. The foiled abduction comes less than two days after the release of 344 schoolboys who were kidnapped in the same area on December 11. The police also recovered 12 stolen cows from the gunmen.

news_headline: Foreign intelligence service is crucial for protecting Russia: Putin
news_article: Russia's foreign intelligence service is a crucial guarantee of its "sovereign, democratic, independent development", President Vladimir Putin said. "I expect...the...service will continue to respond...to the highly changeable international context," he added. Notably, the comments come after the US claimed Russia was behind the cyberattack which targeted key American government departments.

news_headline: 4 Pakistanis arrested for Sept 25 knife attack in Paris
news_article: Four Pakistanis have been arrested in France as part of an investigation into a knife attack in Paris on September 25, the national counter-terrorism prosecutor's office said. They're suspected of encouraging the attacker, also a Pakistani, to carry out the attack, a source said. The attack, near the former office of satirical magazine Charlie Hebdo, had left two journalists injured.

news_headline: No time to waste: Biden as he introduces his climate team
news_article: Introducing key members of his environmental team on Saturday, US President-elect Joe Biden said, "We literally have no time to waste." Just as the US has needed a unified national response to COVID-19, it needs one for dealing with climate change, he added. Biden also reiterated that the US will rejoin the 2015 Paris climate agreement.

news_headline: 10 MLAs, TMC MP join BJP during Amit Shah's rally in Bengal
news_article: At least 10 MLAs and former TMC MP Sunil Mondal have joined BJP in the presence of Home Minister Amit Shah during a rally in West Bengal on Saturday. Former TMC MLAs Suvendu Adhikary, Banasri Maity, Biswajit Kundu, Saikat Panja, Shilbhadra Dutta, Dipali Biswas and Sukra Munda are among those who have joined the party.

news_headline: AAP ready to contest on all 70 seats in 2022 U'khand polls: Manish Sisodia
news_article: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Monday said AAP is ready to contest on all 70 seats in the next Uttarakhand Assembly elections. "People from Uttarakhand visit us and say that the way AAP government worked in Delhi, they should come to power in Uttarakhand too," he added. "They're unhappy with the government under CM Trivendra Singh Rawat," Sisodia said.

news_headline: We've prioritised 30 crore people for COVID-19 vaccine: Health Minister
news_article: Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan on Monday said the Centre has prioritised 30 crore people for a vaccine against the novel coronavirus. He said, "It includes health workers, frontline workers like police, military and sanitation staff, people above 50 years of age and those who are below 50 years but are suffering from certain diseases like blood pressure and diabetes."

news_headline: PM Modi proposes library for traditional Buddhist literature in India
news_article: Speaking at the Indo-Japan Samwad Conference on Monday, PM Narendra Modi proposed to create a library of traditional Buddhist literature and scriptures in India. He said the library will collect digital copies of all such Buddhist literature from different countries. "It will aim to translate them, and make them freely available for all monks and scholars of Buddhism," he added.

news_headline: AAP appoints Raghav Chadha as co-incharge of party's Punjab unit
news_article: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has appointed Raghav Chadha as co-incharge of the party's Punjab unit. Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia took to Twitter to congratulate Chadha and wrote, "Congratulations on becoming the new seh-prabhari of Punjab. Chakk de fatte." Raghav Chadha is currently also the Vice Chairman of the Delhi Jal Board (DJB).

news_headline: Parliament winter session cancelled to avoid debate on farm laws: Raut
news_article: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut claimed that winter session of Parliament was cancelled to avoid a debate on the ongoing farmers' protest against the Centre's new farm laws. Criticising the Centre in his weekly column in Sena mouthpiece 'Saamana', Raut questioned the need for spending "₹1,000 crore" on Central Vista project when government was not interested in holding Parliament session.

news_headline: TMC MP lists '7 pieces of false info' in Amit Shah's speech at rally
news_article: TMC MP Derek O'Brien on Sunday listed "7 pieces of concocted, false info" in Home Minister Amit Shah's speech during a rally in West Bengal's Midnapore. Responding to Shah's claim that CM Mamata Banerjee had "left Congress for another party", O'Brien stated that she "didn't defect, she set up a new party". Shah is in Bengal on a two-day visit.

news_headline: Mamata govt won't stop infiltration, believes in minority appeasement: Shah
news_article: Union Home Minister Amit Shah criticised CM Mamata Banerjee saying infiltration in Bengal has increased manifold. He said that the current TMC government headed by CM Banerjee cannot stop infiltration as it believes in minority appeasement, adding, "Only BJP can do it." Shah further said that political violence in the state is "at its peak".

news_headline: Will consider framing CAA rules after COVID vaccination starts: Shah
news_article: Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday said the rules of the Citizenship (Amendment) Act were yet to be framed as such a huge process could not be conducted during the coronavirus pandemic. He added, "As soon as (COVID-19) vaccination starts and corona cycle breaks, we will consider it." The Home Minister was speaking at a press conference in West Bengal.

news_headline: Party free of virus: TMC leader after Suvendu Adhikari joins BJP
news_article: TMC leader and former minister Madan Mitra on Saturday said that the party will host a "grand gala" to express gratitude to "traitors" whose departure has ensured the party is "free of virus". Mitra said this after Suvendu Adhikari, who resigned as a Minister in CM Mamata Banerjee's Cabinet, joined BJP at a rally in Midnapore.

news_headline: 99.9% Congress members want Rahul Gandhi as party chief: Surjewala
news_article: Congress leader Randeep Surjewala said on Friday that the party would soon start the procedure to elect a new President. He added that 99.9% of party members including him wanted Rahul Gandhi as the President of Congress. "Electoral college of Congress, AICC members, Congress workers and members will choose who is best suited," said Surjewala.

news_headline: PM Modi makes surprise visit to Gurudwara Rakab Ganj Sahib in Delhi
news_article: Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited Delhi's Gurudwara Rakab Ganj Sahib in an unscheduled visit on Sunday morning and paid tributes to Guru Teg Bahadur. PM Modi tweeted, "This morning, I prayed at the historic Gurudwara Rakab Ganj Sahib...I felt extremely blessed. I, like millions around the world, am deeply inspired by the kindnesses of Sri Guru Teg Bahadur Ji."

news_headline: BJP MP Saumitra Khan to send divorce notice to wife Sujata after she joins TMC
news_article: After his wife Sujata Mondal Khan joined TMC, BJP MP Saumitra Khan described her decision as a "big mistake" and said he'll soon send her a divorce notice. "You have chosen politics over family. You have been trapped," Saumitra added. Speaking about her decision, Sujata said, "It's my decision today and who guarantees that Saumitra won't join me in future?"

news_headline: You’ll be left alone by the time Bengal goes to polls: Amit Shah to CM Mamata
news_article: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday said Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee will find herself facing the BJP all by herself by the time West Bengal goes to polls next year. He said this at a rally in Midnapore. High-profile TMC rebel leader, Suvendu Adhikari and several others switched to the BJP on Saturday.

news_headline: Congress student body chief Ruchi Gupta resigns citing delay in changes
news_article: Ruchi Gupta, a confidante and key aide of Rahul Gandhi, has resigned as the national in-charge of Congress' student wing NSUI. In a message announcing her resignation, Gupta said, "As you know important organisational changes have remained pending for very long. The national committee took one year and three months. State presidents' orders have remained pending for months."

news_headline: Give PM Modi one chance, will make Sonar Bangla in 5 yrs: Shah at roadshow
news_article: Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday held a roadshow from Hanuman Mandir Stadium Road to Bolpur circle in West Bengal's Birbhum. "I haven't seen a roadshow like this in my life. This shows love and trust of people towards PM Narendra Modi," Shah said. "Give PM Modi one chance. We'll make 'Sonar Bangla' in five years," he added.

news_headline: TMC MLA Banasri Maity resigns from party, 4th leader to quit in 48 hours
news_article: Trinamool Congress MLA Banasri Maity from West Bengal's Kanthi Uttar on Friday tendered her resignation from the "primary membership and from each and every post" of the party. Maity is the fourth leader to resign from TMC in the past 48 hours after Suvendu Adhikari, Jitendra Tiwari and Silbhadra Datta. Notably, Tiwari on Friday took his resignation back.

news_headline: Veteran Congress leader Motilal Vora passes away a day after his 93rd birthday
news_article: Veteran Congress leader and former Madhya Pradesh CM Motilal Vora passed away on Monday, a day after celebrating his 93rd birthday. He was admitted to Fortis Escorts Hospital in Delhi due to urine infection, according to reports. The leader was infected with coronavirus but had recovered and got discharged in October.

news_headline: Jairam Ramesh apologises to Ajit Doval's son in defamation case
news_article: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Saturday tendered an apology to National Security Advisor Ajit Doval's son, Vivek Doval, in connection with a criminal defamation case. After accepting the apology through his lawyer, Vivek said, "Today, I feel vindicated." Vivek had filed a defamation case against Ramesh and Caravan magazine for their alleged defamatory statements and articles against him in 2019.

news_headline: Temple donation drive akin to poll campaigning in Lord Ram's name: Sena
news_article: The Shiv Sena on Monday alleged that the initiative to collect funds from the public for the Ram temple construction in Ayodhya is akin to "campaigning" for the 2024 general elections in the name of Lord Ram. "The political campaigning of Lord Ram's name has to be stopped at some point of time," said Sena. BJP has refuted the allegation.

news_headline: Dharna held in Hyderabad in support of protesting farmers in Delhi
news_article: Expressing solidarity with the farmers protesting at Delhi borders against the Centre's new farm laws, members of different organisations, including farmer organisations and political parties, held a dharna in Hyderabad on Sunday. The protesters observed 'Shradhanjali Diwas' to pay homage to those who have died during the ongoing farmers' agitation.

news_headline: Sonia Gandhi to convene a meeting with Cong leaders on Sat: Reports
news_article: Congress party's Interim President Sonia Gandhi has called for a meeting of party leaders on Saturday to formulate the party's strategy on the current political scenario amid the ongoing farmers' agitation, according to reports. "The leaders who will be meeting Sonia Gandhi include those who...have specific concerns with [the party's] functioning," a party functionary said.

news_headline: Quit if you can't provide good education: Delhi Dy CM to UP CM
news_article: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Saturday said that UP CM Yogi Adityanath should quit if he is unable to provide good education to the children of the state, "which has a large population". "The people will choose the person who has the ability to give good education to the children of the big state," Sisodia added.

news_headline: Politicians rejected by nation are now misleading farmers: UP CM
news_article: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Sunday said, "Politicians who have been rejected by the people are trying to spoil the atmosphere inside the country by misleading the farmer brothers." "Mandi system will not end...If the farmers get more price for their grain anywhere else in the country, they can take their produce and sell it there," he added.

news_headline: Situation of 'committing suicide' by merging with BJP hasn't come: Kumaraswamy
news_article: JD(S) chief and former Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy took to Twitter on Sunday to write that the situation of "committing suicide" by merging the party with BJP hasn't yet come. "There's no tacit understanding with BJP," he tweeted. "At the most we may extend an issue-based support to BJP if need be," he further wrote in another tweet.

news_headline: Actor Jayasurya dragged by power tiller as it goes out of control, video goes viral
news_article: A video of actor Jayasurya getting dragged by a power tiller after it went out of control during the shoot of Malayalam film 'Vellam' has gone viral. In the video, the team can be seen pulling Jayasurya and saving him from injuries. Jayasurya reportedly insisted on doing the scene without opting for a dupe as he wanted to retain originality.

news_headline: Ariana Grande gets engaged to real estate agent Dalton Gomez, shares pics
news_article: Singer Ariana Grande took to Instagram to reveal that she got engaged to real estate agent Dalton Gomez. Sharing pictures with him and a picture of the ring, Ariana wrote, "Forever and then some." Several celebrities, including Kim Kardashian and Hailey Bieber commented on Ariana's post and congratulated the couple.

news_headline: Madonna shares photo showing her scar from hip surgery
news_article: Singer Madonna on Monday took to Instagram Story to share pictures showing her scar from a hip surgery. She shared the pictures following a cupping treatment session that left her with circular marks dotted across her thighs. The 62-year-old added the hashtags "recovery", "cupping" and "beautiful scar" in the pictures.

news_headline: Actor Nivin Pauly's assistant Shabu passes away at 37 after falling from tree
news_article: Actor Nivin Pauly's personal makeup man and personal assistant Shabu Pulpally passed away at the age of 37 after falling from a tree. Shabu had climbed the tree to hang a Christmas star but lost balance and fell. He died following internal injuries, FEFKA Directors' Union posted on Facebook.

news_headline: Mithun collapses on set due to food poisoning, finishes shoot
news_article: Mithun Chakraborty, who's shooting for Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Kashmir Files', collapsed on the film's set on Saturday. "It was an action scene...He had a terrible bout of food poisoning and was unable to...stand. After taking a...break, he finished the sequence," Agnihotri told Mid-Day. "When he returned to...set on Sunday morning, he ensured he made up for the backlog," Agnihotri added.

news_headline: Father of late actor Sushant Singh Rajput hospitalised due to heart problem
news_article: KK Singh, the father of late actor Sushant Singh Rajput, has been hospitalised in Faridabad due to heart problem. Bollywood and fashion photographer Viral Bhayani shared a picture of KK Singh with his daughters, writing, "Sushant's father is in Faridabad's Asian Hospital due to heart issue. Please pray for his early recovery."

news_headline: 30-yr-old Insta model, dubbed 'Mexican Kim Kardashian', dies after 'botched surgery'
news_article: Instagram model-influencer Joselyn Cano, dubbed 'Mexican Kim Kardashian', died earlier this month aged 30. She's said to have died after a botched butt-lift surgery in Colombia. A livestream of what's believed to be her funeral was shared on YouTube. A message on the stream read, "Joselyn entered this life on...March 14, 1990. She entered into Eternal Life on...December 7, 2020."

news_headline: Karanvir Bohra & wife Teejay blessed with baby girl, pic surfaces
news_article: Television actor Karanvir Bohra and wife Teejay Sidhu have been blessed with a baby girl. The child was born in Vancouver, Canada. "I've become Charlie, now that I've got three angels," Karanvir told SpotboyE, which also shared a picture from the hospital. The couple is already parents to twin girls, who were born in the year 2016.

news_headline: Feels good to be sharing space: Richa on moving in with Ali
news_article: Actress Richa Chadha, who recently moved in with her boyfriend Ali Fazal, said, "It was a long-overdue move and it feels good to be sharing space." Further speaking about Ali, she said, "He is a very good partner and collaborator...I am looking forward to doing a full-fledged film with him because we haven't really worked...opposite each other ever."

news_headline: Eminem apologises to Rihanna for backing Chris Brown after he abused her
news_article: In his new track titled 'Zeus', rapper Eminem apologised to Rihanna for siding with Chris Brown, who physically assaulted her when they were dating. Last year, a song written by Eminem was leaked, where he sided with Chris. "For that song that leaked, I'm sorry, Ri / It wasn't meant to cause you grief," he said in the new song.

news_headline: Even SRK, Aamir take long breaks: Ameesha on break from acting
news_article: Commenting on taking a break from films, actress Ameesha Patel said, "I've taken a gap of only one-and-half year, which is not too long." "Even Shah Rukh Khan and Aamir Khan take breaks for such long periods," she added. The actress further said she took a break from acting to learn production techniques.

news_headline: I never thought that one day I want to be a star: Nawazuddin
news_article: Recalling the initial days of his acting career, actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui said, "I was confident about my skill, but I never thought that one day I want to be a star." Stating that he didn't come to Mumbai to act in films, Nawazuddin told Times of India, "I knew that I didn't have the personality for that...I tried television."

news_headline: Relatives cut ties after I moved to Mumbai without telling parents: Hina
news_article: Actress Hina Khan revealed that she moved to Mumbai at the age of 20 to pursue a career in acting without informing her parents, and said, "Mom's friends and relatives cut ties with us." She told Humans of Bombay, "Initially, I had a 'no shorts, no steamy scenes' policy but over time, I decided to make my own rules."

news_headline: Harman Baweja gets engaged to Sasha Ramchandani, sister shares pic
news_article: Actor Harman Baweja got engaged to wellness coach Sasha Ramchandani in Chandigarh and his sister Rowena Baweja shared the news on social media by posting a picture of the couple from their roka ceremony. "Congratulations you two!! Welcome to the family Sasha! Can't wait for the celebrations to begin. We love you," she wrote in the caption.

news_headline: Do I have to die to get proceedings going: Payal on action against Anurag
news_article: Payal Ghosh, who accused Anurag Kashyap of sexual harassment, tweeted, "It's been 4 months and no action has been taken against Anurag in spite of me providing evidence. Do I have to die to get the proceedings going?" She further tweeted, "Mumbai police hasn't done its best...We should be aware of what examples we are setting."

news_headline: Amitabh Bachchan checked on me every day: Varun on contracting COVID-19
news_article: Actor Varun Dhawan, who recently recovered from coronavirus, revealed that Amitabh Bachchan was in constant touch with him throughout his illness. "He diligently asked me every day if I was doing fine. And I was like, 'I have to get okay now'. He is spectacular and a great man," he said during an interview.

news_headline: 2020 taught us value of work, freedom which we were denied: Aftab
news_article: Calling the year 2020 a learning experience, actor Aftab Shivdasani noted that it taught him to value his health, life, work and freedom. "I had COVID-19, but 2020 taught me to value health and life...A lot of things are going to get better in 2021. This year taught us to value...work and freedom which we were denied," he said.

news_headline: Sunny Leone begins shooting for Vikram Bhatt's 'Anamika'
news_article: Sunny Leone on Monday announced that she has started working on her upcoming web series 'Anamika', which is being directed by Vikram Bhatt. "The start of something new...and the end of my lockdown," she tweeted along with a picture of herself and Vikram holding a clapboard on the sets. Vikram mentioned that the series will feature Sunny doing action scenes.

news_headline: People think being celebrity is glamorous, but it isn't this rosy: Tinaa
news_article: Speaking about her journey in the entertainment industry, actress Tinaa Dattaa said, "People see it as glamorous...but the journey isn't this rosy always." She mentioned that while she has seen many ups and downs in her career, she always believed in hard work. "I've been loyal towards my work, and that has...benefited me in the long run," she said.

news_headline: If I compete with Varun, I'll lose: Sara on screen time in 'Coolie No 1'
news_article: When asked how secure she is about getting enough screen time in 'Coolie No 1', actress Sara Ali Khan said, "If I'm going to compete with Varun...I will lose and I don't really like to lose, so I wouldn't do that." She further added, "The idea is not about stealing the screen, the idea is about stealing the scene...together."

news_headline: Wouldn't dare to try to copy Karisma: Sara on 'Coolie No 1' remake
news_article: Actress Sara Ali Khan, who will reprise Karisma Kapoor's character in the remake of the 1995 film 'Coolie No 1', said she has not tried to copy Karisma in the movie. "One is not trying to copy Karisma...I wouldn't dare to try to ape her...the only attempt here is to bring something of my own into this film," she added.

news_headline: Daughter Pranutan is still struggling: Mohnish Bahl on nepotism
news_article: While commenting on nepotism, Mohnish Bahl said his daughter Pranutan Bahl, who made her Bollywood debut in Salman Khan-produced 'Notebook', is "struggling" on her own. "She managed her second film Helmet which is yet to get a theatrical release and with the Covid-19 pandemic, even that seems to be in a doubtful situation," he added.

news_headline: Arjun Rampal appears before NCB in connection with a drug case
news_article: Arjun Rampal reached the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) office in Mumbai to appear before the agency in a drug case on Monday. He was first summoned on November 13 and was reportedly questioned for six hours. On November 9, NCB raided Arjun's residence and seized medicines which are controlled substances covered under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act.

news_headline: Saif Ali Khan is a very humble man: Sunil Grover on 'Tandav' co-star
news_article: Actor Sunil Grover, who will star with Saif Ali Khan in the upcoming web-series 'Tandav', shared that they shot many scenes for the show at Saif's ancestral house, The Pataudi Palace, and added, "Saif is a very humble man". He further said, "We all enjoyed playing cricket together, Saif and I became very good friends off-screen."

news_headline: NEXA gets India’s 1st multi-financier online car finance: Maruti Suzuki
news_article: Maruti Suzuki India Limited has announced the launch of multi-financier 'Smart Finance' service for NEXA customers across 30 cities. With this, it has become India's 1st car OEM to offer online, end-to-end car finance services, Maruti Suzuki mentioned. The platform offers one-stop convenience with option to compare loan offerings from multiple financiers, enabling customers to make an informed choice.

news_headline: Own a car without buying it : Revv Subscriptions
news_article: You can now drive a new car every month as Revv provides the option to subscribe to your favourite car for 1-36 months with ₹0 down payment, ₹0 road tax and without the hassle of maintenance and service. The car will be sanitized and delivered to your doorstep ensuring complete safety for you and your loved ones.

news_headline: Elon Musk only $20 billion away from becoming the world's richest person
news_article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk is now only $20 billion away from becoming the world's richest person overtaking Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos, according to Bloomberg. The 49-year-old's net worth jumped almost $9 billion to $167.3 billion on Friday as Tesla shares soared. He has added nearly $140 billion this year, which is more than the entire net worth of Bill Gates.

news_headline: Auto industry lost ₹2,300cr a day in lockdown: Parliamentary panel
news_article: The automotive industry suffered ₹2,300 crore loss per day during the COVID-19 lockdown, according to a parliamentary panel report submitted to Rajya Sabha Chairman M Venkaiah Naidu. The sector witnessed an estimated job loss of about 3.45 lakh, the report said. All major original equipment manufacturers (OEM) cut down their production by 18-20% due to low demand, it added.

news_headline: US startup claims to have made 1st 'no charging' solar EV
news_article: US-based Aptera Motors has introduced the "first solar electric vehicle" that requires "no charging" for most daily use and has a range of up to over 1,600 kilometres per full charge. Every Aptera is designed to harvest enough sunlight to travel over 17,702 kilometres per year in most regions. Liquid-cooled electric motors propel Aptera from 0-100 kilometres/hour in 3.5 seconds.

news_headline: Apple moves self-driving car unit under exec who oversees Siri: Report
news_article: Apple has moved its self-driving car unit under the leadership of John Giannandrea, Senior Vice President of Machine Learning and AI Strategy, who also oversees the development of Apple's virtual assistant Siri, Bloomberg reported. Apple began working on its autonomous car project, known as Titan, in 2014. CEO Tim Cook in 2017 called autonomous systems "mother of all AI projects".

news_headline: Apple CFO, Apple's ex-design chief candidates for Ferrari CEO: Report
news_article: Apple CFO Luca Maestri and former Chief Design Officer Jony Ive are reportedly candidates to be Ferrari's next CEO, Reuters reported. Ferrari CEO Louis Camilleri announced his retirement earlier due to "personal reasons". Former Vodafone CEO Vittorio Colao was allegedly in the running for the position too, but Reuters said a source close to Colao has called the claim "groundless".

news_headline: Amazon's Zoox unveils autonomous EV that can travel both ways
news_article: Amazon-owned self-driving car platform Zoox has unveiled a fully autonomous electric vehicle with no steering wheel which can travel in either direction. Equipped with two battery packs, the four-seater robotaxi can run for 16 hours on a single charge and can attain a maximum speed of 120 kmph. CEO Aicha Evans said Zoox plans on launching an app-based ride-hailing service.

news_headline: Tesla asked to give ₹1 cr to used car buyer for hiding damage in China
news_article: Tesla was ordered by a Chinese court to pay over ₹1 crore to the buyer of a used Model S car after concluding it concealed structural damage on the vehicle it sold on its official website. It was reportedly discovered part of the vehicle had been cut and welded back together. Tesla will appeal the ruling to a higher court.

news_headline: Tesla teams to visit Indonesia to discuss investment in EV components
news_article: Tesla will send delegations to Indonesia next month to discuss potential investment in a supply chain for its electric vehicles. Government officials and Tesla CEO Elon Musk have discussed investment opportunities in Indonesia over a call. Indonesia earlier pointed out it has the "biggest" nickel reserves. Musk plans to offer a "giant contract for a long period of time".

news_headline: Baidu becomes 1st to get fully driverless road tests permit in Beijing
news_article: Baidu has become the first to receive permits by the Beijing transportation authorities for five of its vehicles to conduct fully driverless road tests. It plans to remove safety drivers from test vehicles after gradually reducing human intervention. However, a remote safety operator will still be able to take control in an emergency via Baidu's 5G Remote Driving Service.

news_headline: General Motors to not acquire 11% stake in Nikola
news_article: General Motors (GM) and Nikola on Monday announced a reworked deal that replaced their previous agreement under which GM would acquire 11% equity stake in the startup and produce the proposed electric pickup Badger. The companies have instead signed a non-binding memorandum of understanding which is subject to negotiation. Nikola was previously accused of fraud by a short seller.

news_headline: Musk asks Tesla staff to push output to max possible through Dec: Report
news_article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has sent an email to workers encouraging them to push output to the maximum possible through December, Bloomberg reported. "We are fortunate to have the high-class problem of demand being quite a bit higher than production this quarter," the report quoted Musk. The company has a target of delivering 5 lakh cars this year.

news_headline: Honda recalls 737,000 Accord, Insight cars in US over software flaw
news_article: Honda is recalling 737,000 Accord gas and hybrid cars from 2018 to 2020 and Insight hybrid cars from 2019 to 2020 after discovering a glitch in its software. The programming flaw in its control computer can cause the rear camera, turn signals and windshield wipers to malfunction. The move comes as part of a larger recall of 1.79-million cars worldwide.

news_headline: Tesla reveals women comprise 17% of its total US leadership roles
news_article: Tesla revealed in its first-ever US diversity report that women comprise 17% of the company's leadership roles and 21% of the overall workforce. It added that Black people make up 4% of its US leadership roles and 10% of its total workforce. "While women are historically underrepresented...we recognise we have work to do in this area," Tesla said.

news_headline: Tesla to raise $5 billion as market cap crosses $600 billion
news_article: Elon Musk-led Tesla on Tuesday announced that it will be raising $5 billion, marking its second capital raise in the last three months. The additional shares will be sold "from time to time" and "at-the-market" prices. Its shares are up nearly 670% this year with its market capitalisation crossing $600 billion. Tesla will join S&P 500 index later this month.

news_headline: Mahindra's Korean unit SsangYong defaults on $55 million loan
news_article: Automaker Mahindra & Mahindra's South Korean unit SsangYong Motor Company has defaulted on loan repayment of about $55 million. Around $27.5 million was owed to Bank of America, $18.3 million to JP Morgan Chase and $9.1 million to BNP Paribas on December 14. Mahindra has been looking for a buyer for all or most of its 75% stake since June.

news_headline: Tesla to shut down production of Model S, X for 18 days: Report
news_article: Elon Musk-led Tesla will shut down the production of its high-end Model S and Model X electric vehicles from December 24 to January 11 in Fremont, California, CNBC reported. Employees will be given a full week's pay along with few paid holidays. Deliveries of these models amounted to only 11% of total vehicle deliveries during Tesla's third quarter of 2020.

news_headline: Fiat Chrysler to invest $150 mn to set up digital hub in Hyderabad
news_article: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles (FCA) has said it will invest $150 million to set up a global digital hub in Hyderabad. The investment will help create nearly 1,000 jobs by the end of 2021. "One of the key objectives...is to digitalise every aspect of FCA's automotive operations globally and within India," Mamatha Chamarthi, CIO for North America and Asia-Pacific region, said.

news_headline: Workers of Toyota unit near B'luru to continue strike over workload
news_article: Factory workers at Toyota Kirloskar Private Limited's Bidadi unit, located near Bengaluru, announced that they will continue their ongoing strike over increased workload, among other concerns. They said that they don't get time to drink water or use the washroom. The unit has been in a lockout since November 10, after 41 workers were suspended for allegedly questioning the management.

news_headline: Volkswagen CEO reveals they began 'Mission T' to catch up with Tesla
news_article: Volkswagen CEO Herbert Diess, in a blog post, revealed he organised a three-day workshop nicknamed 'Mission T' to discuss how they could "catch up with Tesla". He added that they brought 31 senior executives from Volkswagen, Audi and Porsche together amid the COVID-19 pandemic to discuss how they could further their Project Artemis to take on Tesla.

news_headline: Delhi govt launches forum to discuss electric vehicle policy
news_article: Delhi government on Friday launched the 'Delhi EV Forum', a common platform for multiple stakeholders to hold discussions on the government's electric vehicle (EV) policy. "Delhi EV Forum will be the first such forum in India...The first meeting will be held virtually on December 18," Delhi DDC Vice Chairperson said. The policy's objective is to combat air pollution in Delhi.

news_headline: Honda shuts 23-year-old car unit in UP's Greater Noida
news_article: Honda Cars India has decided to shut its plant in Uttar Pradesh's Greater Noida, which was set up in 1997, reports said. However, the plant will continue to have its research and development set-up, spare parts division and corporate office. The automaker will rely on its facility in Rajasthan to roll out its entire product range in India, reports added.

news_headline: Tesla would consider buying a legacy automaker on friendly terms: Musk
news_article: Tesla would consider leveraging the company's $554 billion market capitalisation to buy a legacy automaker, CEO Elon Musk said in an interview with Axel Springer. "We're definitely not going to launch a hostile takeover," Musk said. "If somebody said, 'Hey, we think it would be a good idea to merge with Tesla,' we certainly could have that conversation," he added.

news_headline: ISRO successfully launches India's 42nd communication satellite CMS-01
news_article: The ISRO on Thursday successfully launched India's 42nd communication satellite from Satish Dhawan Space Centre (SDSC) SHAR, Sriharikota. The PSLV-C50 launch vehicle put the communication satellite CMS-01 in orbit, that will provide coverage for disaster management and satellite internet connection. It's the first one in a new series of communication satellites after the INSAT and the GSAT series.

news_headline: Indian-American Raja Chari selected by NASA to fly to ISS on SpaceX mission
news_article: Indian-American astronaut Raja Chari has been selected by NASA alongside two other astronauts to fly to the International Space Station (ISS) on SpaceX Crew-3 mission in 2021. It'll be the first spaceflight for Chari and Matthias Maurer, and the third for NASA astronaut Tom Marshburn. Raja Chari is the only Indian-American among 18 astronauts selected for NASA's Moon mission.

news_headline: Pics of 2020's last solar eclipse seen in parts of the world surface online
news_article: Pictures of the last solar eclipse of 2020, witnessed on December 14, have surfaced online. The total solar eclipse was visible for people living in parts of Chile and Argentina. In some parts of South America, south-west Africa and Antarctica, people witnessed a partial solar eclipse. The total solar eclipse was not visible from India.

news_headline: 'World's ugliest orchid' featured in Kew's list of 2020's top 10 discoveries
news_article: Gastrodia agnicellus, nicknamed the 'ugliest orchid in the world', has featured in Kew's list of the top 10 discoveries of the year. The orchid depends on fungi for nutrition and has no leaves or any other photosynthetic tissue. As many as 156 plant and fungal species were named by Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew, and partners worldwide in 2020.

news_headline: Videos of Geminids meteor shower surface online
news_article: Videos of the Geminids meteor shower, recognised as the best annual meteor shower a stargazer can see, have surfaced online. According to NASA, the Geminids travel 78,000 mph (35 km/s). The parent of the Geminids is 3200 Phaethon, which is arguably considered to be either an asteroid or an extinct comet, NASA said.

news_headline: How close will Jupiter, Saturn come today in 400 yrs & how can people watch it?
news_article: On Monday night, Jupiter and Saturn will be at their closest separation in the sky since 1623 at 0.1° apart. "To see the Great Conjunction, look toward the southwest after sunset: it doesn't matter where on Earth you are!" tweeted astronomer Dr James O'Donoghue. "Find a spot with...unobstructed view of the sky, such as a field or park," said NASA.

news_headline: Flies turn into 'zombies' when infected by new fungi species, scientists discover
news_article: Scientists in Denmark have discovered two new fungi species that 'zombify' flies and eject spores out of a large hole in the insect's abdomen "like small rockets". The fungi bore holes in the host but keep it alive with an amphetamine-like substance. The flies then buzz around for days, sprinkling more spores on other victims.

news_headline: 30,000 tremors hit Antarctica in 3 months: Scientists
news_article: More than 30,000 tremors have rocked Antarctica since the end of August, scientists at University of Chile said. The small earthquakes were detected in Bransfield Strait, an ocean channel between South Shetland Islands and Antarctic Peninsula. Several tectonic plates and microplates meet near the strait, leading to frequent rumbling, but the past three months have been unusual, scientists said.

news_headline: Kangaroos can ask humans for help with their gaze: Study
news_article: Kangaroos can learn to communicate with humans, a behaviour that was previously thought to be reserved for domesticated animals like dogs, by using their gaze to "point" and ask for help, a study revealed. It involved 11 kangaroos that lived in captivity. Ten of the 11 kangaroos gazed at researchers when they were unable to open a box with food.

news_headline: Dinosaur fossil found in Brazil reveals new chicken-sized species
news_article: Paleontologists have discovered a chicken-sized dinosaur species with a mane of hair down its back and stiff ribbon-like structures projecting from its shoulders. The dinosaur, Ubirajara jubatus, is believed to have lived around 110 million years ago in northeastern Brazil. "There are...strange dinosaurs, but this one is unlike any of them," said professor David Martill, who helped lead the study.

news_headline: NASA shares pic of Himalayan mountains, Delhi's city lights captured from space
news_article: NASA took to Instagram to share a picture of snow-covered Himalayan mountains and Delhi's city lights captured from space. "The bright city lights of New Delhi, India, and Lahore, Pakistan, are...visible below the faint, orange airglow of atmospheric particles reacting to solar radiation," NASA wrote. Reacting to the picture, a user wrote, "This is so beautiful."

news_headline: Japan finds pieces of asteroid inside space capsule that returned to Earth
news_article: The Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency has found pieces of an asteroid inside a space capsule delivered by the Hayabusa2 space probe. The capsule was recovered in Australia on December 6, following its journey through space. The Japanese probe collected surface dust last year from the asteroid Ryugu, around 300 million kilometres away, during two phases of its six-year mission.

news_headline: 1st known case of COVID-19 in non-captive wild mink found in US
news_article: The first known case of COVID-19 in a non-captive wild mink has been confirmed, according to an alert issued by the US Department of Agriculture. The wild mink tested positive around an infected mink farm in Utah. The strain of the virus in the wild mink is "indistinguishable" from that in infected mink on farms around the state.

news_headline: Scientists digitally rebuild dinosaur's brain, learn about its diet
news_article: The University of Bristol's scientists have "rebuilt" the brain of a Thecodontosaurus, that roamed England some 205 million years ago, using advanced imaging and 3D modelling techniques. They said unlike its plant-eating relatives, Thecodontosaurus may have eaten meat and could have walked on two legs. Experts also reconstructed its inner ears and estimated that it had a high hearing frequency.

news_headline: India to soon be manufacturing hub of space assets: PM Modi to space industry
news_article: Prime Minister Narendra Modi in his interaction with the space sector's key industries, startups and academia expressed that India will soon become a manufacturing hub of space assets. He also assured participants that they will be co-passengers with ISRO in this age of space research. He added that private investment in the sector will lead to creation of hi-tech jobs.

news_headline: Blue Origin receives NASA approval to launch future uncrewed missions
news_article: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos-owned Blue Origin has received approval from NASA to launch future unmanned scientific and exploration missions aboard its reusable New Glenn launch vehicle. Under the contract, Blue Origin will be able to compete for national security launch contracts. The New Glenn booster is not expected to make its first flight until 2021.

news_headline: ISRO's next PSLV launch to carry spacetech startup Pixxel satellite
news_article: ISRO has announced that the next PSLV-C51 launch will carry the first satellite by spacetech startup Pixxel India, 'Anand', which is an earth observation satellite, in early 2021. Along with Anand, a satellite by Space Kidz India and another by a consortium of universities will be launched. The primary payload of PSLV-C51 will be a Brazilian earth observation satellite 'Amazonia'.

news_headline: Novel skin disease in dolphins linked to climate change: Study
news_article: Scientists at The Marine Mammal Center identified a novel skin disease in dolphins that is linked to climate change. Due to decreased water salinity brought upon by climate change, the dolphins develop patchy and raised skin lesions across their bodies. The deadly skin disease was first noted on approximately 40 bottlenose dolphins near New Orleans after Hurricane Katrina in 2005.

news_headline: Workers from 27 nations building hybrid sailboat for goods to reduce pollution
news_article: Around 200 workers from 27 nations are building a hybrid sailboat, Ceiba, in Costa Rica aiming to transport goods without polluting the environment. Ceiba will rely mostly on wind power with two auxiliary electric engines for manoeuvring in ports and low winds. It will be put into operation in 2022 on routes between Canada, Ecuador and Hawaii.

news_headline: Only 10% of tropical forests left in Indonesia fire-resistant: Study
news_article: A Swansea University's researchers-led study has revealed only 10% of the tropical forests left in Indonesia remains fire-resistant. The rest has been severely fragmented or degraded and therefore is no longer able to maintain a fire-resistant microclimate. An area of tropical forest and peatland larger than the Netherlands has burned in Indonesia in the past five years, according to Greenpeace.

news_headline: China to open world's largest radio telescope to int'l scientists
news_article: China will open the world's largest radio telescope for use by foreign astronomers. The Five-hundred-meter Aperture Spherical radio Telescope (FAST) has a diameter of half a kilometre and a receiving area equivalent to about 30 football fields. China has said it will accept requests in 2021 from foreign scientists wishing to carry out measurements.

news_headline: Chinese spacecraft brings 1st lunar samples in over 40 years
news_article: China's Chang'e-5 probe successfully landed in the northern Chinese region, bringing back the first lunar rocks and soil retrieved by any country in over 40 years. China is now the third country to have retrieved lunar samples. It will be sharing a portion of the lunar soil with other nations and organisations based on international cooperation conventions.

news_headline: US Space Force personnel will be called 'Guardians': Vice Prez
news_article: The members of the US Space Force will be called "Guardians", Vice President Mike Pence announced at an event celebrating Space Force's first anniversary. "The name Guardians connects our proud heritage and culture to the important mission we execute 24/7, protecting the people and interest of the US and its allies," the Space Force tweeted.

news_headline: Potentially damaging surface ozone levels rose in lockdown in UK: Study
news_article: The University of York has revealed less traffic on the roads during the first lockdown may have caused potentially damaging surface ozone levels to rise in the UK. The study said levels of nitrogen dioxide fell by 42% on average and surface ozone increased by 11%. The first lockdown levels of O3 were the worst in the South of England.

news_headline: 'Forever chemicals' used in outdoor gear found in snow on Mt Everest: Study
news_article: "Forever chemicals" used in water-repellent outdoor gear have been found in snow near Mount Everest's summit, University of Maine reported. A research assistant professor at the university said these human-made PFAS could eventually pose a risk for residents who drink the water. This marks the first time that Everest snow and meltwater has been analysed for PFAS, the professor said.

news_headline: Unleashing world’s best processor for thin & light laptops: Intel
news_article: Intel launched next-generation mobile PC processors which it believes are a major leap forward in processor performance. New 11th Gen Intel® Core™ processors with Intel® Iris® Xe graphics are the world's best processors for thin and light laptops, it said. These processors have unmatched capabilities for real-world productivity, collaboration, creation, gaming and entertainment, the company added.

news_headline: Facebook restores Kisan Ekta Morcha page as #ShameOnFacebook trends
news_article: Facebook on Sunday had briefly blocked Kisan Ekta Morcha's page on Facebook and Instagram, where several farmers’ groups post updates of their ongoing agitation against the new agriculture laws. The page was restored after around 3 hours, as #ShameOnFacebook and #ZuckerbergShameOnYou started trending on Twitter. Facebook claimed the page had gone against its community standards on spam.

news_headline: Automated systems marked Kisan Ekta Morcha page as spam: Facebook
