news_headline: US President's official Twitter account to be reset to zero for Biden
news_article: Twitter has informed President-elect Joe Biden's team that he won't inherit Donald Trump's 33 million followers on the official President of the United States Twitter account, @POTUS, when he assumes the presidency. The White House Twitter account (@WhiteHouse) with 26 million followers will also be reset to zero. In 2017, Twitter transferred followers of Obama administration accounts to Trump.

news_headline: CMGE refutes report that it plans to sell stake to TikTok parent
news_article: Chinese mobile gaming firm CMGE has said it is not in talks to sell a stake to TikTok-parent ByteDance, refuting an earlier Reuters report. Earlier, Reuters had reported that ByteDance plans to buy part or all of the 27.6% CMGE stake held by Fairview Ridge Investment. The stake is controlled by CMGE Chairman Jian Xiao and Vice Chairman​ Hendrick Sin.

news_headline: Facebook, Google agreed to team up against possible antitrust action: WSJ
news_article: Facebook and Google agreed to "cooperate and assist one another" in case their pact to work together in online advertising was investigated, the Wall Street Journal reported. It cited the antitrust lawsuit filed by US states against Google, which accused Facebook and Google of colluding to consolidate their market power illegally. Such agreements are extremely common, a Google spokesperson said.

news_headline: Aramco teams up with Google to offer cloud services in Saudi Arabia
news_article: A subsidiary of Saudi Aramco has teamed up with Google Cloud to offer cloud services to customers in Saudi Arabia. Google Cloud will establish and operate a new cloud region in Saudi Arabia. A new company will also be formed after the required regulatory clearances to supply cloud solutions and services to customers.

news_headline: Was told my heavy accent was a 'disability' at Google: Ex-employee
news_article: A former diversity recruiter at Google has claimed that she was told that her way of speaking, with a heavy Baltimore accent, was a "disability". She added that she "experienced active abuse and retaliation from several managers" due to her "adamant advocacy" for black and brown students for roles at Google. She was later allegedly fired from Google.

news_headline: Social media lets us tell truth: Farmers on suspension of Facebook page
news_article: Following the brief suspension of the Kisan Ekta Morcha's Facebook page, the protestors said that social media was crucial for their movement as it helps them tell their truth in their own words. Facebook shutting down the page was an "attempt to silence" them, they added. Facebook said the page was marked spam by automated systems due to increased activity.

news_headline: Apple aiming to produce self-driving car by 2024: Report
news_article: Apple is aiming for a 2024 launch for its self-driving passenger vehicle that could include its own breakthrough battery technology, Reuters reported. Apple's automotive unit, codenamed Project Titan, was started in 2014 with a former Tesla executive at its helm. Apple is also reportedly working on a new battery that would increase the vehicle’s range and also be "radically" cheaper.

news_headline: Microsoft, Google join Facebook in lawsuit against hacking firm NSO
news_article: A coalition of tech companies including Microsoft, Google, Cisco and Dell have joined Facebook-owned WhatsApp in its legal case against Israeli hacking firm NSO Group, which develops and sells Pegasus spyware. It was found that NSO had helped surveil more than 1,400 people by exploiting a bug in WhatsApp. Its Pegasus had also affected Indian journalists, activists and lawmakers.

news_headline: Facebook to offer enhanced security to journalists, celebs in 2021
news_article: Facebook will expand Facebook Protect security programme, that is offered to US politicians, to more types of accounts next year. It will be made available to vulnerable users like journalists, human rights defenders and celebrities and also to users in countries with upcoming major elections. It includes additional security provisions and real-time monitoring for potential hacking threats.

news_headline: Google denies antitrust claims in response to US lawsuit
news_article: In its first formal response, Google has denied claims made by the US Department of Justice in the antitrust lawsuit which accused Google of abusing its search dominance. "People use Google Search because they choose to, not because they are forced to," Google said. It added that iPhone and Android users could switch to search platforms like Bing and DuckDuckGo.

news_headline: Wipro takes over METRO AG's IT operations in $700 mn deal
news_article: Wipro on Tuesday announced a strategic digital and IT partnership deal with Germany-based METRO AG, which is estimated to be valued at $700 million for the first five years. As part of the deal, Wipro will take over METRO AG's IT units and over 1,300 employees will be transferred to Wipro. The deal could extend for an additional four years.

news_headline: Booking.com accused of violating anti-monopoly law by Russia
news_article: The Federal Antimonopoly Service (FAS) of Russia has accused hotel reservation platform Booking.com of violating the anti-monopoly law, claiming it abused its dominant market position. FAS investigated the company for asking hotels to offer the same prices on their own and rival booking websites as on Booking.com. The company can be fined 1-15% of its annual revenue generated in Russia.

news_headline: Australia rejects Google's undertaking for Fitbit's $2.1 bn acquisition
news_article: The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC) has rejected an undertaking by Google that addressed the regulator's competition concerns over its $2.1 billion acquisition of Fitbit. Google had agreed to not use Fitbit users' health data for advertising and to behave in certain ways towards rival wearable manufacturers. Earlier, the EU approved Google's acquisition of Fitbit.

news_headline: Intel investigating if it has been affected by SolarWinds cyberattack
news_article: US chipmaker Intel on Tuesday said it is investigating if the company has been a victim of the SolarWinds cyberattack that affected US government agencies and several companies. "We currently see no evidence or indication that our systems were affected," Intel said in a statement. Nvidia also said it is looking into whether its systems were illicitly accessed.

news_headline: Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey unfollows Trump, Biden
news_article: Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey has unfollowed President Donald Trump and President-elect Joe Biden on the social media platform, according to a Twitter account that tracks the activity of Silicon Valley tech leaders. Dorsey also unfollowed first daughter Ivanka Trump and Vice President-elect Kamala Harris. Dorsey also called the US stimulus bill "incredibly disappointing and increasingly irrelevant".

news_headline: Our tech industry at forefront of solving global issues: PM Modi
news_article: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, while addressing the India International Science Festival, said India's tech industry is at the "forefront of solving global problems but India wants to do more". He said, "India has a rich legacy in science, technology and innovation. Our scientists have done path-breaking research." He added science and technology are bridging the gap of scarcity and impact.

news_headline: Chandigarh man sues Facebook Director over disabled account
news_article: Aditya Pratap Singh Nain, a Chandigarh resident, has filed a civil suit against Facebook Director after his Facebook account was "arbitrarily" disabled. Nain submitted that on November 4, he was asked to send a photo of his ID proof before logging into his account. The account was later allegedly disabled and no reason was provided to Nain.

news_headline: 6 held for running online money-lending racket via apps in Hyd
news_article: Six people have been arrested in Hyderabad for running a multi-state online money-lending racket and their bank accounts, worth ₹1.52 crore, have been frozen. The police probed the racket after receiving complaints from victims who had obtained small loans from online lending firms through various mobile apps available on Google Play Store. Google has been asked to remove the apps.

news_headline: 40 anti-LGBT groups fundraising on Amazon's charity programme: Report
news_article: A report by openDemocracy revealed that over 40 US-based anti-LGBT groups are fundraising on Amazon's charitable donation programme, AmazonSmile. The report included groups that have intervened in international cases opposing same-sex marriage and anti-discrimination laws. "If at any point an organisation violates [the] agreement, its eligibility will be revoked," Amazon told Business Insider.

news_headline: Apple shares rise on report of self-driving car launch by 2024
news_article: Apple's shares jumped nearly 5% on Tuesday, following a Reuters report of the company aiming to launch its self-driving passenger car by 2024. Shares of Velodyne Lidar, a supplier of lidar systems for Apple's fleet of self-driving test vehicles, rose 14%. Apple's automotive unit, known as Project Titan, was established in 2014 with a former Tesla executive at its helm.

news_headline: Facebook offered to help create rivals to avoid antitrust lawsuits: Report
news_article: Facebook offered to license its code to others, helping them create rival social networks in order to avoid antitrust lawsuits, The Washington Post reported. This would have underscored Facebook's "commitment to competition". However, the antitrust investigators decided the code and other proposed concessions weren't enough to address competitive issues.

news_headline: Illegal streaming to be a crime under US' $900 bn COVID-19 relief bill
news_article: The $900 billion COVID-19 relief package that was passed in US' House of Representatives on Monday will make illegal streaming for profit a crime with penalties of up to 10 years of imprisonment. The bill also includes a copyright bill called the CASE Act under which internet users could be fined up to $30,000 for copyright claims and order payments.

news_headline: Google leads $145 mn fundraise in InMobi's Glance
news_article: InMobi's mobile-first content platform Glance has raised $145 million in fresh funding led by Google, along with participation from billionaire Peter Thiel's Mithril Capital. This funding round has helped Glance enter the unicorn club as it has been valued at over $1 billion, reported Mint. Google's investment comes as a part of its $10 billion India Digitization Fund.

news_headline: Cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal marries YouTuber Dhanashree Verma, shares pics
news_article: Team India leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal got married to YouTuber and choreographer Dhanashree Verma on Tuesday. The 30-year-old took to Instagram to share pictures from the wedding and wrote, "We started at 'Once upon a time' and found 'Our happily ever after', coz finally, #DhanaSaidYuz for infinity and beyond!" The duo had got engaged in August this year.

news_headline: Raina, Randhawa booked after 2:30 am Mumbai pub raid over COVID-19 norms
news_article: Cricketer Suresh Raina and singer Guru Randhawa were booked in Mumbai after a raid at the Dragonfly nightclub at 2:30 am on Tuesday. A total of 34 people, including staff members, were booked in the raid at the pub for keeping establishment open beyond permissible time limit and not following COVID-19 norms, said Mumbai Police.

news_headline: Party nahi chalegi till 6 in the morning: Police on catching celebs at pub at 3 am
news_article: After celebrities like Suresh Raina and Guru Randhawa were caught at a nightclub in Mumbai's Andheri at 3 am following a raid, the Mumbai Police tweeted, "Party (Nahin) Chalegi Till Six In The Morning!" It added, "Action has been initiated against 34 people, out of which 19 were from Delhi and Punjab, including some celebrities #NewNormal."

news_headline: Man, who bought Cobain's guitar for ₹44cr, buys Bradman's 1st baggy green for ₹2.5cr
news_article: Australian businessman Peter Freedman purchased Sir Donald Bradman’s first-ever baggy green cap for AU$450,000 (₹2.5 crore) after it failed to sell at auction last week. Freedman, the founder of Rode Microphones who earlier this year paid $6 million (₹44 crore) to win an auction for a guitar used by Kurt Cobain, plans to tour Bradman’s Test debut cap around Australia.

news_headline: I couldn't spot the ball: NZ batsman as Sun stopped play during T20I
news_article: New Zealand batsman Glenn Phillips said he wasn't able to spot the ball due to sun-glare during his team's innings against Pakistan in third T20I in Napier. The match was stopped due to sunlight during New Zealand's 12th over and was resumed after sunset. "You have to love cricket, it will stop for any reason, no problem," a fan tweeted.

news_headline: Raina wasn't aware of local protocols: Cricketer's manager on Mumbai pub incident
news_article: After Mumbai Police booked 34 people including Suresh Raina after a raid at a Mumbai pub over COVID-19 norms at 3 am, the cricketer's manager issued a statement. He said, "Raina was not aware of the local timings and protocols. Once pointed out, he immediately complied with the procedures laid out by the authorities and regrets the incident."

news_headline: Who gave people the right to troll Anushka: Pragyan Ojha after India's defeat
news_article: After several social media users trolled captain Virat Kohli's actress-wife Anushka Sharma following India's defeat in the first Test against Australia, ex-India cricketer Pragyan Ojha asked people to not drag cricketers' personal lives. "Yes, we are all upset that we lost but that doesn't give people the right to troll...How can you drag anybody's family into all this?" Ojha added.

news_headline: Steve Smith reacts to Ian Chappell's remark on bouncers, calls it 'bizarre'
news_article: Reacting to ex-Australia captain Ian Chappell calling on umpires to protect tailenders from facing bouncers, Steve Smith said, "It seems like Chappell has a bizarre statement after every match." He added, "Short balls are part of the game...We've seen over the years there've been some really good battles and I don’t think they should be outlawed at all,” he added.

news_headline: Kallis appointed as England’s batting consultant for Sri Lanka Test tour
news_article: On Monday, former South Africa all-rounder Jacques Kallis was named as England batting consultant for their two-test tour of Sri Lanka next month. It is yet to be confirmed whether Kallis would continue as batting consultant for subsequent tour of India in February. In last 12 months, former England batsmen Jonathan Trott and Marcus Trescothick have also filled the post.

news_headline: Horrible to play without fans, it's a very ugly sensation: Messi
news_article: Lionel Messi has said that it's "horrible" and "ugly" to play without fans amid the coronavirus pandemic. On Barcelona being fifth in La Liga standings, Messi explained, "Seeing no one in the stadium is like a training session and it's very tough to get going at the start of a game...that's why we are seeing such evenly matched games."

news_headline: No hope, can't see how India can bounce back after Adelaide: Mark Waugh
news_article: On being asked whether India can bounce back after the Adelaide Test defeat, former Australia batsman Mark Waugh said, "No hope, no hope." He added, "Australia whitewashed them on the third day. So 'no' is the answer, four-nil to Australia." India lost the Test by eight wickets after posting their lowest-ever Test total of 36/9 in the second innings.

news_headline: India's confidence would take a hit: Hussey on Shami's injury
news_article: On Mohammad Shami being reportedly ruled out of the remaining Tests against Australia after suffering a fracture in his arm, former Australian cricketer Michael Hussey said that the unavailability of the pacer will be a "hammer blow" for India. "I think [Team India's] confidence would have really taken a hit and there'll be a few doubts in mind," Hussey added.

news_headline: It's not about whether Smith should take over, it's about what's best: CA
news_article: Amid calls for Steve Smith to be reinstated as captain, Cricket Australia chairman Earl Eddings has said that it's not about whether Smith should take over, but what's best for the Team "overall". "Steve's a great young man and was a good captain when he was there. Like any succession, there's planning in place," he added.

news_headline: With Kohli gone, want to see where India get their energy from: Brad Haddin
news_article: Former Australia wicketkeeper-batsman Brad Haddin has said that he wants to see where India will get their energy in the absence of Virat Kohli in the upcoming Tests against Australia. "A lot of energy comes off the back of what Kohli does [during the match]...now I think they need a senior player like [Rohit Sharma]," he added.

news_headline: Pakistan defeat NZ by 4 wickets in 3rd T20I, lose series 1-2
news_article: Pakistan on Tuesday defeated New Zealand by four wickets after Mohammad Rizwan scored his career-best 89 off 59 balls to help the visitors chase down the 173-run total. New Zealand had already secured the series, winning the first two games by five wickets and nine wickets respectively. Both sides will now play the two-Test series, commencing on December 26.

news_headline: Need to go with five bowlers, captain Rahane should bat at No. 4: Gambhir
news_article: Former India opener Gautam Gambhir has advised Team India to play five specialist bowlers in the second Test against Australia and has asked captain Ajinkya Rahane to bat at number four in Virat Kohli's absence. "I won't want him to stay at number five because if he is the captain now, he has to lead from the front," Gambhir said.

news_headline: Don’t think India will recover from the loss at Adelaide: Brad Haddin
news_article: Former Australia wicket-keeper Brad Haddin feels it won't be possible for Team India to recover from the eight-wicket loss in the first Test at Adelaide. "I thought their only opportunity to win a Test match was the first Test at Adelaide," Haddin said. "I don't think they will be able to turn it around," Haddin added.

news_headline: Djokovic, Federer, Nadal bag honours at ATP awards for 2020
news_article: Novak Djokovic, Roger Federer, Rafael Nadal were among the winners at the ATP awards 2020 on Monday. Djokovic ended the year as world number one singles player for record-equaling sixth time. Federer was the singles fans' favourite for a record-extending 18th straight year. Meanwhile, Nadal received the Stefan Edberg Sportsmanship Award for the third year straight and fourth time overall.

news_headline: Let it go and move on, keep a positive mindset: Smith advises Team India
news_article: Australia's Steve Smith has asked Team India to forget and move on after the visitors got dismissed for 36 in the second innings of the first Test. "You got to let it go...try and keep yourself in a positive mindset," Smith said. "It's important to keep moving forward, look at yourself individually, what you could have done better," Smith added.

news_headline: Footballer Marcus Thuram handed five-match ban for spitting in opponent's face
news_article: Borussia Monchengladbach's French striker Marcus Thuram was banned for five games by German football federation for spitting in Hoffenheim defender Stefan Posch's face on Saturday. The ban applies to the German Cup and Bundesliga and that a further one-game ban is suspended on condition of good behaviour until December 21, 2021. Thuram has to also pay a fine of $50,000.

news_headline: India need to remember they were ahead for 2 days in 1st Test: Gambhir
news_article: Ahead of the Boxing Day Test against Australia, former India opener Gautam Gambhir has said that Team India need to forget the Adelaide defeat and remember that they were ahead for two days in the match. "[For the Melbourne Test, India's batsmen need to] think about scoring 200-250 runs and give...bowlers runs on the board," he added.

news_headline: Atmosphere wrongly created that Saha can't bat, Pant can't keep wickets: Aakash
news_article: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said that a wrong atmosphere has been created regarding Wriddhiman Saha and Rishabh Pant's skills on the field. "Atmosphere has been created that Pant is a bad keeper. How is that the case, as he takes very good catches; and Saha cannot bat; how can he not as he has a Test century," he stated.

news_headline: Shaw may be better suited to bat in the middle-order: Hogg
news_article: Former Australia cricketer Brad Hogg has suggested that 21-year-old Prithvi Shaw, who scored zero and four in Adelaide Test as an opener, might be better suited to bat in the middle-order. "Shaw has made a lot of runs in domestic cricket, so he has talent...his technique will be better suited [in the middle-order]," Hogg stated.

news_headline: David Warner, Sean Abbott ruled out of Boxing Day Test against India
news_article: Cricket Australia has confirmed that David Warner won't be playing the second Test against India as he continues to recover from his groin injury. Meanwhile, pacer Sean Abbott will also be missing the Melbourne Test, despite recovering from his calf strain, due to Cricket Australia's strict bio-security protocols. The duo spent time outside the bio-bubble in Sydney during their recovery.

news_headline: Ashwin is a world-class performer, hope to play him better in next game: Smith
news_article: Australia's Steve Smith called Ravichandran Ashwin a "world-class performer" and said he hopes he would "play him little better" in the upcoming Tests. "He is a good bowler...I know he got the better of me the other day, hopefully, I'll learn something and move forward," said Smith. Ashwin dismissed Smith in his first over in the first Test in Adelaide.

news_headline: No continent left untouched by COVID-19 as 58 people test +ve in Antarctica
news_article: COVID-19 has reached every continent on Earth as at least 58 people tested positive in Antarctica. Chile's army announced 36 people at General Bernardo O'Higgins Riquelme Antarctic base tested positive, and later, Health Minister for Chile's Biobio region said there are 21 infections involving people aboard Chilean navy's Sergeant Aldea vessel. One more case was reported in Las Estrellas village.

news_headline: 1 person died of COVID-19 every 33 seconds in US' deadliest week: Reuters
news_article: Someone died from COVID-19 every 33 seconds in the US in its deadliest week last week, according to a Reuters analysis of state and county reports. Coronavirus claimed more than 18,000 lives in the seven days ending December 20. The states of Iowa, South Dakota and Rhode Island were the worst hit in terms of deaths per capita, Reuters said.

news_headline: Taiwan reports 1st local COVID-19 case in 253 days, blames pilot
news_article: Taiwan on Tuesday reported its first locally transmitted case of COVID-19 since April, blaming a pilot from New Zealand for the transmission. The locally-transmitted case was a woman who had close contact with the pilot, who was himself confirmed to have been infected. He had allegedly not correctly reported all his contacts and list of places he had been.

news_headline: US President's official Twitter account to be reset to zero for Biden
news_article: Twitter has informed President-elect Joe Biden's team that he won't inherit Donald Trump's 33 million followers on the official President of the United States Twitter account, @POTUS, when he assumes the presidency. The White House Twitter account (@WhiteHouse) with 26 million followers will also be reset to zero. In 2017, Twitter transferred followers of Obama administration accounts to Trump.

news_headline: Jupiter and Saturn come closest in night sky after 397 years, pics go viral
news_article: Jupiter and Saturn came closer than any time in 397 years on Monday night in the event dubbed 'Great Conjunction'. The two planets were at their closest separation at 0.1° apart. The event was visible with the unaided eye as well. The pictures above include the event as seen from New Delhi, Las Vegas and New York among others.

news_headline: Who's Zhao Zongqi, the removed PLA commander under whom Galwan clash took place?
news_article: Chinese President Xi Jinping has moved out General Zhao Zongqi, who headed People's Liberation Army's Western Theatre Command during the violent clash with the Indian Army in Ladakh's Galwan Valley. The 2017 Doklam standoff with India also took place under his watch. The 65-year-old joined the PLA in 1984 and started heading the western command in 2016.

news_headline: Putin signs law allowing Russia's ex-presidents to become Senators for life
news_article: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday signed legislation that allows former presidents to become lawmakers for life in Russia's upper house of parliament once they leave the office. The legislation would allow presidents to name up to 30 Senators to the Federation Council, Russia's upper house. Putin earlier signed a law allowing him to run for two more terms.

news_headline: Brazilian woman enslaved as maid for 38 yrs & forced into marriage, rescued
news_article: A Brazilian woman enslaved as a maid from the age of eight for 38 years and forced into marriage was rescued in a rare crackdown on domestic slavery, officials said. Madalena Gordiano had worked without pay or any time off. She was given up by her parents to the family of a professor and was raised by his mother.

news_headline: People were slaughtered like chickens: Ethiopia war eyewitness
news_article: Speaking about the conflict between Ethiopia's federal government of Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed and the Tigray People's Liberation Front (TPLF), an eyewitness said that people had been "slaughtered" like chickens and their corpses abandoned to be "eaten by hyenas". "All government assets have been destroyed and looted," another eyewitness said.

news_headline: Madhav Kumar Nepal replaces PM Oli as Nepal Communist Party chief
news_article: Madhav Kumar Nepal has replaced Nepal Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli as Chairman of the Nepal Communist Party after 315 central committee members voted in his favour, party spokesperson Narayan Kaji Shrestha said. The party will also be taking disciplinary action against Oli, he added. This comes after President Bidya Devi Bhandari ratified PM Oli's proposal to dissolve the Parliament.

news_headline: Nude pics of Thai King's mistress leaked, sent to anti-monarchy activists
news_article: More than 1,000 photographs, many of them nude, of King of Thailand's mistress Sineenat Wongvajirapakdi have been leaked and sent to anti-monarchy activists. The pictures were taken between 2012 and 2014. In September, King Maha Vajiralongkorn had reinstated Sineenat and returned the official titles and military rank to her, nearly a year after she was removed from the position.

news_headline: It's a disgrace: Trump as he rejects $900bn COVID-19 relief bill
news_article: US President Donald Trump on Tuesday rejected a $900 billion COVID-19 relief bill, saying that the package "really is a disgrace". Trump urged Congress to amend the bill and increase stimulus payments from "$600 to $2,000, or $4,000 for a couple". "It's called the COVID-19 relief bill, but it has almost nothing to do with COVID-19," he further said.

news_headline: UK PM's India trip might not be possible: Senior British doctor
news_article: UK PM Boris Johnson's India visit might not be possible due to new COVID-19 strain, "particularly if this level of infection and spread continues", Dr Chaand Nagpaul, Chair of British Medical Association's Council said. However, it's still early for the government to decide on the visit, he added. Johnson has been invited as Chief Guest for India's Republic Day parade.

news_headline: Bhutan announces 1-week nationwide lockdown to combat coronavirus
news_article: The Bhutan government on Tuesday said that it would impose a nationwide lockdown for seven days, starting from Wednesday, to curb the spread of coronavirus. During the lockdown period, only designated shops within the zones and essential services will be allowed to function, the government added. All schools, institutions, offices and business establishments will remain closed.

news_headline: US infectious-disease expert Fauci gets COVID-19 vaccine on camera
news_article: US top infectious-disease expert Dr Anthony Fauci and other senior health officials received a dose of Moderna coronavirus vaccine on camera on Tuesday. Fauci said he was taking the vaccine "as a symbol" for American people to encourage them about the "safety and the efficacy of this vaccine". The US is the worst coronavirus-hit country with over 1.8 crore cases.

news_headline: Singapore gets Asia's 1st Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine doses
news_article: Singapore has received its first shipment of Pfizer-BioNTech's COVID-19 vaccine, making it the first country in Asia to do so. The country had approved the vaccine last week. Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong said that authorities will announce details of a rollout in due course. Singapore has planned to inoculate its 5.7 million population by the third quarter of 2021.

news_headline: Antarctica records COVID-19 cases for the first time: Reports
news_article: Antarctica has recorded its first cases of COVID-19, becoming the world's last continent to get affected by the pandemic, according to reports. At least 36 people have been infected at a Chilean research base, including members of the Chilean army, reports said. Those who tested positive have been evacuated to Chile's Punta Arenas and are reportedly under isolation.

news_headline: Aus names over 100 venues in Sydney as potential COVID-19 hotspots
news_article: Australian officials in New South Wales have named over 100 venues across Sydney as potential COVID-19 hotspots. The officials have also instructed thousands of people who visited these venues to self-isolate and also get themselves tested. Last week, all Australian states and territories had imposed travel restrictions on Sydney residents over the recent COVID-19 outbreak in the city.

news_headline: Illegal streaming to be a crime under US' $900 bn COVID-19 relief bill
news_article: The $900 billion COVID-19 relief package that was passed in US' House of Representatives on Monday will make illegal streaming for profit a crime with penalties of up to 10 years of imprisonment. The bill also includes a copyright bill called the CASE Act under which internet users could be fined up to $30,000 for copyright claims and order payments.

news_headline: Farmers to write to UK MPs to stop Johnson's visit until demands are met
news_article: Farmers' unions will write to British MPs and ask them to stop UK PM Boris Johnson from visiting India until the Centre meets farmers' demands, Kulwant Singh Sandhu, farmer leader, said. Earlier, India invited Johnson to be the Chief Guest for Republic Day parade. Sandhu also urged the Punjabi community to protest in front of Indian embassies across the world.

news_headline: Israel heads for 4th election in 2 years after Parliament dissolved
news_article: Israel's Parliament has been dissolved after PM Benjamin Netanyahu-led unity government failed to pass a budget before a Tuesday midnight deadline. The country will be heading for its fourth parliamentary election in two years, likely to be held in March. Netanyahu and his coalition partner, Blue and White leader Benny Gantz, blamed each other for collapse of their seven-month-old government.

news_headline: Alex Padilla to replace VP-elect Kamala Harris in US Senate
news_article: California State Secretary Alex Padilla has been named as US Vice President-elect Kamala Harris' replacement in the US Senate, becoming the first Latino to represent California in the nation's upper house. Padilla will hold the Senate seat until 2022, when Harris' term ends. Padilla pledged to "work each and every day to honour that trust and deliver for all Californians".

news_headline: US Congress passes bill on next Dalai Lama; China opposes
news_article: US Congress on Tuesday passed a bill that reaffirms the right of Tibetans to choose a successor to their spiritual leader, the Dalai Lama. "Any interference by Chinese officials will be met with serious sanctions," Central Tibetan Administration said. China accused US of meddling in its internal affairs and warned US President Donald Trump against signing the legislation into law.

news_headline: Will take countermeasures: China on US' new visa restrictions
news_article: Reacting to US' new visa restrictions on Chinese officials over alleged human rights abuses, China said it would take countermeasures against those responsible. US has severely interfered in our internal affairs by using visas as a weapon, China added. Announcing the restrictions, US had accused "China's authoritarian rulers" of imposing "draconian restrictions" on people's freedoms of expression.

news_headline: Israel PM gives Jared Kushner 'certificate of appreciation'
news_article: Israel PM Benjamin Netanyahu has presented a "certificate of appreciation" to US President Donald Trump's adviser Jared Kushner. He was given the certificate for his contribution to the "normalisation of Israel's relations with the Arab and Muslim world, and to peace in the Middle East". Kushner joined an Israeli delegation on the first direct flight to Morocco on Tuesday.

news_headline: AAP ready to contest on all 70 seats in 2022 U'khand polls: Manish Sisodia
news_article: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Monday said AAP is ready to contest on all 70 seats in the next Uttarakhand Assembly elections. "People from Uttarakhand visit us and say that the way AAP government worked in Delhi, they should come to power in Uttarakhand too," he added. "They're unhappy with the government under CM Trivendra Singh Rawat," Sisodia said.

news_headline: We've prioritised 30 crore people for COVID-19 vaccine: Health Minister
news_article: Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan on Monday said the Centre has prioritised 30 crore people for a vaccine against the novel coronavirus. He said, "It includes health workers, frontline workers like police, military and sanitation staff, people above 50 years of age and those who are below 50 years but are suffering from certain diseases like blood pressure and diabetes."

news_headline: Garbage of lies: Mamata on Amit Shah’s claims on Bengal’s development
news_article: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee described the figures given by Home Minister Amit Shah on the state's position on various parameters as "garbage of lies". "He (Shah) said we are a zero in industry. We are number one in MSME. He also said we have not made village roads. We are number one on that count too," Banerjee said.

news_headline: Prove me wrong or treat me with dhokla: Mamata to Shah over development data
news_article: Countering Home Minister Amit Shah over data on development in West Bengal, CM Mamata Banerjee said, "I challenge Home Minister to prove me wrong or treat me with dhokla." She said Central government data shows West Bengal is "number 1, in poor eradication in India, rural housing, skill development". Political killings and other crimes decreased under TMC rule, she added.

news_headline: PM Modi proposes library for traditional Buddhist literature in India
news_article: Speaking at the Indo-Japan Samwad Conference on Monday, PM Narendra Modi proposed to create a library of traditional Buddhist literature and scriptures in India. He said the library will collect digital copies of all such Buddhist literature from different countries. "It will aim to translate them, and make them freely available for all monks and scholars of Buddhism," he added.

news_headline: BJP MP Saumitra Khan to send divorce notice to wife Sujata after she joins TMC
news_article: After his wife Sujata Mondal Khan joined TMC, BJP MP Saumitra Khan described her decision as a "big mistake" and said he'll soon send her a divorce notice. "You have chosen politics over family. You have been trapped," Saumitra added. Speaking about her decision, Sujata said, "It's my decision today and who guarantees that Saumitra won't join me in future?"

news_headline: Temple donation drive akin to poll campaigning in Lord Ram's name: Sena
news_article: The Shiv Sena on Monday alleged that the initiative to collect funds from the public for the Ram temple construction in Ayodhya is akin to "campaigning" for the 2024 general elections in the name of Lord Ram. "The political campaigning of Lord Ram's name has to be stopped at some point of time," said Sena. BJP has refuted the allegation.

news_headline: Chhattisgarh govt announces 3-day state mourning on Motilal Vora's demise
news_article: The Chhattisgarh government has declared a three-day state mourning till December 23 on the demise of former Madhya Pradesh CM and veteran Congress leader Motilal Vora, on Monday. The state government said it has also decided that the last rites of Motilal Vora would be performed with state honour. PM Narendra Modi also expressed condolences on the veteran leader's demise.

news_headline: Azad Samaj Party will fight UP Panchayat polls: Chandrashekhar Azad
news_article: Bhim Army chief Chandrashekhar Azad on Tuesday said his party will field candidates in the upcoming Panchayat polls in Uttar Pradesh. The Azad Samaj Party will field candidates in Panchayat polls before the 2022 Assembly polls, said Chandrashekhar in Azamgarh. He went there to meet the DM over alleged delay in providing help to a Dalit village head killed recently.

news_headline: MP Youth Congress mistakenly elects BJP leader as general secretary
news_article: Madhya Pradesh Youth Congress (YC) mistakenly elected Harshit Singhai, a leader now in BJP, as its general secretary of Jabalpur (uttar) unit in the elections that concluded on Friday. "Soon after the goof-up was brought to my notice, his (Singhai's) appointment was cancelled with immediate effect," YC's spokesperson said. Singhai had left Congress and joined BJP after Jyotiraditya Scindia.

news_headline: Veteran Congress leader Motilal Vora passes away a day after his 93rd birthday
news_article: Veteran Congress leader and former Madhya Pradesh CM Motilal Vora passed away on Monday, a day after celebrating his 93rd birthday. He was admitted to Fortis Escorts Hospital in Delhi due to urine infection, according to reports. The leader was infected with coronavirus but had recovered and got discharged in October.

news_headline: Gupkar alliance maintains overall lead; BJP emerges single largest party: Trends
news_article: The Peoples Alliance for Gupkar Declaration (PAGD), an amalgam of seven political parties, has won over 90 seats while BJP emerged as the single largest party winning 65 seats as per current trends. Counting of votes for the 280 DDCs in J&K is still underway. Notably, 39 seats were bagged by Independent candidates, while Congress won 20 seats.

news_headline: Azam Khan's wife secures bail, released after 10 months in jail
news_article: Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan's wife Tazeen Fatima, who is also an SP MLA, was released from Sitapur jail on Monday after securing bail in a forgery case. "Her bail has proved that those who indulge in hate politics, lose in the end," SP chief Akhilesh Yadav tweeted. "This is a victory for those who believe in justice," Yadav added.

news_headline: BJP abolished Triple Talaq but asked my husband to divorce me: TMC's Sujata
news_article: After BJP leader Saumitra Khan sent a legal divorce notice to his wife Sujata Mondal who recently joined TMC, Sujata said, "The party that abolished Triple Talaq is asking Saumitra to divorce me today." She added, "Still today I love Saumitra...I am still wearing sindoor (vermilion) of his name...Ours was a love marriage. How can it end in a day?"

news_headline: PM Modi will not let farmers get hurt: Rajnath Singh on Farmers' Day
news_article: On the occasion of the birth anniversary of former PM Chaudhary Charan Singh, which is celebrated as Farmers' Day, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi will not let the farmers get hurt. He added the government is holding talks with farmers with "full sensitivity". He said that he hoped the farmers will withdraw their movement soon.

news_headline: J&K DDC election result trends show Gupkar Alliance leading over BJP
news_article: With the counting of votes underway for the 280 seats in the Jammu and Kashmir District Development Council (DDC) polls, the Peoples Alliance for Gupkar Declaration (PAGD) is holding a lead over BJP. The PAGD alliance is leading in 71 seats whereas BJP is leading in 48. Congress is leading in 19 seats and has bagged four seats so far.

news_headline: Will consider framing CAA rules after COVID vaccination starts: Shah
news_article: Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday said the rules of the Citizenship (Amendment) Act were yet to be framed as such a huge process could not be conducted during the coronavirus pandemic. He added, "As soon as (COVID-19) vaccination starts and corona cycle breaks, we will consider it." The Home Minister was speaking at a press conference in West Bengal.

news_headline: BJP MP Babul Supriyo calls Prashant Kishor 'expert' after 'double digits' remark
news_article: Following political strategist Prashant Kishor's remark that BJP will "struggle to cross double digits" in Bengal polls 2021, BJP MP Babul Supriyo said, "Very happy that an 'expert' who can make such 'statement' is leading...Mamata Banerjee's poll campaign." BJP's Bengal in-charge Kailash Vijayvargiya said India will have to lose an "election strategist after BJP forms government in Bengal".

news_headline: Payment to women for their work at home if voted to power: Haasan
news_article: Unveiling his party Makkal Needhi Maiam's "Governance and Economic Agenda" for the 2021 Tamil Nadu Assembly Elections, Kamal Haasan promised homemakers "payment" for their work at home if he gets voted to power. "Women will break through glass ceilings by opportunities provided to them by MNM government," he added. Haasan also promised high-speed internet to households if voted to power.

news_headline: Cong should contest BMC 2022 polls independently: Party's Mumbai chief
news_article: Newly-elected Mumbai Congress President Ashok Arjunrao Jagtap suggested on Sunday that the party contest all 227 seats in Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation polls in 2022. "Seat-sharing is a difficult task," he further said. "Even when we were in power for 15 years in an NCP alliance, we always fought BMC polls independently and this should be followed even now," Jagtap added.

news_headline: BJP is misusing powers of Centre to destabilise Bengal govt: NCP
news_article: Following transfer of three IPS officers from Bengal, NCP National Spokesperson Nawab Malik has sided with CM Mamata Banerjee saying that BJP is "misusing powers" to "destabilise Bengal government". Terming the transfer as "serious", he added, "Mamata Banerjee and Sharad Pawar have discussed the matter." "Mr Pawar will discuss the issue with leaders of other parties also," Malik further said.

news_headline: TMC will be gone by May, I have vaccine for TMC virus: Dilip Ghosh
news_article: West Bengal BJP president Dilip Ghosh on Monday said, "I know TMC will be gone from Bengal in May next year. I have the vaccine for TMC virus." "Just like coronavirus, TMC wasn't able to do anything to me. But we have a vaccine for coronavirus, though we don't know when it'll be gone for good," the minister added.

news_headline: Kerala to hold special Assembly session to discuss new farm laws
news_article: Kerala Finance Minister Thomas Isaac on Monday said, "Kerala Cabinet decided to convene a special session of the Legislative Assembly on December 23...to discuss and reject the controversial farm laws." "Kerala [is] in total solidarity with the farmers' struggle," he added. Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan had earlier said that the government was exploring legal options against the bills.

news_headline: Sisodia reaches Lucknow to debate on AAP vs BJP governance model
news_article: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia, on Tuesday, reached Lucknow for an open debate to speak for Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's model of governance against UP CM Yogi Adityanath's model. "BJP leaders have gotten perturbed ever since Arvind Kejriwal made an announcement that AAP is going to fight the upcoming Uttar Pradesh elections," Sisodia said.

news_headline: Situation of 'committing suicide' by merging with BJP hasn't come: Kumaraswamy
news_article: JD(S) chief and former Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy took to Twitter on Sunday to write that the situation of "committing suicide" by merging the party with BJP hasn't yet come. "There's no tacit understanding with BJP," he tweeted. "At the most we may extend an issue-based support to BJP if need be," he further wrote in another tweet.

news_headline: Singer Guru Randhawa's team issues statement over Mumbai pub COVID-19 rule breach
news_article: Guru Randhawa's team has issued a statement after the singer was booked for violating COVID-19 rules at a Mumbai pub. "Guru Randhawa...deeply regrets the unintentional incident...Unfortunately, he wasn't aware of local authorities' decision of night curfew," it read. "He promises to comply with government guidelines and protocols by taking all precautionary measures in the future," it added.

news_headline: Party nahi chalegi till 6 in the morning: Police on catching celebs at pub at 3 am
news_article: After celebrities like Suresh Raina and Guru Randhawa were caught at a nightclub in Mumbai's Andheri at 3 am following a raid, the Mumbai Police tweeted, "Party (Nahin) Chalegi Till Six In The Morning!" It added, "Action has been initiated against 34 people, out of which 19 were from Delhi and Punjab, including some celebrities #NewNormal."

news_headline: Cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal marries YouTuber Dhanashree Verma, shares pics
news_article: Team India leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal got married to YouTuber and choreographer Dhanashree Verma on Tuesday. The 30-year-old took to Instagram to share pictures from the wedding and wrote, "We started at 'Once upon a time' and found 'Our happily ever after', coz finally, #DhanaSaidYuz for infinity and beyond!" The duo had got engaged in August this year.

news_headline: Actress Rakul Preet tests positive for coronavirus
news_article: Actress Rakul Preet took to Instagram on Tuesday to share that she has tested positive for coronavirus. "I've quarantined myself. I am feeling fine and will rest up well so that I can be back at shoot soon," she stated. "[I] request everyone who met me to kindly get yourself tested. Thank you and please stay safe," Rakul added.

news_headline: Sussanne Khan issues clarification on Mumbai pub raid, says no arrests were made
news_article: Sussanne Khan issued clarification over reports that she was arrested for COVID-19 rule breach after a late-night police raid at a Mumbai pub. She said guests were asked to wait for three hours as authorities and management sorted things out. "We were finally allowed to leave at 6 am...The speculation...that there were arrests made are completely incorrect," she added.

news_headline: A director apparently from south asked me to sleep with him: Actress Donal Bisht
news_article: TV actress Donal Bisht, who has starred in shows 'Roop- Mard Ka Naya Swaroop', 'Dil Toh Happy Hai Ji' and 'Laal Ishq', told Mumbai Mirror she once faced casting couch. "A filmmaker, who was apparently from the south film industry, asked me to sleep with him for a role," she stated. "I immediately filed a police complaint," she added.

news_headline: Anubhav Sinha, Sudhir Mishra to come together for a thriller film: Reports
news_article: Anubhav Sinha, who has directed films like 'Thappad', 'Article 15' and 'Mulk', will reportedly unite with 'Hazaaron Khwaishein Aisi' director Sudhir Mishra for a "quirky, edge-of-the-seat thriller" film. It'll be directed by Sudhir and produced under the banner of Anubhav's Benaras Media Works, reports added. They're in talks with a few A-list actors for the yet-to-be-titled film, reports said.

news_headline: Big B shares childhood pic with mom on her death anniversary
news_article: Amitabh Bachchan took to social media to remember his mother, Teji Bachchan, on her death anniversary. The actor shared an old picture of himself with his brother and late mother. He wrote, "That very special day when you simply had to get photographed. Ma, younger brother and moi...you wanted to show off your very first bush shirt."

news_headline: I have posed as Zooey Deschanel to get into LA clubs: Katy Perry
news_article: During an Instagram Live session, singer Katy Perry said that she has posed as actress Zooey Deschanel to get into Los Angeles clubs. "When I first got to LA, I had no money...sometimes I would pose as you (Zooey) to get into [clubs]," Katy added. "I'm sorry if I misrepresented you, I wanted to say that now," she further said.

news_headline: I've always been against it: Anurag on censorship on OTT platforms
news_article: Speaking about possible censorship of content on digital platforms, filmmaker Anurag Kashyap said during an interview, "I've always been against any kind of censorship. I...believe there shouldn't be censorship and people should have their own thought process". Commenting on the same, Anurag's 'AK vs AK' co-star Anil Kapoor said, "There should be a kind of a balance...censorship should be there".

news_headline: TV actors Mohit Malik, Aditi Malik to welcome their first child
news_article: TV actors Mohit Malik and Aditi Shirwaikar Malik revealed that they're expecting their first child and told Times Of India that the baby is due in May next year. Sharing the news on Instagram, Mohit shared a picture with his pregnant wife and wrote, "As we grow from 2 to 3. It makes my belief...stronger that we are 1."

news_headline: I was told to hide being a mother: Swastika Mukherjee
news_article: Actress Swastika Mukherjee, who made her debut in 2001 with 'Hemanter Pakhi', has revealed that she was told to hide being a mother so that the audience finds her "desirable". She said, "A lot of people in the industry, mostly men, would tell me, 'Don't tell people you've...child' because it's difficult for a woman to become...heroine if people know you're...mother."

news_headline: I get scared when people say 'she's at her career-best': Taapsee
news_article: Actress Taapsee Pannu said in an interview that she gets scared when people say that she is at her career-best. "It's scary because then you feel there is going to be a decline. If you reach the peak, the only way ahead is to come down...that's a crazy thought," she added. Taapsee was last seen in Anubhav Sinha's 'Thappad'.

news_headline: It was extremely challenging: Arjun Rampal on shooting amid COVID-19
news_article: Actor Arjun Rampal has said shooting for his upcoming film 'Nail Polish' amid the coronavirus pandemic was "extremely challenging". Arjun, whose co-actors Manav Kaul and Anand Tiwari tested positive for the virus, added, "Re-gathering ourselves and braving the situation, we had all the experiences. The best feeling was fighting through all these times and finishing what we had started."

news_headline: It was a huge responsibility: Director Ali on 3 yrs of Tiger Zinda Hai
news_article: Director Ali Abbas Zafar, while talking about his film 'Tiger Zinda Hai' which completed three years of release on Tuesday, said that it was a huge responsibility because the first instalment, 'Ek Tha Tiger', was a huge hit. "I'm very thankful to God and the audience for making 'Tiger Zinda Hai' one of the biggest blockbusters," he added.

news_headline: Wasn't surprised: Chris Pine on Steve's return in Wonder Woman 1984
news_article: Actor Chris Pine said he wasn't surprised when he found out that his character Steve Trevor, who died in the 2017 film 'Wonder Woman', was returning in the sequel. "I was aware of it...I was excited to jump back in...In the second iteration, Steve is...curious and excited. In many ways like Diana was in the first one," he said.

news_headline: Cannot imagine how we'd have survived pandemic without digital platforms: Swara
news_article: Actress Swara Bhasker has said she's grateful for the emergence of OTT platforms and added, "I cannot imagine how we'd have survived the pandemic without internet and digital platforms." Swara, who starred in web shows like 'Bhaag Beanie Bhaag' and 'Rasbhari', further said, "It's been a strangely blessed year where despite...pandemic I've seen such success and warmth from the audiences."

news_headline: All rubbish was being offered to me: Vidya Malavade on taking break from films
news_article: Vidya Malavade, who starred in film 'Chak De! India', talked about her absence from films and said, "I...kept saying no to projects...because all rubbish was being offered to me." She added that she doesn't want to do any film for money. "I'm not doing it for anything but for me to feel that magic of a good performance," Vidya said.

news_headline: Singer Jazzy B arrives at Singhu border, extends support to farmers
news_article: Indian-Canadian singer Jazzy B on Tuesday reached Singhu border to extend his support to farmers who are protesting against the farm laws. "These farmers' dharnas are having an impact abroad as well," Jazzy B said. He added that the protesting farmers, especially the youth, should not do anything wrong that "would bring disrepute to the peasant movement".

news_headline: Hrithik Roshan praises Dimple Kapadia's performance in 'Tenet'
news_article: Hrithik Roshan took to Instagram Stories on Tuesday to praise Dimple Kapadia's performance in 'Tenet'. He wrote, "Hers is unmistakably one of the best performances by an Indian actor in an international film. Just brilliant!!!!" Hrithik added, "The charm, the power, the poise, the seductive eyes, Dimple aunty you are something else!" The film is directed by Christopher Nolan.

news_headline: Will hopefully get married next yr, it'll be a small affair in Himachal: Vikrant
news_article: Actor Vikrant Massey, while talking about his wedding with Sheetal Thakur, said, "Unfortunately, COVID-19 has really reshuffled our plans. Hopefully, next year for sure." "When is something we will have to work around it," he added. "It will be a small affair in Himachal, mine and Sheetal's native place," Vikrant further said.

news_headline: I'm blessed that people think me worthy to offer varied roles: Abhishek
news_article: Abhishek Bachchan said he is blessed that people think him "worthy enough to offer a varied spectrum of roles". "For example, 'Breathe', 'Ludo', 'Bob Biswas' and 'Big Bull'...four films that I have done this year...all of these are so different from each other," he added. "This year has taught me to prioritise what I really want to do," Abhishek stated.

news_headline: I tell myself to choose films that help me tap into a different side of me: Amit
news_article: Amit Sadh, who has starred in films like 'Shakuntala Devi' and 'Super 30', has said he wants to try new genres and characters. "I constantly tell myself to choose films and characters that help me tap into a different side of me," he added. "I want to be...part of films that shape me both as...human being and as...actor," said Amit.

news_headline: I hope I never let my fans down: Sood on temple built in his honour
news_article: A temple has been built in honour of Sonu Sood in Maddur Mandal of Siddipet district in Telangana. Reacting to the same, Sonu, who has been helping people amid the coronavirus pandemic, said, "I don't think I've done anything to deserve this kind of love...from...people." He added, "[Want] to thank my fans in Telangana...I hope I never let them down."

news_headline: I love the fact that I can focus solely on myself: Krishna Shroff on singlehood
news_article: Actor Tiger Shroff's sister Krishna Shroff, who announced her separation from boyfriend Eban Hyams in November, spoke about her singlehood phase and said, "It's actually been amazing." She added, "I love the fact that I can focus solely on myself and my businesses now without any distractions or the drama a relationship tends to bring."

news_headline: NEXA gets India’s 1st multi-financier online car finance: Maruti Suzuki
news_article: Maruti Suzuki India Limited has announced the launch of multi-financier 'Smart Finance' service for NEXA customers across 30 cities. With this, it has become India's 1st car OEM to offer online, end-to-end car finance services, Maruti Suzuki mentioned. The platform offers one-stop convenience with option to compare loan offerings from multiple financiers, enabling customers to make an informed choice.

news_headline: Our safety innovations have saved over a million lives: Volvo
news_article: Volvo has said that the seatbelt, the speed limit and every other feature unique to its cars has contributed to saving millions of lives. "Volvo Cars has been a leader in the field of car safety for decades," the company added. Volvo further said that with the coming year 2021, it'll begin its journey to save a million more lives.

news_headline: Own a car without buying it : Revv Subscriptions
news_article: You can now drive a new car every month as Revv provides the option to subscribe to your favourite car for 1-36 months with ₹0 down payment, ₹0 road tax and without the hassle of maintenance and service. The car will be sanitized and delivered to your doorstep ensuring complete safety for you and your loved ones.

news_headline: Musk reveals he tried selling Tesla to Apple but Tim Cook refused a meeting
news_article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk revealed that he once approached Apple CEO Tim Cook to discuss the possibility of the iPhone maker acquiring Tesla for a tenth of its current value, indicating a valuation of about $60 billion. "He refused to take the meeting," he added. Musk said he had contacted Cook during the "darkest days" of development of Model 3.

news_headline: Elon Musk only $20 billion away from becoming the world's richest person
news_article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk is now only $20 billion away from becoming the world's richest person overtaking Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos, according to Bloomberg. The 49-year-old's net worth jumped almost $9 billion to $167.3 billion on Friday as Tesla shares soared. He has added nearly $140 billion this year, which is more than the entire net worth of Bill Gates.

news_headline: Mahindra's South Korean unit SsangYong files for bankruptcy
news_article: Mahindra & Mahindra's South Korean subsidiary SsangYong Motor Company has filed for bankruptcy after it defaulted on loan repayment of about ₹400 crore. SsangYong has also applied for an autonomous restructuring support programme, which gives the automaker up to three months to negotiate with stakeholders to resolve issues. Mahindra acquired SsangYong from near-insolvency in 2010.

news_headline: Auto industry lost ₹2,300cr a day in lockdown: Parliamentary panel
news_article: The automotive industry suffered ₹2,300 crore loss per day during the COVID-19 lockdown, according to a parliamentary panel report submitted to Rajya Sabha Chairman M Venkaiah Naidu. The sector witnessed an estimated job loss of about 3.45 lakh, the report said. All major original equipment manufacturers (OEM) cut down their production by 18-20% due to low demand, it added.

news_headline: Musk asks Tesla staff to push output to max possible through Dec: Report
news_article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has sent an email to workers encouraging them to push output to the maximum possible through December, Bloomberg reported. "We are fortunate to have the high-class problem of demand being quite a bit higher than production this quarter," the report quoted Musk. The company has a target of delivering 5 lakh cars this year.

news_headline: Tesla asked to give ₹1 cr to used car buyer for hiding damage in China
news_article: Tesla was ordered by a Chinese court to pay over ₹1 crore to the buyer of a used Model S car after concluding it concealed structural damage on the vehicle it sold on its official website. It was reportedly discovered part of the vehicle had been cut and welded back together. Tesla will appeal the ruling to a higher court.

news_headline: Apple moves self-driving car unit under exec who oversees Siri: Report
news_article: Apple has moved its self-driving car unit under the leadership of John Giannandrea, Senior Vice President of Machine Learning and AI Strategy, who also oversees the development of Apple's virtual assistant Siri, Bloomberg reported. Apple began working on its autonomous car project, known as Titan, in 2014. CEO Tim Cook in 2017 called autonomous systems "mother of all AI projects".

news_headline: US startup claims to have made 1st 'no charging' solar EV
news_article: US-based Aptera Motors has introduced the "first solar electric vehicle" that requires "no charging" for most daily use and has a range of up to over 1,600 kilometres per full charge. Every Aptera is designed to harvest enough sunlight to travel over 17,702 kilometres per year in most regions. Liquid-cooled electric motors propel Aptera from 0-100 kilometres/hour in 3.5 seconds.

news_headline: Apple aiming to produce self-driving car by 2024: Report
news_article: Apple is aiming for a 2024 launch for its self-driving passenger vehicle that could include its own breakthrough battery technology, Reuters reported. Apple's automotive unit, codenamed Project Titan, was started in 2014 with a former Tesla executive at its helm. Apple is also reportedly working on a new battery that would increase the vehicle’s range and also be "radically" cheaper.

news_headline: Amazon's Zoox unveils autonomous EV that can travel both ways
news_article: Amazon-owned self-driving car platform Zoox has unveiled a fully autonomous electric vehicle with no steering wheel which can travel in either direction. Equipped with two battery packs, the four-seater robotaxi can run for 16 hours on a single charge and can attain a maximum speed of 120 kmph. CEO Aicha Evans said Zoox plans on launching an app-based ride-hailing service.

news_headline: Tesla teams to visit Indonesia to discuss investment in EV components
news_article: Tesla will send delegations to Indonesia next month to discuss potential investment in a supply chain for its electric vehicles. Government officials and Tesla CEO Elon Musk have discussed investment opportunities in Indonesia over a call. Indonesia earlier pointed out it has the "biggest" nickel reserves. Musk plans to offer a "giant contract for a long period of time".

news_headline: Apple CFO, Apple's ex-design chief candidates for Ferrari CEO: Report
news_article: Apple CFO Luca Maestri and former Chief Design Officer Jony Ive are reportedly candidates to be Ferrari's next CEO, Reuters reported. Ferrari CEO Louis Camilleri announced his retirement earlier due to "personal reasons". Former Vodafone CEO Vittorio Colao was allegedly in the running for the position too, but Reuters said a source close to Colao has called the claim "groundless".

news_headline: Baidu becomes 1st to get fully driverless road tests permit in Beijing
news_article: Baidu has become the first to receive permits by the Beijing transportation authorities for five of its vehicles to conduct fully driverless road tests. It plans to remove safety drivers from test vehicles after gradually reducing human intervention. However, a remote safety operator will still be able to take control in an emergency via Baidu's 5G Remote Driving Service.

news_headline: Honda recalls 737,000 Accord, Insight cars in US over software flaw
news_article: Honda is recalling 737,000 Accord gas and hybrid cars from 2018 to 2020 and Insight hybrid cars from 2019 to 2020 after discovering a glitch in its software. The programming flaw in its control computer can cause the rear camera, turn signals and windshield wipers to malfunction. The move comes as part of a larger recall of 1.79-million cars worldwide.

news_headline: Bajaj Auto to set up ₹650 crore manufacturing unit in Maharashtra
news_article: Bajaj Auto has said that it will invest ₹650 crore to set up a manufacturing plant in Maharashtra's Chakan. The facility is expected to start production in 2023 and will be utilised for manufacturing high-end KTM, Husqvarna and Triumph motorcycles, and electric vehicles, the automaker added. Bajaj Auto signed an MoU with the state government for the same.

news_headline: Ola eyeing sites in India, Europe to build charging stations: Report
news_article: Ride-hailing platform Ola is looking for multiple sites across India and Europe to build a network of charging stations for electric two-wheelers, PTI reported quoting sources. The charging stations will allow customers to charge their vehicles and they'll address concerns around charging requirements. Ola recently said it'll invest ₹2,400 crore to set up an electric scooter factory in Tamil Nadu.

news_headline: Tesla shares fall 6% in first day of trading on S&P 500 index
news_article: Elon Musk-led Tesla's shares on Monday dipped as much as 6.3% in pre-market trading in its first day of trading on the S&P 500 index. Tesla, which is the most valuable company to be added to the benchmark index, will account for 1.69% of the S&P 500. Tesla's shares have soared over 700% so far in 2020.

news_headline: Tesla to raise $5 billion as market cap crosses $600 billion
news_article: Elon Musk-led Tesla on Tuesday announced that it will be raising $5 billion, marking its second capital raise in the last three months. The additional shares will be sold "from time to time" and "at-the-market" prices. Its shares are up nearly 670% this year with its market capitalisation crossing $600 billion. Tesla will join S&P 500 index later this month.

news_headline: Tesla to shut down production of Model S, X for 18 days: Report
news_article: Elon Musk-led Tesla will shut down the production of its high-end Model S and Model X electric vehicles from December 24 to January 11 in Fremont, California, CNBC reported. Employees will be given a full week's pay along with few paid holidays. Deliveries of these models amounted to only 11% of total vehicle deliveries during Tesla's third quarter of 2020.

news_headline: Fiat Chrysler to invest $150 mn to set up digital hub in Hyderabad
news_article: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles (FCA) has said it will invest $150 million to set up a global digital hub in Hyderabad. The investment will help create nearly 1,000 jobs by the end of 2021. "One of the key objectives...is to digitalise every aspect of FCA's automotive operations globally and within India," Mamatha Chamarthi, CIO for North America and Asia-Pacific region, said.

news_headline: Mahindra's Korean unit SsangYong defaults on $55 million loan
news_article: Automaker Mahindra & Mahindra's South Korean unit SsangYong Motor Company has defaulted on loan repayment of about $55 million. Around $27.5 million was owed to Bank of America, $18.3 million to JP Morgan Chase and $9.1 million to BNP Paribas on December 14. Mahindra has been looking for a buyer for all or most of its 75% stake since June.

news_headline: Honda shuts 23-year-old car unit in UP's Greater Noida
news_article: Honda Cars India has decided to shut its plant in Uttar Pradesh's Greater Noida, which was set up in 1997, reports said. However, the plant will continue to have its research and development set-up, spare parts division and corporate office. The automaker will rely on its facility in Rajasthan to roll out its entire product range in India, reports added.

news_headline: ISRO successfully launches India's 42nd communication satellite CMS-01
news_article: The ISRO on Thursday successfully launched India's 42nd communication satellite from Satish Dhawan Space Centre (SDSC) SHAR, Sriharikota. The PSLV-C50 launch vehicle put the communication satellite CMS-01 in orbit, that will provide coverage for disaster management and satellite internet connection. It's the first one in a new series of communication satellites after the INSAT and the GSAT series.

news_headline: Indian-American Raja Chari selected by NASA to fly to ISS on SpaceX mission
news_article: Indian-American astronaut Raja Chari has been selected by NASA alongside two other astronauts to fly to the International Space Station (ISS) on SpaceX Crew-3 mission in 2021. It'll be the first spaceflight for Chari and Matthias Maurer, and the third for NASA astronaut Tom Marshburn. Raja Chari is the only Indian-American among 18 astronauts selected for NASA's Moon mission.

news_headline: NASA shares pic of Jupiter-Saturn's 'Great Conjunction' as seen from Moon
news_article: The NASA's official account about Earth's Moon shared a picture of the 'Great Conjunction' of planets Jupiter and Saturn as seen from the Moon. "Unlike Sun, that's no star, it's two planets! #TheGreatConjunction looks great from the Moon!" it captioned the picture. On Monday night, Saturn and Jupiter were the closest in the sky in nearly 400 years.

news_headline: Dinosaur fossil found in Brazil reveals new chicken-sized species
news_article: Paleontologists have discovered a chicken-sized dinosaur species with a mane of hair down its back and stiff ribbon-like structures projecting from its shoulders. The dinosaur, Ubirajara jubatus, is believed to have lived around 110 million years ago in northeastern Brazil. "There are...strange dinosaurs, but this one is unlike any of them," said professor David Martill, who helped lead the study.

news_headline: 'World's ugliest orchid' featured in Kew's list of 2020's top 10 discoveries
news_article: Gastrodia agnicellus, nicknamed the 'ugliest orchid in the world', has featured in Kew's list of the top 10 discoveries of the year. The orchid depends on fungi for nutrition and has no leaves or any other photosynthetic tissue. As many as 156 plant and fungal species were named by Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew, and partners worldwide in 2020.

news_headline: Flies turn into 'zombies' when infected by new fungi species, scientists discover
news_article: Scientists in Denmark have discovered two new fungi species that 'zombify' flies and eject spores out of a large hole in the insect's abdomen "like small rockets". The fungi bore holes in the host but keep it alive with an amphetamine-like substance. The flies then buzz around for days, sprinkling more spores on other victims.

news_headline: Kangaroos can ask humans for help with their gaze: Study
news_article: Kangaroos can learn to communicate with humans, a behaviour that was previously thought to be reserved for domesticated animals like dogs, by using their gaze to "point" and ask for help, a study revealed. It involved 11 kangaroos that lived in captivity. Ten of the 11 kangaroos gazed at researchers when they were unable to open a box with food.

news_headline: How close will Jupiter, Saturn come today in 400 yrs & how can people watch it?
news_article: On Monday night, Jupiter and Saturn will be at their closest separation in the sky since 1623 at 0.1° apart. "To see the Great Conjunction, look toward the southwest after sunset: it doesn't matter where on Earth you are!" tweeted astronomer Dr James O'Donoghue. "Find a spot with...unobstructed view of the sky, such as a field or park," said NASA.

news_headline: NASA shares pic of Himalayan mountains, Delhi's city lights captured from space
news_article: NASA took to Instagram to share a picture of snow-covered Himalayan mountains and Delhi's city lights captured from space. "The bright city lights of New Delhi, India, and Lahore, Pakistan, are...visible below the faint, orange airglow of atmospheric particles reacting to solar radiation," NASA wrote. Reacting to the picture, a user wrote, "This is so beautiful."

news_headline: 57,000-year-old wolf cub found preserved in Canada with skin, fur intact
news_article: A preserved wolf cub, estimated to be about 57,000-years-old, was found buried under permafrost in Canada by a gold miner in 2016, researchers said in a study published on Monday. "This mummy...has basically got all her skin, most of her fur...soft tissues present," they added. The female cub is "the oldest, most complete wolf that's ever been found", researchers said.

news_headline: 30,000 tremors hit Antarctica in 3 months: Scientists
news_article: More than 30,000 tremors have rocked Antarctica since the end of August, scientists at University of Chile said. The small earthquakes were detected in Bransfield Strait, an ocean channel between South Shetland Islands and Antarctic Peninsula. Several tectonic plates and microplates meet near the strait, leading to frequent rumbling, but the past three months have been unusual, scientists said.

news_headline: Jupiter and Saturn come closest in night sky after 397 years, pics go viral
news_article: Jupiter and Saturn came closer than any time in 397 years on Monday night in the event dubbed 'Great Conjunction'. The two planets were at their closest separation at 0.1° apart. The event was visible with the unaided eye as well. The pictures above include the event as seen from New Delhi, Las Vegas and New York among others.

news_headline: 1st known case of COVID-19 in non-captive wild mink found in US
news_article: The first known case of COVID-19 in a non-captive wild mink has been confirmed, according to an alert issued by the US Department of Agriculture. The wild mink tested positive around an infected mink farm in Utah. The strain of the virus in the wild mink is "indistinguishable" from that in infected mink on farms around the state.

news_headline: No need for major alarm over new coronavirus strain: WHO
news_article: WHO has said there is no need for major alarm over the emergence of COVID-19's new variant and that it was a normal part of a pandemic's evolution. WHO officials, citing Britain's data, said they had no evidence that the variant was deadlier than existing strains. Officials said coronavirus mutations had so far been much slower than with influenza.

news_headline: Blue Origin receives NASA approval to launch future uncrewed missions
news_article: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos-owned Blue Origin has received approval from NASA to launch future unmanned scientific and exploration missions aboard its reusable New Glenn launch vehicle. Under the contract, Blue Origin will be able to compete for national security launch contracts. The New Glenn booster is not expected to make its first flight until 2021.

news_headline: ISRO's next PSLV launch to carry spacetech startup Pixxel satellite
news_article: ISRO has announced that the next PSLV-C51 launch will carry the first satellite by spacetech startup Pixxel India, 'Anand', which is an earth observation satellite, in early 2021. Along with Anand, a satellite by Space Kidz India and another by a consortium of universities will be launched. The primary payload of PSLV-C51 will be a Brazilian earth observation satellite 'Amazonia'.

news_headline: 'Forever chemicals' used in outdoor gear found in snow on Mt Everest: Study
news_article: "Forever chemicals" used in water-repellent outdoor gear have been found in snow near Mount Everest's summit, University of Maine reported. A research assistant professor at the university said these human-made PFAS could eventually pose a risk for residents who drink the water. This marks the first time that Everest snow and meltwater has been analysed for PFAS, the professor said.

news_headline: US Space Force personnel will be called 'Guardians': Vice Prez
news_article: The members of the US Space Force will be called "Guardians", Vice President Mike Pence announced at an event celebrating Space Force's first anniversary. "The name Guardians connects our proud heritage and culture to the important mission we execute 24/7, protecting the people and interest of the US and its allies," the Space Force tweeted.

news_headline: Potentially damaging surface ozone levels rose in lockdown in UK: Study
news_article: The University of York has revealed less traffic on the roads during the first lockdown may have caused potentially damaging surface ozone levels to rise in the UK. The study said levels of nitrogen dioxide fell by 42% on average and surface ozone increased by 11%. The first lockdown levels of O3 were the worst in the South of England.

news_headline: Workers from 27 nations building hybrid sailboat for goods to reduce pollution
news_article: Around 200 workers from 27 nations are building a hybrid sailboat, Ceiba, in Costa Rica aiming to transport goods without polluting the environment. Ceiba will rely mostly on wind power with two auxiliary electric engines for manoeuvring in ports and low winds. It will be put into operation in 2022 on routes between Canada, Ecuador and Hawaii.

news_headline: Chinese spacecraft brings 1st lunar samples in over 40 years
news_article: China's Chang'e-5 probe successfully landed in the northern Chinese region, bringing back the first lunar rocks and soil retrieved by any country in over 40 years. China is now the third country to have retrieved lunar samples. It will be sharing a portion of the lunar soil with other nations and organisations based on international cooperation conventions.

news_headline: New population of blue whales found in Indian Ocean: Researchers
news_article: Researchers have discovered a new population of blue whales in the western Indian Ocean. Every blue whale population sings a unique song and researchers described a new blue whale song heard from the Arabian Sea coast of Oman across to the Chagos Archipelago. Dr Salvatore Cerchio, Visiting Scientist at the New England Aquarium, first recorded the novel song in 2017.

news_headline: Novel skin disease in dolphins linked to climate change: Study
news_article: Scientists at The Marine Mammal Center identified a novel skin disease in dolphins that is linked to climate change. Due to decreased water salinity brought upon by climate change, the dolphins develop patchy and raised skin lesions across their bodies. The deadly skin disease was first noted on approximately 40 bottlenose dolphins near New Orleans after Hurricane Katrina in 2005.

news_headline: Only 10% of tropical forests left in Indonesia fire-resistant: Study
news_article: A Swansea University's researchers-led study has revealed only 10% of the tropical forests left in Indonesia remains fire-resistant. The rest has been severely fragmented or degraded and therefore is no longer able to maintain a fire-resistant microclimate. An area of tropical forest and peatland larger than the Netherlands has burned in Indonesia in the past five years, according to Greenpeace.

news_headline: Microplastics found in the placentas of unborn babies for the first time
news_article: Microplastic particles have been revealed in the placentas of unborn babies for the first time. A team of Italian researchers found microplastics on both the foetal and maternal sides of placenta of healthy women and in the membrane within which the foetus develops. "The mothers were shocked," said Antonio Ragusa, who is the lead author of the study.

news_headline: Singapore citizen world's 1st to cross int'l border with digital COVID-19 travel pass
