These hires will be from the STEM (science, technology, engineering, and mathematics) background and in areas including AI, machine learning, cybersecurity, analytics and other emerging technologies. EY in India has over 50,000 people working in all member firms.

news_headline: Good idea: Musk on combining SpaceX, Tesla, Boring Company and Neuralink
news_article: Elon Musk said that combining SpaceX, Tesla, The Boring Company and Neuralink to form a holding company called 'X' would be a "good idea". His reply came in response to YouTuber Dave Lee, who suggested bringing all ventures under one structure to make it easier to manage them. "X's mission [will be] to ensure human survival and progress," Lee said.

news_headline: WHO's COVID-19 updates app launches first in Nigeria
news_article: WHO has launched 'WHO COVID-19 Updates' app to provide latest COVID-19 guidance and updates in Nigeria. It will be launched in other English-speaking countries soon. The app helps users learn the symptoms and find ways to help out pandemic relief efforts, among other things. It works with devices running iOS 9.0 and up and those running Android 4.4.

news_headline: Amazon India's e-comm unit's losses widen to ₹5,849.2 cr in FY20
news_article: The online marketplace unit of Amazon India, Amazon Seller Service, saw its losses widening to ₹5,849.2 crore in FY20 as compared to ₹5,685.4 crore recorded in FY19, filings revealed. Its revenue, however, grew 43% to ₹10,847.6 crore from ₹7,593.5 crore. Amazon Seller Services saw its total expenses rising over 25% from ₹13,463.1 crore to ₹16,877.1 crore.

news_headline: Impossible to take Tesla private now: Elon Musk
news_article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk, in response to a tweet saying he should create a holding company and optimise his time in areas such as innovation, said, "Tesla public company duties are a much bigger factor, but going private is impossible now." Musk has also said that SpaceX's Starlink will likely go for IPO once its revenue growth becomes "reasonably predictable".

news_headline: Pakistan issues notice to Google over 'sacrilegious content'
news_article: Pakistan regulators have criticised Google and Wikipedia for "disseminating sacrilegious content" and issued notices to them for removal of "unlawful content" to avoid any legal action. The regulators pointed to misleading search results associated with "Present Khalifa of Islam" and an "unauthentic version of Holy Quran" on Google Play Store, among other things.

news_headline: E-comm sites asked to remove listings of mobile signal boosters
news_article: The Department of Telecommunications (DoT) has issued notices to e-commerce sites asking them to pull down listings of mobile network boosters. It said such equipment has resulted in poor service quality and led to frequent complaints in various parts of the country. The DoT removed 68 illegal boosters during raids carried out in South Mumbai in the last two days.

news_headline: Google told scientists to 'strike a positive tone' in research: Report
news_article: Google launched a "sensitive topics" review in 2020, aiming to tighten its control over its scientists' papers, reported Reuters. Google also reportedly requested authors to refrain from casting its technology in a negative light in at least three cases. A senior Google official also asked authors to "take great care to strike a positive tone" earlier this year.

news_headline: MNS Chief Raj Thackeray summoned in Amazon vandalism case
news_article: A Mumbai court on Thursday issued a notice to Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) Chief Raj Thackeray over a case related to vandalism of Amazon India’s promotional posters. Amazon India filed a plea alleging that MNS workers tore company posters as its app didn't have Marathi as a language option. The MNS has started a campaign called 'No Marathi, No Amazon'.

news_headline: Hawaii's 1st Tesla Supercharger may be built on Oracle Founder's island: Report
news_article: Tesla has recently applied for a permit to construct Hawaii's first Supercharger in Lanai City, an island that Oracle's billionaire Founder Larry Ellison owns 98% of, Electrek reported. Lanai has only around 48 kilometres of paved roads and zero stoplights. Ellison recently announced his plans to move to Lanai, an island he bought in 2012 for a reported $300 million.

news_headline: 400 Canadian Amazon workers test COVID-19 +ve at 4 facilities: Report
news_article: Over 400 Amazon workers have tested COVID-19 positive at four facilities near Ontario, The National Post reported. An Amazon ex-worker in Canada said he wasn't surprised by the numbers as the working conditions at facilities are "hell". A current worker said there is no sanitation or social distancing at facilities and that 99% of workers are scared of working there.

news_headline: No penalty for individual users of banned mobile apps: IT Ministry
news_article: The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY) has clarified that no penalty or punishment will be imposed on individual users of banned mobile apps, such as PUBG, TikTok and UC Browser. In response to an RTI, the ministry added that intermediaries recognised under Section 69A of Information Technology Act would be penalised for non-compliance of the blocking order.

news_headline: 100 EV battery-swapping stations to be set up in Bengaluru
news_article: As many as 100 electric vehicle (EV) battery-swapping stations will be set up in Bengaluru as part of a joint initiative by Karnataka government and private firms. "With the government encouraging the use of EVs, these battery-swapping units...will...help reduce the weight of vehicles, increase mileage, and make it possible to drive for longer hours," CM BS Yediyurappa said.

news_headline: Facebook staff side with Apple over Apple's privacy policy: Report
news_article: Facebook employees are unhappy with its move to publicly criticise Apple over its privacy policy that would require apps to ask for users' permission before tracking them, media reports said. Facebook had earlier run newspaper ads against it saying it would hurt small businesses. The employees have reportedly said that Facebook was hiding its bad privacy practices behind small businesses.

news_headline: Broadcaster to air deepfake version of UK Queen's Christmas message
news_article: UK broadcaster Channel 4 will show an alternative Christmas message which will be delivered by a digitally-altered version of Queen Elizabeth II. It will show the Queen sharing her reflections on the year, including the departure of the Duke and Duchess of Sussex. Channel 4 said the intention was to give a "stark warning" about fake news in digital era.

news_headline: GoDaddy offers staff fake holiday bonus as part of 'phishing test'
news_article: Internet domain company GoDaddy sent "phishing test" email to its employees promising a $650 one-time holiday bonus, The Copper Courier reported. Those employees who fell for it later received an email from the firm saying they failed the test. However, after facing backlash for the test, GoDaddy apologised and acknowledged it needs to be more sensitive to its employees.

news_headline: SpaceX will begin testing Super Heavy flights soon: Elon Musk
news_article: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk on Thursday said that his space exploration company will begin flight testing its Super Heavy booster, starting with low-altitude "hops", as soon as "a few months" from now. He added that it will also use both its launch pads at its facility in Boca Chica, Texas with prototype rockets set up on each.

news_headline: Apple rolls out lower App Store fees for some developers: Report
news_article: Apple has started rolling out its new App Store commission structure through its Small Business Program, lowering fees to 15% for developers who earn less than $1 million a year, AppleInsider reported. It had introduced the program in November. Apparent Software Founder Jacob Gorban and a few other developers revealed that the reduced program fees are now in effect.

news_headline: Bitcoin irrelevant to financial markets: Kevin O'Leary
news_article: Canadian businessman and Shark Tank investor Kevin O'Leary on Thursday said Bitcoin is irrelevant to financial markets and that investors should be careful glorifying it while it could still be regulated. He said "grown men are going to weep" when regulators "come down hard" on Bitcoin. "It's not even a single cell amoeba," O'Leary remarked about Bitcoin.

news_headline: MediaTek becomes biggest smartphone chipset vendor in Q3: Report
news_article: MediaTek beat Qualcomm to become the biggest smartphone chipset vendor with a 31% market share in the third quarter of 2020, Counterpoint reported. Its growth in key regions like China and India helped it become the biggest smartphone chipset vendor. However, Qualcomm was the biggest 5G chipset vendor and powered 39% of 5G phones sold worldwide.

news_headline: Suspected Russian hackers used Microsoft vendors to attack: Reports
news_article: The suspected Russian hackers behind the cyberattack on US agencies also used Microsoft's resellers to break into customers of Microsoft's Office 365 software, media reports said. Security firm CrowdStrike said some hackers got access to the vendor that sold it Office licences and used that to try to read its email. CrowdStrike found no impact from the intrusion attempt.

news_headline: Human rights groups join Facebook's suit against hacking firm NSO
news_article: A coalition of human rights groups joined Facebook's lawsuit against Israeli hacking firm NSO, alleging that the company "prioritises profit to the detriment of human rights". The organisations, including Amnesty International, filed a "friend of the court" brief in support of Facebook. Earlier, a tech companies' coalition, comprising Microsoft and Google, had joined Facebook in the suit.

news_headline: Cyberpunk 2077 maker CD Projekt sued by investor over game's launch
news_article: CD Projekt, the maker of the video game Cyberpunk 2077, has been sued by an investor who claimed he was misled about the game. In his complaint, Andrew Trampe said the company failed to disclose that the game was “virtually unplayable on...Xbox or PlayStation systems due to an enormous number of bugs". Sony also removed the game from PlayStation's store.

news_headline: China's BOE to manufacture OLED panels for iPhone 12 series: Report
news_article: An industry analyst firm said China's BOE has received certification and will soon start manufacturing OLED panels for Apple iPhone 12 series, GSMArena reported. Samsung will make about 130 million units in 2021, while BOE would make 10 million units. However, depending on iPhone 12 sales the order might increase up to 20 million.

news_headline: Apple iCloud issue causing sign-in, device activation problems
news_article: Apple's iCloud backend is suffering from an unknown problem that appears to be causing new device setup and account activation failures. Apple's status page suggests that the 'iCloud Account and Sign in' issue is ongoing. A number of users have reported device activation troubles on Twitter. Some users noted long wait times for iCloud account creation and new device setup.

news_headline: Gill, Siraj receive maiden Test caps from Shastri, Ashwin; BCCI shares videos
news_article: Batsman Shubman Gill and fast bowler Mohammed Siraj received their maiden Test caps from Team India head coach Ravi Shastri and off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin respectively ahead of the Boxing Day Test against Australia at Melbourne Cricket Ground. Gill and Siraj have become the 297th and 298th cricketers respectively to represent India in Test cricket.

news_headline: Which Team India players earned the most from match fees in 2020?
news_article: Fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah, who returned to international cricket at the start of 2020 following an injury, earned ₹1.38 crore in match fees, the highest among the players who represented Team India this year. Captain Virat Kohli earned ₹1.29 crore for playing three Tests, nine ODIs and 10 T20Is. All-rounder Ravindra Jadeja followed Kohli with ₹96 lakh.

news_headline: When was the last time two Indian players made their Test debuts together?
news_article: Shubman Gill and Mohammed Siraj will make their Test debuts in the Boxing Day Test against Australia that starts tomorrow. The last time two Indians debuted together in a Test was in 2013 when Rohit Sharma and Mohammad Shami played their first Test against West Indies in Kolkata. Rohit scored 177 runs, while Shami took nine wickets on debut.

news_headline: Controversy erupts over Paine's run-out decision, Cricket Australia shares video
news_article: During the 55th over of Australia's first innings in the Boxing Day Test against India, Tim Paine was declared not-out by the third umpire after a close run-out call. Several former cricketers and fans contended that Paine should've been given out as "no part of his bat was behind the line". The third umpire claimed there was "no conclusive evidence".

news_headline: Aus all out on Day 1 of an MCG Boxing Day Test after 10 years, India 36/1 at stumps
news_article: After winning the toss and deciding to bat first in the Boxing Day Test against India, Australia were bowled out for 195 runs in 72.3 overs in their first innings. It is the first time since 2010 that Australia were bowled out on opening day of a Boxing Day Test at Melbourne Cricket Ground. India ended the day at 36/1.

news_headline: Shimla-born Robin Jackman, former England cricketer and commentator, dies aged 75
news_article: Former England fast bowler and commentator Robin Jackman has passed away at the age of 75. He was diagnosed with throat cancer in 2012. Jackman, who made his Test debut in 1981 aged 35, took 14 wickets in his four England appearances, and also featured in 15 ODIs between 1974 and 1983. He was born in Shimla in 1945.

news_headline: Smith gets out for a duck in a Test after 4 years, 1st time ever against India
news_article: Australia batsman Steve Smith, who is the top-ranked Test batsman, got out for a duck on the bowling of Ravichandran Ashwin in the first innings of Boxing Day Test. It is Smith's first duck in Test cricket since November 3, 2016. It is also the first time that he got out for a duck in a Test against India.

news_headline: Out ho ja bhootni ke: Pak spinner heard saying on stump mic as batsman misses ball
news_article: Pakistan leg-spinner Yasir Shah was heard saying 'Out ho ja bhootni ke' on stump mic in frustration after New Zealand batsman Henry Nicholls missed a cut shot on his bowling in first Test today. Reacting to it, a fan tweeted, "Hahaha top stuff with tongue but bowling [thumbs down]." Nicholls is unbeaten on 42 off 100 deliveries after day one.

news_headline: Which bowlers have dismissed Steve Smith for a duck in Test cricket?
news_article: India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin today became the fifth bowler to dismiss Australia batsman Steve Smith for a duck in Tests. Before Ashwin, Smith's last two ducks had come against South Africa left-arm spinner Keshav Maharaj and ex-Pakistan left-arm spinner Zulfiqar Babar in 2016 and 2014, respectively. Smith's first Test duck had come in 2013 against former England pacer Chris Tremlett.

news_headline: What is Ajinkya Rahane's record as captain in international cricket?
news_article: Ajinkya Rahane, India's stand-in captain for the last three Tests against Australia, has captained India seven times in international cricket. Rahane has captained India twice in Test cricket, beating Australia in 2017 and defeating Afghanistan in 2018. India won all three ODIs Rahane captained in. Meanwhile, India won one match and suffered one defeat in two T20Is led by Rahane.

news_headline: What is head-to-head record of India & Australia ahead of 100th Test between them?
news_article: Australia-India Boxing Day Test that starts tomorrow will be the 100th Test match between the two countries. In their first 99 Tests, India have won 28 Tests, while Australia have won 43 Tests. Further, 27 matches have been drawn and one match ended as a tie. The Boxing Day Test will also be the 50th Australia-India Test on Australian soil.

news_headline: Jadeja takes running catch despite collision with Gill, Cricket Aus shares video
news_article: Team India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja pulled off a running catch despite a collision with debutant Shubman Gill to dismiss Australia opener Matthew Wade on the bowling of Ravichandran Ashwin on the first day of the Boxing Day Test. The collision happened after Gill went for the catch despite Jadeja calling for it. Wade was dismissed for 30(39).

news_headline: What is a Boxing Day Test match in cricket?
news_article: The Test match that starts on December 26, primarily at Australia's Melbourne Cricket Ground, is called the Boxing Day Test. According to a theory, December 26 came to be known as the Boxing Day as the servants in Victorian-era England were given boxes of gifts a day after Christmas. Australia has hosted a Boxing Day Test every year since 1990.

news_headline: It's been unfair on Pant, Saha both: Gambhir on Team India playing XI
news_article: After Rishabh Pant was included in the playing XI instead of Wriddhiman Saha for the Melbourne Test, ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir asked what will happen if Pant doesn't score in the upcoming Tests. "Would you go back to Saha?" Gambhir asked. "It's been unfair on Pant and Saha both...[management has] picked...players on conditions...you don't do that with wicketkeepers," he stated.

news_headline: Ajinkya Rahane has a calming influence on players: Srikkanth
news_article: On Ajinkya Rahane leading Team India in the remaining three Tests against Australia, former India batsman Kris Srikkanth has said that the change in captaincy might bring a change in fortune for the side. "As a personality...Rahane has a calming influence on the players, he's not...like...Virat Kohli who expresses himself in an aggressive [mode]," he added.

news_headline: Was just sticking to basics: Bumrah on 4-wicket haul on Day 1
news_article: India pacer Jasprit Bumrah picked four wickets for 56 runs on the first day of the Boxing Day Test against Australia. Talking about his performance, Bumrah said, "Sometimes when you try too hard you don't get that success, so was just sticking to the basics." Bumrah has now picked more than three wickets in a Test innings six times.

news_headline: He's having trouble running at full speed: Langer on Warner's injury
news_article: Giving an update on David Warner's injury, Australia head coach Justin Langer said Warner is "moving well" but he's having "trouble running at full speed". Warner had sustained a groin injury while fielding in the second ODI against India and was ruled out of the ODI and T20I series. In the two ODIs, Warner scored 69 and 83* respectively.

news_headline: He certainly has skills, swings away from lefties: Labuschagne on Siraj
news_article: Talking about India's bowling on the first day of the Melbourne Test, Marnus Labuschagne, who top scored for Australia, praised debutant India pacer Mohammed Siraj. "He is more of a swing bowler...swings away from lefties. He certainly has skills," he stated. He further said that the MCG pitch is helping the bowlers a little bit more than usual.

news_headline: Amir's retirement will have negative impact on Pakistan cricket: Inzamam
news_article: Talking about Pakistani pacer Mohammad Amir's retirement aged 28, ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq said that what bothers him about the decision is not what impact it'll have on Pakistan bowling resources but the negative impact it'll have on Pakistan cricket and its image. "It is better if such situations don't take place," he added. Amir had said, "PCB ruined his image."

news_headline: Ex-Russia captain, who hospitalised referee during match, sentenced to community service
news_article: Former Russia captain Roman Shirokov has been sentenced to 100 hours of community service over an assault on a referee whilst playing in an amateur competition in August. Shirokov had punched and kicked the referee after being denied a penalty during the match. Later, the 39-year-old posted an apology on social media and expressed his regret over the incident.

news_headline: Aus batting is 30% Warner, 30% Smith, 30% all others: Kris Srikkanth
news_article: Ex-India batsman Kris Srikkanth has said that while Australia have a "very good" bowling attack, their batting is "not very strong". "My belief is the Aussies' batting is 30% David Warner, 30% Steve Smith, all others put together is 30%," he stated. On the Melbourne Test, Srikkanth said that India need to have "a bit more positive intent".

news_headline: Outstanding bowling changes, smart fielding placements from Rahane: Sehwag on Day 1
news_article: After India bundled out Australia for 195 and posted 36/1 at the end of the first day at Melbourne, ex-India opener Virender Sehwag praised stand-in captain Ajinkya Rahane. "Outstanding bowling changes and really smart fielding placements from Rahane...Great effort to get Australia all out," he tweeted. Jasprit Bumrah picked four wickets, while Ravichandran Ashwin picked three.

news_headline: India can't let one bad innings define their tour: Ex-Aus captain Mark Taylor
news_article: Former Australia captain Mark Taylor has said that day one of the Melbourne Test will be "crucial" for India's chances to win the series Down Under. "If they put runs on the board, they've got the bowling attack to take 10 wickets," he added. "India can't let one bad innings define their tour," he further said.

news_headline: He's human: Hussey on Smith getting out for a duck after 4 yrs
news_article: On Steve Smith getting out for a duck against India at Melbourne, Michael Hussey said that the Australia batsman is a human and can make mistakes. "They know his strength is off the pads, so they've put fielders there...but then bowled straight at the stumps," he explained. It was Smith's first duck in Test cricket in four years.

news_headline: Cricket Australia to pay tribute to Dean Jones on Day 1 of Boxing Day Test
news_article: Cricket Australia will pay tribute to former Australia batsman Dean Jones during the tea break on Day 1 of the Boxing Day Test. Jones had died in September in Mumbai while on commentary duty for IPL 2020. Cricket Australia has also decided to give a video tribute to Jones at 3:24 pm, in reference to his Test number, 324.

news_headline: South Africa rejects claim that its COVID-19 variant is more dangerous than UK strain
news_article: South Africa has rejected UK's claim that a new coronavirus variant found in the country is more contagious or dangerous than a similar one in UK. UK Health Secretary's words "have created a perception that the South Africa variant has been a major factor in UK's second wave," South Africa's Health Minister Zweli Mkhize said, adding that "it isn't correct".

news_headline: Some will sit at family tables missing a familiar face: WHO chief in Xmas message
news_article: In a message for Christmas, WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said we mustn't squander the sacrifices made to protect us from coronavirus pandemic by people or their families "who, this holiday season, will sit at family tables missing a familiar face". "Millions of people are today making great, heart-wrenching sacrifices by staying apart to stay safe," he added.

news_headline: Due to Covid-19 curbs, not standoff: China on 39 Indian sailors stranded for months
news_article: With 39 Indian sailors stranded on two cargo ships at Chinese ports for several months, the country's foreign ministry has said that the vessels were stuck because of quarantine measures in place due to Covid-19 pandemic. The ministry has claimed that there's no link between this situation and the current state of ties between the two countries.

news_headline: AK-47 manufacturer tests its new guided anti-aircraft missile, releases video
news_article: Kalashnikov, the maker of AK-47 assault rifles, has released a video as it successfully carried out a test of its new Strela-guided anti-aircraft missile. The test was carried out at the Donguz range in Russia's Orenburg Region on the border with Kazakhstan. The Strela-9M333 guided missile is capable of shooting down low-flying planes, helicopters, drones and cruise missiles.

news_headline: Russian MP admits staring at minister's chest and not listening to her speech
news_article: A Russian MP has admitted that he was staring at entrepreneurship minister Irina Vysokikh's chest during an online parliamentary session. "It's not good, of course. Yes, as a man I admit it's beautiful," Pyotr Ammosov said. He further said that this stopped him from listening attentively to her speech on low-alcohol drinks.

news_headline: What is the 'balloon boy hoax', for which US parents were pardoned recently?
news_article: In 2009, Richard Heene and his wife Mayumi claimed their son had been carried away by a homemade helium balloon. It led to large-scale search operations as the balloon's flight was followed live by media. However, the boy was found in the attic of his home and authorities accused the parents of carrying out a hoax as a publicity stunt.

news_headline: Monolith made of gingerbread appears in US
news_article: A monolith made of gingerbread has appeared in US' San Francisco. The origin of the structure which was discovered by visitors at San Francisco's Corona Heights Park is unclear. The city's parks department said it is not in any rush to take the monolith down, adding, "We all deserve a little bit of magic right now."

news_headline: Pakistan's governance system has become corrupt: IHC Chief Justice
news_article: The governance system in Pakistan has become corrupt, Islamabad High Court (IHC) Chief Justice Athar Minallah said on Thursday. The citizens do not have access to "cheap and speedy justice", he added. Talking about the conditions of accountability courts, he said, "There is a lot of work pressure on those courts, but there is an acute dearth of staff."

news_headline: What is the new coronavirus strain found in South Africa?
news_article: Scientists have said the new coronavirus variant, 501.V2, discovered in South Africa is different from others because it has multiple mutations in the important "spike" protein that the virus uses to infect human cells. It has also been associated with higher concentration of virus particles in patients' bodies. Health authorities said 80-90% of new cases there are carrying this variant.

news_headline: Pic of vehicle that exploded in 'intentional act' in US released
news_article: Police in Nashville, US, released the picture of the camper van that broadcast a warning to residents before it blew up on Friday, in what police believe was an "intentional act". Possible human remains have been found at the scene of the explosion, police said. Three people were injured in the morning blast, though none critically.

news_headline: 3 nations collaborate to evacuate expeditioner from Antarctica
news_article: Australia, China and US collaborated to medically evacuate an Australian expeditioner from Antarctica in a 5-day mission involving ships, helicopters and planes. "Antarctica really brings nations together to support each other," AAD Director said. The multi-country collaboration was essential as Australia doesn't currently have small ski-equipped intracontinental aircraft in Antarctica, AAD said.

news_headline: Vehicle plays bomb explosion warning message before exploding in US
news_article: A recreational vehicle that was broadcasting a recording that said a potential bomb would detonate within 15 minutes exploded in US' Nashville injuring three people. "We do believe this to have been an intentional act," police said. It was not clear whether anyone was inside the vehicle at the time of the explosion, police added.

news_headline: Russia approves use of Sputnik V vaccine for people above 60: Reports
news_article: Russia has approved the use of Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine for people over the age of 60, Russian news agencies reported. People over 60 were excluded from Russia's national inoculation programme, as the vaccine was being tested on this age group separately. Earlier, Russian President Vladimir Putin said he would take the vaccine when it becomes "possible for his age".

news_headline: France reports first case of coronavirus variant found in UK
news_article: France reported its first case of the new coronavirus variant that emerged in the UK after a man who flew in from London tested positive. The man, who arrived on December 19, is currently self-isolating at home, French Health Ministry said. UK identified the new COVID-19 variant that it said is 70% more transmissible last week.

news_headline: China hails its 'extraordinary' success in handling COVID-19 ahead of WHO probe
news_article: China's ruling Communist Party leaders hailed themselves on their "extremely extraordinary" success in handling the COVID-19 outbreak domestically. The party's leadership "played a decisive role in leading...China in prevailing over the rare risks and challenges this year", a statement read. This comes ahead of the upcoming visit by the WHO team to China in January to probe COVID-19 origin.

news_headline: Negative COVID-19 test must for all incoming passengers: Turkey
news_article: Turkey's Health Minister Fahrettin Koca has said the country would require all incoming passengers to test negative for coronavirus within 72 hours of departure, starting Monday. In addition to this, passengers arriving from UK, South Africa, and Denmark will have to quarantine for at least seven days until a second test, he added. Turkey has reported over 21 lakh cases.

news_headline: Hong Kong bans S African flights, imposes 21-day quarantine for visitors
news_article: Hong Kong announced a ban on people who have stayed in South Africa in the past 21 days from entering amid the spread of the new variant of coronavirus. The authorities also extended compulsory quarantine from 14 days to 21 days for all visitors outside China from Friday. At least five countries have suspended flights from South Africa.

news_headline: Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince receives COVID-19 vaccine on camera
news_article: Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman received his first dose of COVID-19 vaccine on camera on Friday as a part of the kingdom's inoculation plan. The country began the mass vaccination drive against COVID-19 with Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine on December 17. Saudi Arabia has reported over 3.6 lakh COVID-19 cases and over 6,000 coronavirus-related deaths so far.

news_headline: US doctor suffers serious allergic reaction to Moderna's vaccine: Report
news_article: A doctor in Boston, who has a severe shellfish allergy, suffered a serious allergic reaction after getting Moderna's coronavirus vaccine on Thursday, The New York Times reported. The doctor experienced a severe reaction almost immediately after he was vaccinated, feeling dizzy and with his heart racing, it added. This is the first allergic reaction reported from Moderna's vaccine.

news_headline: Myanmar Navy commissions submarine handed over by India
news_article: Myanmar on Saturday formally commissioned submarine INS Sindhuvir, which was handed over by India to the country in October this year, into its Navy. The diesel-electric Kilo Class submarine, which has been renamed as UMS Minye Theinkhathu, was in operation in the Indian Navy since 1988. UMS Minye Theinkhathu is the first submarine in Myanmar Navy's arsenal.

news_headline: Four people injured in shooting in Berlin; manhunt underway
news_article: At least four people were injured in a shooting on Saturday in the German capital Berlin, the police said. The injured were taken to a hospital following an altercation involving several people in the Kreuzberg district, it added. Police further said that there is no indication of a political motive and a manhunt is underway for the gunmen.

news_headline: Nepal SC issues notice to PM Oli govt over dissolution of Parliament
news_article: Nepal's Supreme Court on Friday issued a show-cause notice to PM K P Sharma Oli-led government over its decision to dissolve the Parliament. This comes after a constitutional bench led by Chief Justice Cholendra Shumsher JB Rana heard writ petitions filed against the dissolution. The court also ordered government to submit a written reply by January 3.

news_headline: Be strong in backing Taiwan against China: Japan minister to Biden
news_article: Calling the island's safety a "red line", Japan's Deputy Defence Minister Yasuhide Nakayama urged US President-elect Joe Biden to "be strong" in backing Taiwan against China. We're concerned that China would expand its "aggressive stance" into Taiwan, he added. An official in Biden's team said the President-elect believes US support for Taiwan "must remain strong, principled, and bipartisan".

news_headline: 3 UN peacekeepers killed in attack in Central African Republic
news_article: Three UN peacekeepers were killed and two others were injured by unidentified gunmen in the Central African Republic (CAR), UN Secretary spokesperson Stephane Dujarric said on Friday. UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres condemned the attack and warned that attacks against UN  peacekeepers may "constitute a war crime". The attack comes ahead of the presidential polls due to take place on Sunday.

news_headline: Air Canada Boeing 737-8 MAX suffers engine issue, pilots forced to divert
news_article: An Air Canada Boeing 737-8 MAX flying between Arizona and Montreal with three crew members faced an engine issue that forced pilots to divert it to Tucson, Arizona. Pilots received an "engine indication" and "decided to shut down one engine" shortly after take-off, the airline said. Boeing 737 MAX recently returned to service after a 20-month safety grounding.

news_headline: Congress to ally with Left parties for West Bengal assembly polls
news_article: The Congress has formally approved an alliance with Left parties for the upcoming assembly elections in West Bengal, state party chief Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said. In October, CPI(M) Central Committee had decided that the party and the Left Front will have an electoral understanding with Congress in the West Bengal polls. The state will go to polls in March-April 2021.

news_headline: 6 of 7 JD(U) MLAs in Arunachal Pradesh join BJP
news_article: Six of seven MLAs of Nitish Kumar-led JD(U) have joined the ruling BJP in Arunachal Pradesh, a bulletin issued by the state legislative assembly stated. Talem Taboh, Hayeng Mangfi, Jikke Tako and Dongru Siongju are among the JD(U) MLAs who joined BJP. The lone MLA from the People's Party of Arunachal (PPA), Kardo Nyigyor, has also joined the saffron party.

news_headline: Rajinikanth admitted to hospital after 'severe fluctuations' in BP
news_article: Actor Rajinikanth has been admitted to Apollo Hospital in Hyderabad on Friday for further evaluation after his blood pressure showed "severe fluctuations", a statement from the hospital said. The 70-year-old tested negative for Covid-19 on December 22 after some crew members of the film he was shooting for in Hyderabad tested positive. The hospital added that he was hemodynamically stable.

news_headline: Mamata opened door to BJP with TMC-BJP alliance in 1999: Adhir Ranjan
news_article: Addressing a rally on Wednesday, Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said, "People of Bengal did not have any relations with BJP. Mamata Banerjee opened political doors to BJP by forming TMC-BJP alliance during 1999 Lok Sabha polls." He added, "We had cautioned her then. BJP could strengthen its foothold in Bengal due to her."

news_headline: PM views Northeast as focal point for India’s development: Shah in Assam
news_article: Home Minister Amit Shah, who is on a two-day visit to Assam, on Saturday said that PM Narendra Modi considers the Northeast of India as the focal point for the nation's development. PM Modi has visited the region "30 times in the last six years and each time, he has come with some gifts", Shah said.

news_headline: General Secy of Kamal Haasan's party joins BJP ahead of TN Assembly polls
news_article: General Secretary of Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam (MNM) A Arunachalam joined BJP on Friday, ahead of Tamil Nadu Assembly elections. Arunachalam, who is a founding member of MNM, said he took the decision after Haasan refused to support the Centre's farm laws. "Coming from a farming family, I know the benefits of [the farm laws]", he said.

news_headline: Rahul Gandhi, Ghulam Nabi meet President Kovind over farm laws
news_article: Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi, Ghulam Nabi Azad and Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury met President Ram Nath Kovind at the Rashtrapati Bhavan on Thursday and sought withdrawal of the new farm laws. Following the meeting, Gandhi said, "I told the President that these farm laws are anti-farmer. The country has seen that farmers have stood up against these laws."

news_headline: Will bury you 10 feet deep if you don't leave MP, CM warns mafia
news_article: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Friday issued a warning to mafia elements, stating, "Leave Madhya Pradesh, otherwise, I will bury you 10 feet deep and no one will know your whereabouts." Chouhan added, "I am in a dangerous mood nowadays. I will not spare those who are involved in illegal activities."

news_headline: Some people in Delhi trying to teach me democracy: PM takes jibe at Rahul
news_article: After Congress' Rahul Gandhi claimed India was an "imaginary democracy," PM Narendra Modi said, "There are people in Delhi who always taunt and insult me. They want to teach me lessons in democracy." PM Modi added, "The party that rules in Puducherry has not conducted local body elections...whereas J&K held Panchayat-level polls within one year after becoming a Union Territory."

news_headline: Rahul Gandhi is forever young, frustrated: BJP's Sudhanshu Trivedi
news_article: After Congress leader Rahul Gandhi called India an "imaginary democracy", BJP national spokesperson Sudhanshu Trivedi called him "perpetually young, disenchanted, frustrated and agitated." Meanwhile, Union Minister Prakash Javadekar challenged Gandhi to a debate, stating, "I will prove how Congress always ignored farmers' interests and how (PM Narendra) Modi empowered them."

news_headline: MNS Chief Raj Thackeray summoned in Amazon vandalism case
news_article: A Mumbai court on Thursday issued a notice to Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) Chief Raj Thackeray over a case related to vandalism of Amazon India’s promotional posters. Amazon India filed a plea alleging that MNS workers tore company posters as its app didn't have Marathi as a language option. The MNS has started a campaign called 'No Marathi, No Amazon'.

news_headline: Amit Shah reaches Guwahati to begin BJP's campaign for Assam polls 2021
news_article: Union Home Minister and BJP leader Amit Shah reached Guwahati on late Friday night to begin party's poll campaign for Assam Assembly Elections 2021. Chief Minister Sarbananda Sonowal, Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma, among others, welcomed him at the airport. Sarma said that during Shah's three-day visit to Assam and Manipur, he will also meet BJP allies in Assam.

news_headline: Gupkar Alliance stronger today than when it was formed: Farooq Abdullah
news_article: Jammu and Kashmir National Conference chairman Farooq Abdullah said that People's Alliance for Gupkar Declaration (PAGD) is "much stronger" today than when it was formed. "We are united and we will continue to be united," Abdullah added. Notably, PAGD won 110 seats in the recently concluded District Development Council (DDC) polls in Jammu and Kashmir.

news_headline: BJP ally Rashtriya Loktantrik Party quits NDA in protest over farm laws
news_article: The Rashtriya Loktantrik Party led by Hanuman Beniwal on Saturday said that it was quitting the BJP-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA) to protest the new farm laws that have led to demonstrations by farmers. Earlier, BJP ally SAD had also quit the NDA in support of the farmers' protest demanding the government to repeal the laws.

news_headline: PM Modi is the true well-wisher of farmers: Amit Shah
news_article: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday said that PM Narendra Modi is the true well-wisher of the farmers. He said that PM Modi has deposited ₹95,000 crore directly in the bank accounts of 10 crore farmers within the last two and a half years. "The three farm laws are in the favour of the farmers," he added.

news_headline: AAP to contest local body polls in Gujarat
news_article: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) is going to contest the upcoming local body polls in Gujarat, its state president Gopal Italia announced on Thursday. The process for the selection of candidates and designing the campaign is underway, he added. Notably, the local body polls in the state are likely to be held in February next year.

news_headline: I challenge Bengal CM to organise rally with 10k farmers: Dilip Ghosh
news_article: West Bengal BJP president Dilip Ghosh said, "I am challenging Mamata Banerjee and her leaders to gather 10,000 farmers and organise a rally in Kolkata if they can." "We [BJP] would organise 50,000 farmers and show them. The farmers are with [PM] Narendra Modi," he added while launching a mega booth-level outreach program ahead of 2021 West Bengal Assembly polls.

news_headline: MP Youth Congress to hold rally in support of farmers on Dec 27
news_article: The Madhya Pradesh Youth Congress will organise a meeting with its newly appointed members and will take out a rally on December 27, in support of the ongoing farmers' agitation. MP Youth Congress president Vikrant Bhuria said on Friday that the wing members will play an important role in ensuing local body elections.

news_headline: BJP doesn't give tickets to Muslims but uses them to topple govt: Gehlot
news_article: Addressing a press conference in Jaipur on Friday, Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot said, "The BJP does not give a ticket to Muslims during elections, but they are being used to topple the government." Gehlot added, "The PM delivered a sweet talk in AMU. He spoke about secularism...But does he practice that? There's a difference between his speech and action."

news_headline: Don't believe lies by parties who never did anything: JP Nadda to farmers
news_article: BJP President JP Nadda on Friday urged farmers not to fall for lies that are being spread by political parties, who never did anything despite being "in power for decades". "Beware of them," he further said, adding, "Support Prime Minister Narendra Modi to make farmer brothers and the entire country prosperous and self-reliant."

news_headline: Karunanidhi's son MK Alagiri to decide on launching his party after Jan 3
news_article: Former DMK chief and Tamil Nadu CM Kalaignar M Karunanidhi's elder son MK Alagiri has scheduled a meeting with his supporters in Madurai on January 3 after which he'll "take decision" on launching his party. "There's no chance of working with DMK in forthcoming election," Alagiri further said. Meanwhile, he added that he hasn't "yet decided" on alliance with Rajinikanth.

news_headline: Mass participation reflects people's faith in democracy: Shah on J&K DDC polls
news_article: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Wednesday said, "Congratulations to the people of Jammu and Kashmir for such great turnout in District Development Council polls...The mass participation in these elections reflects people's faith in democracy." He added, "BJP under the leadership of PM Narendra Modi will continue to work relentlessly towards the prosperity and development of the J&K region."

news_headline: Rahul Gandhi to meet President with 2 cr signatures against farm laws
news_article: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi will meet President Ram Nath Kovind on Thursday to submit a memorandum containing two crore signatures seeking the repeal of the farm laws passed by the Parliament. Rahul will also lead a demonstration, along with Congress MPs, from Vijay Chowk to Rashtrapati Bhavan at 10:45 am, Congress MP K Suresh told ANI.

news_headline: Will sleep only after lotus blooms: Suvendu Adhikari at WB roadshow
news_article: Former TMC leader Suvendu Adhikari, who recently joined BJP in West Bengal, has said, "I'll sleep only after the lotus blooms [in the state]." Adhikari held a three-hour long roadshow from Mecheda Bypass to Central Bus Stand in Purba Medinipur's Contai Municipality area. "Roadshow has shown that I've made right decision [to join BJP] and have people's approval," he added.

news_headline: BJP leaders will soon join NCP in large numbers: Ajit Pawar
news_article: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar has said that the leaders who were "imported by BJP on a big scale" during the assembly elections will be joining the Nationalist Congress Party in the next three to four months. "Some leaders want to join us now, but we will start admitting them after the election code of conduct is over," Pawar added.

news_headline: I couldn't have taken stress: Anurag Basu on removing Govinda from 'Jagga Jasoos'
news_article: Talking about removal of Govinda from 2017 film 'Jagga Jasoos', director Anurag Basu said, "There was confusion if Govindaji is coming on set or is he cancelling the flight or is he taking the flight or are we cancelling the shoot." He added, "It was so unpredictable. I couldn’t have taken that stress...I just had to let go of him."

news_headline: Rajinikanth's health progressing well: Hospitalised actor's doctors
news_article: Actor Rajinikanth, who was admitted to Apollo Hospital in Hyderabad on Friday, is "progressing well", according to the hospital's official statement. "His blood pressure is still on the higher side although under better control than yesterday. His investigations haven't revealed anything alarming so far. He's scheduled for a further set of investigations today," the statement read.

news_headline: Actor Anil Nedumangad drowns to death aged 48 in Kerala dam while bathing with friends
news_article: Actor Anil Nedumangad, known for his roles in Malayalam films 'Ayyappanum Koshiyum', 'Kammattipaadam' and 'Paavada', drowned to death aged 48 today in Malankara dam in Kerala's Thodupuzha. He had stepped into the Malankara dam reservoir to take a bath with his friends. Condoling Anil's demise, actor Dulquer Salmaan wrote, "Heart hurts. Can’t make sense of this. RIP Anil etta."

news_headline: Demi Lovato posts pics of her stretch marks, puts glitter paint on them
news_article: Singer Demi Lovato posted pictures of her stretch marks and wrote, "I wanted to celebrate my stretch marks instead of being ashamed of them. I started wearing glitter paint on my stretch marks to celebrate my body." She also talked about recovering from an eating disorder. "I used to genuinely believe recovery from an eating disorder wasn't real," she said.

news_headline: Hrithik Roshan to star in Hindi remake of 'Vikram Vedha': Reports
news_article: Hrithik Roshan will reportedly star in the Hindi remake of Madhavan and Vijay Sethupathi's 2017 Tamil film 'Vikram Vedha'. As per reports, the film was also offered to Aamir Khan but he backed out as he wasn't satisfied with the screenplay of the remake. It will reportedly be directed by Pushkar and Gayatri, who also helmed the original film.

news_headline: I just didn't want to give it to anyone: Manav on battling COVID-19
news_article: Talking about dealing with coronavirus, actor Manav Kaul said, "My doctor friend was very helpful...He checked my report and said I'd...mild COVID-19." He added, "So I was confident...I would be fine. I just didn't want to give COVID to anyone else...was completely at home for about two weeks." Manav tested positive while shooting for his upcoming film 'Nail Polish'.

news_headline: Was more filled with concern for family: Abhishek on getting COVID-19
news_article: Abhishek Bachchan recently talked about the time when he tested positive for coronavirus and said, "I was more filled with concern for my family than anything else." "You're concerned about your loved ones and want them...be alright. There'd be little that you can do," said Abhishek whose father Amitabh Bachchan, wife Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and daughter Aaradhya also tested positive.

news_headline: 38 years of togetherness: Suniel Shetty shares video on anniversary
news_article: On his 38th wedding anniversary with Mana Shetty, actor Suniel Shetty shared a video, which included several old pictures of the actor and his wife. "38 years of togetherness...make your marriage more memorable than your wedding...Happy anniversary WIFEY," he wrote. Several celebrities, including Tiger Shroff, Sanjay Kapoor and Bosco Leslie Martis, also wished the couple on the occasion.

news_headline: Never thought there will be a film in which I'll play lead: Pankaj on Kaagaz
news_article: Actor Pankaj Tripathi, who'll be seen in the lead role in 'Kaagaz', has said, "I...never thought that someday there will be a film in which I'll play the lead." "Because as early as 16 years ago...no one would've thought that...a plain-looking guy like me could be the lead actor," he added. "So when this thing happened...I got excited," said Pankaj.

news_headline: Our interactions are always enriching: Ranveer shares pic with Mahesh Babu
news_article: Ranveer Singh, who recently collaborated with Mahesh Babu for an advertisement, took to Instagram to share a picture from the sets.  He wrote, "One of the finest gentlemen I have had the privilege to collaborate with. Our interactions are always enriching. Love & Respect to big brother Mahesh Garu." Reacting to Ranveer's post, Mahesh wrote, "The feeling is mutual."

news_headline: Good film offers are coming after Sacred Games & Mirzapur: Harshita
news_article: Actress Harshita Shekhar Gaur has said she's glad that the OTT space has opened avenues for talent. "I don't know if people were aware of me earlier but after Sacred Games and Mirzapur, good film offers are coming my way," she added. "I think web has changed the game. It has rightly made story the hero," Harshita further said.

news_headline: We're getting stuck with the underworld gangster genre: Supriya on OTT
news_article: Stating that there is variety in the content that is being released on digital platforms in western countries, actress Supriya Pathak said, "In India, we seem to be getting stuck with the underworld gangster genre...the tone is very similar." Supriya said, "In this country if one thing works, we have a tendency to dole out cookie-cutter versions of the same."

news_headline: Being loved for what you love doing is greatest feeling ever: Anil
news_article: While speaking about the response he is getting for his performance in the film 'AK vs AK', following its digital release, actor Anil Kapoor said, "Being loved for what you love doing is the greatest feeling ever." He further said, "I am here because of fans and their undying support. Without them we are nothing."

news_headline: Comedy is the toughest beat to crack for any actor: Mrunal
news_article: Talking about the comedy genre, actress Mrunal Thakur said it's the "toughest beat to crack" for any actor. The actress, who'll be seen in the comedy film 'Aankh Micholi', added, "The most important virtue is to be observant in order to have a good comic timing and I tried to inculcate that right from the word go!"

news_headline: Rashmika to share screen space with Big B in Vikas Bahl's next: Reports
news_article: South Indian actress Rashmika Mandanna will star alongside Amitabh Bachchan in Vikas Bahl's next film, which is tentatively titled 'Deadly', as per reports. The film is a father-daughter story and it will also feature Neena Gupta, reports added. It will be produced by Reliance Entertainment and is scheduled to go on floors in March 2021, reports further said.

news_headline: Wasn't easy to convince Annu Kapoor for the role: 'Paurashpur' director
news_article: Speaking about roping in veteran actor Annu Kapoor for the web series 'Paurashpur', director Shachindra Vats said it wasn't easy to convince the actor to play the role of king Bhadrapratap in the show. "King Bhadrapratap has shades of grey but the character exudes power and attitude, and Annu Kapoor has done full justice to the role," Shachindra added.

news_headline: Rejected a few offers on OTT as they had too much of skin show: Adaa Khan
news_article: Actress Adaa Khan has said she has rejected a few offers on the web because they'd "too much of skin show". "[Can't] do bold characters for the heck of it. Story needs to justify...intimate scenes. They can't be included just to get instant...attention," she added. Adaa further said she'd like to do shows like 'Delhi Crime' and 'Made in Heaven'.

news_headline: I'm not worried: Richa on releasing Shakeela in theatres amid COVID-19
news_article: Actress Richa Chadha, on being asked if she is worried about the theatrical release of 'Shakeela' amid the coronavirus pandemic, said, "No, I am not." "We are all living in strange times, so no point in being worried about something like this," she added. "I am hoping that people will want to watch Shakeela in theatres," Richa further said.

news_headline: Pandemic has put a stop to my creative process: Filmmaker Scorsese
news_article: Hollywood filmmaker Martin Scorsese has said that the coronavirus pandemic has put a stop to his "creative process". "I've to find a way to get back to a singular creative impulse for my new film, the way I had for Irishman. Cut away all the award ceremonies, all that stuff, and get back to being...alone with a project," he added.

news_headline: Akshay Kumar backs out of King Suheldev film: Reports
news_article: Akshay Kumar has reportedly backed out of a film based on King Suheldev. The actor reportedly refused to be part of the project as "he was not on the same page with...stakeholders creatively". "Even dates were an issue as Akshay is blocked for...next two years," reports said. The film is reportedly an adaptation of Amish Tripathi's book, 'Legend of Suheldev'.

news_headline: Important to understand need of the hour: Sara on 'Coolie...' OTT release
news_article: Sara Ali Khan has said she's a bit disappointed with the digital release of 'Coolie No 1' as she won't be able to check the box office numbers. "But I also think, as actors...it's very important to understand the need of the hour. With...pandemic...it's socially responsible and necessary that we give you something fun and entertaining at home," she added.

news_headline: My ordinariness will never get corrupted: Pankaj Tripathi
news_article: Actor Pankaj Tripathi, on being asked if he fears getting corrupted by the shine of showbiz, said that his ordinariness will never get corrupted. "I'm a grounded person, connected to nature. I travel to villages and small towns. So, no it won't get corrupted because when your roots are firmly in...ground, the tree will survive both...good and...bad times," he added.

news_headline: Johnny Depp seeks retrial in 'wife beater' case against UK tabloid
news_article: Johnny Depp has asked the Court of Appeal to order a retrial of his libel claim against The Sun for calling him a "wife beater". The judge in the case determined the tabloid's claim to be "substantially true" earlier this year. According to legal documents obtained by Daily Mail, Depp has claimed that he "did not receive a fair trial".

news_headline: It was very satisfying as an actor: Ishaan on 'A Suitable Boy' role
news_article: Actor Ishaan Khatter, who played a character named Maan Kapoor in 'A Suitable Boy', spoke about his role and said, "It was very satisfying as an actor." He added, "It gave me the chance to display many shades within one character, without stepping out of the boundaries of his life and the believability of the character."

news_headline: NEXA gets India’s 1st multi-financier online car finance: Maruti Suzuki
news_article: Maruti Suzuki India Limited has announced the launch of multi-financier 'Smart Finance' service for NEXA customers across 30 cities. With this, it has become India's 1st car OEM to offer online, end-to-end car finance services, Maruti Suzuki mentioned. The platform offers one-stop convenience with option to compare loan offerings from multiple financiers, enabling customers to make an informed choice.

news_headline: Our safety innovations have saved over a million lives: Volvo
news_article: Volvo has said that the seatbelt, the speed limit and every other feature unique to its cars has contributed to saving millions of lives. "Volvo Cars has been a leader in the field of car safety for decades," the company added. Volvo further said that with the coming year 2021, it'll begin its journey to save a million more lives.

news_headline: Own a car without buying it : Revv Subscriptions
news_article: You can now drive a new car every month as Revv provides the option to subscribe to your favourite car for 1-36 months with ₹0 down payment, ₹0 road tax and without the hassle of maintenance and service. The car will be sanitized and delivered to your doorstep ensuring complete safety for you and your loved ones.

news_headline: 80-year-old man from Austria buys his 80th Porsche, pictures surface
news_article: Ottocar J, a resident of Austria's Vienna who recently bought a Boxster Spyder in blue colour, has bought 80 Porsche cars over the past several decades. He said his passion for Porsche started nearly 50 years ago. "I can drive a different one every day for a month, and two at the weekends," Ottocar, who currently owns 38 cars, said.

news_headline: Musk reveals he tried selling Tesla to Apple but Tim Cook refused a meeting
news_article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk revealed that he once approached Apple CEO Tim Cook to discuss the possibility of the iPhone maker acquiring Tesla for a tenth of its current value, indicating a valuation of about $60 billion. "He refused to take the meeting," he added. Musk said he had contacted Cook during the "darkest days" of development of Model 3.

news_headline: Elon Musk only $20 billion away from becoming the world's richest person
news_article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk is now only $20 billion away from becoming the world's richest person overtaking Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos, according to Bloomberg. The 49-year-old's net worth jumped almost $9 billion to $167.3 billion on Friday as Tesla shares soared. He has added nearly $140 billion this year, which is more than the entire net worth of Bill Gates.

news_headline: Mahindra's South Korean unit SsangYong files for bankruptcy
news_article: Mahindra & Mahindra's South Korean subsidiary SsangYong Motor Company has filed for bankruptcy after it defaulted on loan repayment of about ₹400 crore. SsangYong has also applied for an autonomous restructuring support programme, which gives the automaker up to three months to negotiate with stakeholders to resolve issues. Mahindra acquired SsangYong from near-insolvency in 2010.

news_headline: Auto industry lost ₹2,300cr a day in lockdown: Parliamentary panel
news_article: The automotive industry suffered ₹2,300 crore loss per day during the COVID-19 lockdown, according to a parliamentary panel report submitted to Rajya Sabha Chairman M Venkaiah Naidu. The sector witnessed an estimated job loss of about 3.45 lakh, the report said. All major original equipment manufacturers (OEM) cut down their production by 18-20% due to low demand, it added.

news_headline: Apple aiming to produce self-driving car by 2024: Report
news_article: Apple is aiming for a 2024 launch for its self-driving passenger vehicle that could include its own breakthrough battery technology, Reuters reported. Apple's automotive unit, codenamed Project Titan, was started in 2014 with a former Tesla executive at its helm. Apple is also reportedly working on a new battery that would increase the vehicle’s range and also be "radically" cheaper.

news_headline: Amazon's Zoox unveils autonomous EV that can travel both ways
news_article: Amazon-owned self-driving car platform Zoox has unveiled a fully autonomous electric vehicle with no steering wheel which can travel in either direction. Equipped with two battery packs, the four-seater robotaxi can run for 16 hours on a single charge and can attain a maximum speed of 120 kmph. CEO Aicha Evans said Zoox plans on launching an app-based ride-hailing service.

news_headline: Apple CFO, Apple's ex-design chief candidates for Ferrari CEO: Report
news_article: Apple CFO Luca Maestri and former Chief Design Officer Jony Ive are reportedly candidates to be Ferrari's next CEO, Reuters reported. Ferrari CEO Louis Camilleri announced his retirement earlier due to "personal reasons". Former Vodafone CEO Vittorio Colao was allegedly in the running for the position too, but Reuters said a source close to Colao has called the claim "groundless".

news_headline: Honda recalls 737,000 Accord, Insight cars in US over software flaw
news_article: Honda is recalling 737,000 Accord gas and hybrid cars from 2018 to 2020 and Insight hybrid cars from 2019 to 2020 after discovering a glitch in its software. The programming flaw in its control computer can cause the rear camera, turn signals and windshield wipers to malfunction. The move comes as part of a larger recall of 1.79-million cars worldwide.

news_headline: Musk asks Tesla staff to push output to max possible through Dec: Report
news_article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has sent an email to workers encouraging them to push output to the maximum possible through December, Bloomberg reported. "We are fortunate to have the high-class problem of demand being quite a bit higher than production this quarter," the report quoted Musk. The company has a target of delivering 5 lakh cars this year.

news_headline: Apple's self-driving car poses a real challenge: Volkswagen CEO
news_article: On reports of Apple launching its self-driving car by 2024, Volkswagen CEO Herbert Diess said, it poses "a real challenge—dimensions greater than those within our industry" such as Toyota. "The incredible evaluation and thus the virtually unlimited access to resources inspire us a great deal of respect," Diess said. "We are looking forward to new competitors," he further added.

news_headline: Indian auto sector to see stronger growth in 2021: Nomura
news_article: Global brokerage firm Nomura expects India's auto industry to register stronger growth next year. The personal vehicle segment, however, will recover to pre-COVID-19 levels only in 2023-24, the brokerage said. The auto industry faced an unprecedented challenge owing to the pandemic during the first half of 2020-21, Automotive Component Manufacturers Association (ACMA) had said.

news_headline: Tesla to shut down production of Model S, X for 18 days: Report
news_article: Elon Musk-led Tesla will shut down the production of its high-end Model S and Model X electric vehicles from December 24 to January 11 in Fremont, California, CNBC reported. Employees will be given a full week's pay along with few paid holidays. Deliveries of these models amounted to only 11% of total vehicle deliveries during Tesla's third quarter of 2020.

news_headline: Honda India stops Civic, CR-V production after Gr Noida plant closure
news_article: Honda India Senior Vice-President Rajesh Goel confirmed that production of its Civic and CR-V models is ending after the closure of its production facility in Greater Noida. The company now has only one plant in India, at Tapukara in Rajasthan. He said the models have to be discontinued as the Tapukara plant is designed to manufacture only mid-size cars.

news_headline: Honda shuts 23-year-old car unit in UP's Greater Noida
news_article: Honda Cars India has decided to shut its plant in Uttar Pradesh's Greater Noida, which was set up in 1997, reports said. However, the plant will continue to have its research and development set-up, spare parts division and corporate office. The automaker will rely on its facility in Rajasthan to roll out its entire product range in India, reports added.

news_headline: Tesla shares fall 6% in first day of trading on S&P 500 index
news_article: Elon Musk-led Tesla's shares on Monday dipped as much as 6.3% in pre-market trading in its first day of trading on the S&P 500 index. Tesla, which is the most valuable company to be added to the benchmark index, will account for 1.69% of the S&P 500. Tesla's shares have soared over 700% so far in 2020.

news_headline: India's fuel demand falls again in November after one-month pause
news_article: India's fuel demand resumed its downward trajectory last month after rising for the first time in seven months in October, Petroleum Planning and Analysis Cell data showed. While the overall consumption for petroleum products in November declined by nearly 4% against last year, the demand for petrol rose over 5%. Kerosene and diesel consumption slipped by 18% and 7% respectively.

news_headline: Fiat Chrysler to invest $150 mn to set up digital hub in Hyderabad
news_article: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles (FCA) has said it will invest $150 million to set up a global digital hub in Hyderabad. The investment will help create nearly 1,000 jobs by the end of 2021. "One of the key objectives...is to digitalise every aspect of FCA's automotive operations globally and within India," Mamatha Chamarthi, CIO for North America and Asia-Pacific region, said.

news_headline: Mahindra's Korean unit SsangYong defaults on $55 million loan
news_article: Automaker Mahindra & Mahindra's South Korean unit SsangYong Motor Company has defaulted on loan repayment of about $55 million. Around $27.5 million was owed to Bank of America, $18.3 million to JP Morgan Chase and $9.1 million to BNP Paribas on December 14. Mahindra has been looking for a buyer for all or most of its 75% stake since June.

news_headline: Bajaj Auto to set up ₹650 crore manufacturing unit in Maharashtra
news_article: Bajaj Auto has said that it will invest ₹650 crore to set up a manufacturing plant in Maharashtra's Chakan. The facility is expected to start production in 2023 and will be utilised for manufacturing high-end KTM, Husqvarna and Triumph motorcycles, and electric vehicles, the automaker added. Bajaj Auto signed an MoU with the state government for the same.

news_headline: Ola eyeing sites in India, Europe to build charging stations: Report
news_article: Ride-hailing platform Ola is looking for multiple sites across India and Europe to build a network of charging stations for electric two-wheelers, PTI reported quoting sources. The charging stations will allow customers to charge their vehicles and they'll address concerns around charging requirements. Ola recently said it'll invest ₹2,400 crore to set up an electric scooter factory in Tamil Nadu.

news_headline: Scientists trial drug that could give immunity after coronavirus exposure
news_article: British scientists are trialling a new drug that could give instant immunity against COVID-19 to people who have been recently exposed to coronavirus. The antibody treatment developed by AstraZeneca has been administered to 10 people so far in the study, which aims to recruit 1,125 people worldwide. Scientists hope the drug would provide protection for up to a year.

news_headline: 57,000-year-old wolf cub found preserved in Canada with skin, fur intact
news_article: A preserved wolf cub, estimated to be about 57,000-years-old, was found buried under permafrost in Canada by a gold miner in 2016, researchers said in a study published on Monday. "This mummy...has basically got all her skin, most of her fur...soft tissues present," they added. The female cub is "the oldest, most complete wolf that's ever been found", researchers said.

news_headline: Jupiter and Saturn come closest in night sky after 397 years, pics go viral
news_article: Jupiter and Saturn came closer than any time in 397 years on Monday night in the event dubbed 'Great Conjunction'. The two planets were at their closest separation at 0.1° apart. The event was visible with the unaided eye as well. The pictures above include the event as seen from New Delhi, Las Vegas and New York among others.

news_headline: NASA shares pic of Jupiter-Saturn's 'Great Conjunction' as seen from Moon
news_article: The NASA's official account about Earth's Moon shared a picture of the 'Great Conjunction' of planets Jupiter and Saturn as seen from the Moon. "Unlike Sun, that's no star, it's two planets! #TheGreatConjunction looks great from the Moon!" it captioned the picture. On Monday night, Saturn and Jupiter were the closest in the sky in nearly 400 years.

news_headline: How close will Jupiter, Saturn come today in 400 yrs & how can people watch it?
news_article: On Monday night, Jupiter and Saturn will be at their closest separation in the sky since 1623 at 0.1° apart. "To see the Great Conjunction, look toward the southwest after sunset: it doesn't matter where on Earth you are!" tweeted astronomer Dr James O'Donoghue. "Find a spot with...unobstructed view of the sky, such as a field or park," said NASA.

news_headline: 'World's ugliest orchid' featured in Kew's list of 2020's top 10 discoveries
news_article: Gastrodia agnicellus, nicknamed the 'ugliest orchid in the world', has featured in Kew's list of the top 10 discoveries of the year. The orchid depends on fungi for nutrition and has no leaves or any other photosynthetic tissue. As many as 156 plant and fungal species were named by Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew, and partners worldwide in 2020.

news_headline: Indian photographer's image of Jupiter-Saturn conjunction goes viral
news_article: Indian photographer Sajal Chakraborty's photograph of the 'Great Conjunction' of Jupiter and Saturn taken from Australia which also shows Jupiter's four largest moons has gone viral. Chakraborty explained that he stacked 25 images to achieve the clarity seen in the final image. It got over 1.3 million likes after a Twitter user named Rebecca Hill shared it on the platform.

news_headline: Dinosaur fossil found in Brazil reveals new chicken-sized species
news_article: Paleontologists have discovered a chicken-sized dinosaur species with a mane of hair down its back and stiff ribbon-like structures projecting from its shoulders. The dinosaur, Ubirajara jubatus, is believed to have lived around 110 million years ago in northeastern Brazil. "There are...strange dinosaurs, but this one is unlike any of them," said professor David Martill, who helped lead the study.

news_headline: 30,000 tremors hit Antarctica in 3 months: Scientists
news_article: More than 30,000 tremors have rocked Antarctica since the end of August, scientists at University of Chile said. The small earthquakes were detected in Bransfield Strait, an ocean channel between South Shetland Islands and Antarctic Peninsula. Several tectonic plates and microplates meet near the strait, leading to frequent rumbling, but the past three months have been unusual, scientists said.

news_headline: No need for major alarm over new coronavirus strain: WHO
news_article: WHO has said there is no need for major alarm over the emergence of COVID-19's new variant and that it was a normal part of a pandemic's evolution. WHO officials, citing Britain's data, said they had no evidence that the variant was deadlier than existing strains. Officials said coronavirus mutations had so far been much slower than with influenza.

news_headline: Govt calls on startups to scale up vaccine portal, winner to get ₹40 lakh
news_article: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare along with the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology has launched a challenge for startups and technology enthusiasts to scale up the COVID Vaccine Intelligence Network (CoWIN) portal. Participants can focus on seven areas including vaccine's portability and queue management. The top two contestants will get ₹40 lakh and ₹20 lakh respectively.

news_headline: ISRO's next PSLV launch to carry spacetech startup Pixxel satellite
news_article: ISRO has announced that the next PSLV-C51 launch will carry the first satellite by spacetech startup Pixxel India, 'Anand', which is an earth observation satellite, in early 2021. Along with Anand, a satellite by Space Kidz India and another by a consortium of universities will be launched. The primary payload of PSLV-C51 will be a Brazilian earth observation satellite 'Amazonia'.

news_headline: 'Forever chemicals' used in outdoor gear found in snow on Mt Everest: Study
news_article: "Forever chemicals" used in water-repellent outdoor gear have been found in snow near Mount Everest's summit, University of Maine reported. A research assistant professor at the university said these human-made PFAS could eventually pose a risk for residents who drink the water. This marks the first time that Everest snow and meltwater has been analysed for PFAS, the professor said.

news_headline: Chinese spacecraft brings 1st lunar samples in over 40 years
news_article: China's Chang'e-5 probe successfully landed in the northern Chinese region, bringing back the first lunar rocks and soil retrieved by any country in over 40 years. China is now the third country to have retrieved lunar samples. It will be sharing a portion of the lunar soil with other nations and organisations based on international cooperation conventions.

news_headline: Workers from 27 nations building hybrid sailboat for goods to reduce pollution
news_article: Around 200 workers from 27 nations are building a hybrid sailboat, Ceiba, in Costa Rica aiming to transport goods without polluting the environment. Ceiba will rely mostly on wind power with two auxiliary electric engines for manoeuvring in ports and low winds. It will be put into operation in 2022 on routes between Canada, Ecuador and Hawaii.

news_headline: Only 10% of tropical forests left in Indonesia fire-resistant: Study
news_article: A Swansea University's researchers-led study has revealed only 10% of the tropical forests left in Indonesia remains fire-resistant. The rest has been severely fragmented or degraded and therefore is no longer able to maintain a fire-resistant microclimate. An area of tropical forest and peatland larger than the Netherlands has burned in Indonesia in the past five years, according to Greenpeace.

news_headline: US Space Force personnel will be called 'Guardians': Vice Prez
news_article: The members of the US Space Force will be called "Guardians", Vice President Mike Pence announced at an event celebrating Space Force's first anniversary. "The name Guardians connects our proud heritage and culture to the important mission we execute 24/7, protecting the people and interest of the US and its allies," the Space Force tweeted.

news_headline: Microplastics found in the placentas of unborn babies for the first time
news_article: Microplastic particles have been revealed in the placentas of unborn babies for the first time. A team of Italian researchers found microplastics on both the foetal and maternal sides of placenta of healthy women and in the membrane within which the foetus develops. "The mothers were shocked," said Antonio Ragusa, who is the lead author of the study.

news_headline: Only half a beer can hamper hand-eye coordination: NASA study
news_article: A NASA-led study said hand-eye coordination in driving and other activities, is compromised after consuming the equivalent of less than a half of beer, for a person weighing around 75 kilograms. Researchers had measured volunteers' eye movements, pupil responses and BAC multiple times during a day while they performed a specially designed task, before and after they drank alcohol.

news_headline: Novel skin disease in dolphins linked to climate change: Study
news_article: Scientists at The Marine Mammal Center identified a novel skin disease in dolphins that is linked to climate change. Due to decreased water salinity brought upon by climate change, the dolphins develop patchy and raised skin lesions across their bodies. The deadly skin disease was first noted on approximately 40 bottlenose dolphins near New Orleans after Hurricane Katrina in 2005.

news_headline: Potentially damaging surface ozone levels rose in lockdown in UK: Study
news_article: The University of York has revealed less traffic on the roads during the first lockdown may have caused potentially damaging surface ozone levels to rise in the UK. The study said levels of nitrogen dioxide fell by 42% on average and surface ozone increased by 11%. The first lockdown levels of O3 were the worst in the South of England.

news_headline: New population of blue whales found in Indian Ocean: Researchers
news_article: Researchers have discovered a new population of blue whales in the western Indian Ocean. Every blue whale population sings a unique song and researchers described a new blue whale song heard from the Arabian Sea coast of Oman across to the Chagos Archipelago. Dr Salvatore Cerchio, Visiting Scientist at the New England Aquarium, first recorded the novel song in 2017.

news_headline: Japan's JAXA shares pictures of asteroid Ryugu samples it collected
news_article: Japan's JAXA has shared pictures of the samples it collected during its mission to asteroid Ryugu. It shared an image showing the contents of the Hayabusa2 probe's sample capsule's 'C' chamber. JAXA says the largest particles in chamber 'C' were about a centimetre in size. In the picture, JAXA has marked one of the particles as an "artificial object".

news_headline: 7 DNA fingerprints that show cancer risks in people found: Study
news_article: A University of Calgary researcher discovered seven DNA fingerprints or patterns that define cancer risk in people. "We believe that a baby is born with a germline genomic pattern and it will not change, and that pattern is associated with a lower or higher cancer risk," the researcher said. One of the seven germlines offers protection from developing cancer.

news_headline: Only one unit of PlayStation 5 with 20 kg gold to be made by Russian company
news_article: Russian company Caviar will make only one unit of a luxury Sony PlayStation 5 gaming console which will be made by assembling eight sheets created by using 20 kilograms of gold. The controllers will be made of crocodile leather with gold inserts. While the company did not reveal the gadget's price, a report estimated it will cost over ₹8 crore.

news_headline: Jack Ma loses $11 billion in two months
news_article: Alibaba Co-Founder Jack Ma's net worth has plunged by almost $11 billion in two months as China increased scrutiny of the e-commerce giant and its fintech affiliate Ant Group. The 56-year-old's wealth, which reached a peak of $61.7 billion this year, has tumbled to $50.9 billion. China recently launched an anti-monopoly investigation into Alibaba, weeks after suspending Ant's $35-billion IPO.

news_headline: Boston Dynamics robots dance together to wish New Year; company shares video
news_article: Boston Dynamics got its robots to dance together to celebrate the arrival of 2021. The American robotics design company released a video of its robots performing a choreographed dance routine to 'Do You Love Me' by The Contours. The video features Atlas the humanoid robot, Spot the robot dog, and Handle, a robot designed to move boxes.

news_headline: Fake news of Microsoft buying Sony for $130 billion spreads due to satire article
news_article: Fake news about Microsoft buying Sony with all its divisions including PlayStation for $130 billion went viral on Tuesday.
