The 600-foot ship has been designed as a floating landing point for the first-stage booster of New Glenn rocket.

news_headline: Be aware of 'pay and register' coronavirus vaccine scams: Cyber Dost
news_article: The Ministry of Home Affairs' cybersecurity awareness handle, Cyber Dost, has warned people to be aware of the scams related to coronavirus vaccines. Criminals may offer to "pay and register" to get priority in receiving COVID-19 vaccines by sending malicious links, emails, phone calls and messages, it said. Criminals are resorting to various tricks due to COVID-19-related apprehension, it added.

news_headline: Apple removes app promoting 'secret' parties amid COVID-19 in US
news_article: Apple has removed an iOS app that promoted "secret gatherings" in New York City, which would have been illegal under current COVID-19 pandemic restrictions in US. Vybe Together gained exposure when a New York Times reporter tweeted about it, saying it promoted "COVID-unsafe large, indoor house parties". The app had a few thousand users, Vybe Together's Co-founder told The Verge.

news_headline: Samsung will be different: Vice-Chairman Jay Lee at bribery trial
news_article: Samsung Vice-Chairman Jay Y Lee on Wednesday said "Samsung will be different” in a trial's final hearing that will decide whether he returns to jail for alleged bribery. He said Samsung's social role and responsibility had been overlooked. Lee was convicted of bribing an associate of former South Korean President Park Geun-hye in 2017 and jailed for five years.

news_headline: Apple, Amazon and Tesla supplier used forced Uighur labour: Report
news_article: Lens Technology, a company that supplies various parts to Apple, Amazon and Tesla, has been accused of using forced labour from thousands of Uighur workers in its Chinese factories. The evidence to the claims was available openly on the internet, the Tech Transparency Project claimed. "Apple has zero tolerance for forced labour," an Apple representative told The Washington Post.

news_headline: Apple patents a 'reconfigurable' keyboard made of displays: Report
news_article: Apple has been granted a new patent by the US Patent and Trademark Office that allows the use of tiny displays on individual keys of the keyboard, Patently Apple reported. According to the patent, letter/character on top of the displays will be customisable, making it easier to reconfigure keyboard layouts and languages as required.

news_headline: Looking to boost electric mobility, water conservation in 2021: NITI Aayog
news_article: NITI Aayog Vice-Chairman Rajiv Kumar said accelerating electric mobility, enhancing competitiveness of textiles industry and pushing water conservation measures will dominate the think-tank's reforms agenda for next year. He added that the current government is "certainly not protectionist" and has increased scope for FDI. He also expects positive GDP growth in the March quarter, he said.

news_headline: UP man booked for using pics of PM Modi to promote mobile brand
news_article: An FIR has been filed against the brother of a UP minister for allegedly using pictures of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and CM Yogi Adityanath to promote a mobile phone brand. The accused had reportedly put up the pictures on a hoarding before the launch of the brand. The advertising agency later took them down and apologised over the matter.

news_headline: NCW asks Amazon to stop spread of pornographic content on platform
news_article: National Commission for Women (NCW) Chairperson Rekha Sharma has written to Amazon after taking cognisance of a tweet that alleged Amazon's Kindle was selling "porn literature". Sharma asked Amazon to stop the transmission of content that may "promote crime against women". She said e-commerce sites should not be party to dissemination of pornographic content as it violates the law.

news_headline: Bitcoin touches $29,000-mark for 1st time, surges almost 50% in Dec
news_article: Bitcoin's value has crossed the $29,000-mark for the first time ever, surging above $29,700. This marks the value of the digital asset surging nearly 50% only in December, making it the biggest monthly gain for the cryptocurrency since 2019. As per Bloomberg, Bitcoin has now quadrupled in value this year amid the global COVID-19 pandemic.

news_headline: Apple removes 39,000 game apps on China store in biggest single day removal
news_article: Apple on Thursday removed over 46,000 apps on its China store, including 39,000 game apps, marking the biggest removal ever in a single day. The apps were removed as December 31 was the deadline for all game publishers to obtain a licence. Only 74 of the top 1,500 paid games on Apple store were not removed, according to Qimai.

news_headline: Haryana Police to set up Regional Cyber Crime Coordination Centre
news_article: Haryana Police has announced that it is in the process of setting up a Regional Cyber Crime Coordination Centre to deal with online criminal activities. The facility will assist the force in enhancing capability in cyber investigations, DGP Manoj Yadava said. Increased use of technology due to COVID-19 has led to sharp rise in cyber crime incidents, he added.

news_headline: Acts of vandalism should stop: Rajnath Singh on damaged telecom towers
news_article: Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Wednesday condemned the disruption of telecom services in Punjab and said, "Such acts of vandalism should stop." "Such things should not happen. Our farmers from Punjab should think about this," he further said. Earlier, Punjab Chief Minister Captain Amarinder Singh directed police to take action against those who're causing the vandalism in the state.

news_headline: Apple loses copyright claims in lawsuit against US startup
news_article: Apple has lost copyright claims in a lawsuit against a Florida startup, Corellium, whose software helps security researchers find vulnerabilities in Apple products. Apple had accused Corellium of replicating iOS to create virtual iOS-operated devices. The judge ruled that Corellium's software amounted to "fair use" since it helped developers find security flaws.

news_headline: Prosecutors seek 9-yr jail term for Samsung Vice Chairman in bribery case
news_article: South Korean prosecutors have requested a nine-year jail term for Samsung Vice Chairman Jay Y Lee during the retrial of a 2016 bribery case. Samsung should "set the example" for efforts to root out corruption, a prosecutor said. Lee had been sentenced to jail for five years in 2017 for bribing an associate of former South Korean President Park Geun-hye.

news_headline: Over 6 lakh Facebook users hit by large-scale ad phishing campaign
news_article: A large-scale ad phishing campaign that has compromised accounts of around 6.15 lakh Facebook users from over 50 countries has been unearthed by cybersecurity firm ThreatNix. The campaign targets users through fake ads and redirects them to phishing sites hosted on GitHub pages. ThreatNix said the campaign targets countries including Nepal and Pakistan and is growing at a rapid pace.

news_headline: Had late-night conversations on leadership with Branson: PayPal CEO
news_article: PayPal CEO Dan Schulman said he has had "a number of late-night conversations" on inequality and the role of a business leader with Virgin Group Founder Richard Branson. He said Branson told him that employees have to be kept above shareholders and customers. Schulman added that this employee-first philosophy has been crucial to PayPal's success.

news_headline: TikTok faces lawsuit from 12-yr-old UK girl for alleged misuse of data
news_article: A 12-year-old girl in London is intending to bring a lawsuit against TikTok for allegedly misusing her personal data and infringing her privacy rights. TikTok was unlawfully processing children's personal data "in order to garner advertising revenue from corporate clients", her lawyers stated. She has also been granted anonymity to avoid direct online bullying.

news_headline: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's net worth quintupled to $167 bn in 2020
news_article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's net worth has quintupled to around $167 billion in 2020, who is now also the world's second richest person, trailing only Amazon's Jeff Bezos. According to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index, Musk started the year at a net worth of $27.6 billion. Tesla's 689% increase in value this year is a major reason for Musk's surge.

news_headline: Stop sneaky moves: Musk as ViaSat asks for environmental probe of Starlink
news_article: Elon Musk criticised ViaSat after the rival communication firm asked the US Federal Communications Commission (FCC) to look into the potential environmental impact of SpaceX's internet venture Starlink's satellites. “Starlink “poses a hazard” to Viasat’s profits, more like it. Stop the sneaky moves, Charlie Ergen!" Musk tweeted. "And Mark Dankberg. This action is wack, not dank!!” he added.

news_headline: Bitcoin hits all time high of $28,600, rallies 295% in 2020
news_article: Cryptocurrency Bitcoin on Wednesday rose over 4.5% to hit an all time high of $28,599.99. The world's most popular cryptocurrency had surpassed the $20,000-mark on December 16 and has surged by nearly half since then. Bitcoin has gained 295% this year, with its market capitalisation exceeding $500 billion, as per CoinDesk.

news_headline: Amazon acquires podcast network Wondery reportedly for $300 million
news_article: Amazon has announced that it is acquiring podcast network Wondery in a deal reportedly worth $300 million. Wondery, which has produced podcasts such as 'Dirty John' and 'Dr. Death', will now join Amazon Music. Amazon added that when the deal closes, "nothing will change for listeners" as they can continue to access Wondery podcasts through several providers.

news_headline: We do not want to raise a child in the public eye: Anushka Sharma
news_article: Actress Anushka Sharma, who is due to deliver her first child in January, has said she and her husband, Team India captain Virat Kohli, do not want to raise a child in the public eye. She added, "We don’t plan on engaging our child in social media. I think it’s a decision your child should be able to take."

news_headline: Warner names himself 'ICC Male TikToker of the Decade', trolls Chahal
news_article: Australia opener David Warner took to Instagram to jokingly declare himself as 'ICC Male TikToker of the Decade'. Warner shared an edited picture with his photograph and text which read, "Sir GP Muthu Award for ICC Male TikToker of the Decade." Trolling spinner Yuzvendra Chahal, Warner wrote, "Thanks everyone for your support. Chahal, I thought we would be joint winners."

news_headline: I've never seen him this happy & light: Wife Prithi on Ravi Ashwin after Test win
news_article: India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin's wife Prithi took to Twitter to comment on her husband's picture that he shared after winning the Melbourne Test. Prithi wrote, "I have seen/spoken to Ashwin after every Test he has played...But I've never seen him this happy, satisfied and light (can I say?) with a smile in his eyes in almost 10 years."

news_headline: ICC issues clarification over New Zealand's Test ranking after win vs Pakistan
news_article: The ICC has issued a clarification after several reports, including that of the official broadcaster of New Zealand-Pakistan Test series, stated New Zealand have become the number one side after winning the first Test. "New Zealand move closer to the number one spot in...ICC Test team rankings...They'll confirm their place at the top if they win the series," ICC stated.

news_headline: Latest Test rankings for batsmen out; Williamson overtakes Kohli, Smith to go on top
news_article: The ICC today announced the latest Test rankings for the batsmen, with New Zealand captain Kane Williamson overtaking India captain Virat Kohli and Australia batsman Steve Smith to go on top of the rankings. Steve Smith has dropped to the third position, while India stand-in captain Ajinkya Rahane jumped five spots to be ranked sixth.

news_headline: Poster of 'Brahmin only' cricket tournament in Hyderabad goes viral
news_article: A poster of a 'Brahmin only' cricket tournament which was held in Hyderabad on December 25 and 26 has gone viral on social media. "Every player should carry their ID proof compulsorily and no other caste players are allowed," one of the rules of the tournament stated. Reacting to it, a user tweeted, "Sure...tell me caste isn't a problem today."

news_headline: Rohit Sharma joins Team India after 2-week quarantine, BCCI shares video
news_article: Team India batsman Rohit Sharma joined the Test squad in Australia after undergoing a two-week quarantine. The BCCI took to social media to share a video of Rohit meeting the team for the first time in Australia. "Good to have you, Rohit...The Hitman has joined #TeamIndia and gets a warm welcome...Who else is excited," the BCCI captioned the video.

news_headline: ICC shares pics of special artwork bats created for 'Players of the Decade'
news_article: The ICC shared pictures on Instagram of 'special artwork' bats made for ICC Players of the Decade. The bats will be presented to India captain Virat Kohli, who won Sir Garfield Sobers Award for being the Male Cricketer of the Decade, and Australia all-rounder Ellyse Perry, who won Rachael Heyhoe-Flint Award for being the Female Cricketer of the Decade.

news_headline: Rahane has his name engraved on MCG Honours Board for 2nd time, BCCI shares video
news_article: Following his match-winning knock of 112 runs in the first innings of the Boxing Day Test against Australia, Team India stand-in captain Ajinkya Rahane got his name engraved on the MCG Honours Board for the second time.The MCG honours board features names of cricketers who have either scored a century or picked up a five-wicket haul at the venue.

news_headline: Pakistan's Fawad Alam scores his second Test hundred 11 years after his first
news_article: Pakistan batsman Fawad Alam on Wednesday scored 102 runs off 269 deliveries against New Zealand in the first Test. It is the 35-year-old's second hundred in Test cricket. His first hundred had come more than 11 years ago in July 2009, when he hit 168(259) against Sri Lanka on debut. The first Test against New Zealand is Alam's sixth Test.

news_headline: Azharuddin's car meets with an accident in Rajasthan, ex-cricketer escapes unhurt
news_article: Former Team India captain and Congress leader Mohammed Azharuddin’s car met with an accident on Wednesday morning in Rajasthan's Soorwal. Azharuddin escaped unhurt according to his personal assistant, news agency ANI reported. Azharuddin was returning to Ranthambore along with his family when the accident happened. He was taken to his hotel in another car.

news_headline: Ben Stokes shares pics of 'Teams of the Decade' caps he received, trolls ICC
news_article: England all-rounder Ben Stokes took to Instagram to share pictures of caps he received for being named in the ICC ODI Team of the Decade and the ICC Test Team of the Decade. Trolling ICC, he captioned his post, "Very proud of both these caps, one of them just doesn't seem right, it's a bit BAGGY and GREEN...thanks ICC."

news_headline: Gill, Rahane played more pull shots than Australia played in two Tests: Ponting
news_article: Former captain Ricky Ponting criticised Australian batsmen for not playing enough pull shots against India in the first two Tests. "Shubman Gill & Ajinkya Rahane played more good pull shots than I think Australia have played in the two Tests," Ponting said. "I can count on one hand in two Tests how many pull shots have been played," he added.

news_headline: Sreesanth named in Kerala squad for Syed Mushtaq Ali T20 tournament
news_article: Indian cricketer Sreesanth, who was banned by the BCCI over his alleged involvement in spot-fixing in the IPL, was included in the Kerala side for the upcoming Syed Mushtaq Ali T20 competition. This would be his first domestic event since his seven-year ban ended in September this year. The Syed Mushtaq Ali T20 tournament starts from January 10 in Mumbai.

news_headline: Good people finish first too: Ganguly lauds Rahane and team after MCG win
news_article: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly took to Twitter to praise Ajinkya Rahane and his side for their eight-wicket win against Australia in the second Test. "A special win at MCG...Well done Ajinkya Rahane ..good people finish first too.. congratulations to all," Ganguly tweeted on Tuesday night. Ganguly also wished the team "best of luck" for the remaining two Test matches.

news_headline: Nothing to float on cloud nine, plenty of work to do: Bishan Bedi to Team India
news_article: Ex-India captain Bishan Singh Bedi has asked the Indian team not to "float on cloud nine" after their eight-wicket win at Melbourne since they still have "plenty of work to do" in the remaining two Tests. "Nice to remain calm as Ajinkya Rahane & deliver...This OZ (Australia) batting is pretty average...so Indians can win the series," Bedi also tweeted.

news_headline: India vs Australia women's ODI series postponed due to COVID-19
news_article: A three-match ODI series between Australia and India women's teams has been postponed till "next season" due to the "impact of global pandemic", Cricket Australia (CA) said on Thursday.  New COVID-19 outbreaks have been reported in Sydney which has led to travel restrictions in Australia. The matches were due to take place in Canberra, Melbourne and Hobart in January 2021.

news_headline: Formula One champion Lewis Hamilton knighted in UK's year-end royal honours
news_article: Seven-time Formula One champion Lewis Hamilton was awarded a knighthood on Wednesday as part of Britain's traditional New Year's Honours list. Hamilton was recognised in the "overseas" section of the honours list to avoid controversy over his tax returns since he lives in the tax haven Monaco. The British Prime Minister, Boris Johnson, reportedly intervened to ensure Hamilton was knighted.

news_headline: Ex-India spinner L Sivaramakrishnan joins BJP ahead of TN assembly polls
news_article: Former India leg-spinner Laxman Sivaramakrishnan joined BJP in Chennai on Wednesday. "I know I couldn't do justice to my talent and expectations of my fans as a cricketer. I will fulfill that commitment in politics," Sivaramakrishnan said. He made his India debut at 17 years and 118 days and was a member of the 1985 World Championship of Cricket-winning team.

news_headline: Aus selectors got lot of thinking to do before the third Test: Ponting
news_article: After eight-wicket loss against India in the second Test, ex-Australia captain Ricky Ponting said  Australian selectors have a lot of thinking to do over next few days. "They've got more questions to answer now than they have had in a long, long time," Ponting added. He also said Warner's return is important while Smith and Labuschagne need to find form.

news_headline: We’ll see how Rohit is doing physically before we take a call: Ravi Shastri
news_article: India coach Ravi Shastri said on Tuesday that Rohit Sharma's selection for the third Test will depend upon how well he is doing physically. "Rohit will join the team on Wednesday...He's coming after a long quarantine. We have to check how he feels before we take a call," Shastri said. On Tuesday, Rohit completed his quarantine in Sydney.

news_headline: Warner and Pucovski return to Aus squad ahead of third Test, Burns dropped
news_article: Openers David Warner and Will Pucovski were included in the Australian squad for the third and fourth Test against India. But out-of-form opener Joe Burns was dropped from the 18-man squad. While Warner is recovering from a groin injury sustained during the ODI series, Pucovski suffered a concussion that ruled him out of the first two Tests.

news_headline: India came to Aus with fantastic plans for Steve Smith: Hussey
news_article: Former Australia cricketer Michael Hussey said India has come well-prepared with "fantastic plans" to negate the threat posed by Australia batsman Steve Smith. "India are attacking his stumps, bowling straight, setting leg-side field to cut off scoring options and it is really working," Hussey added. After the first two Tests, Smith has managed scores of 1, 1*, 0 and 8.

news_headline: MCG in Australia becomes India’s most successful ground outside India
news_article: With the eight-wicket win over Australia in the Boxing Day Test, India registered their fourth win at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG), making it India's most successful hunting ground overseas. Prior to the second Test, India also had three wins each at the SSC in Sri Lanka, the Sabina Park in Jamaica, the Queen's Park Oval in Trinidad and Tobago.

news_headline: Why will Spain keep a register of people who refuse COVID-19 vaccine?
news_article: Spain will keep a register of people who refuse to take COVID-19 vaccine and share it with other European Union nations. Spain's Medicines Agency head said it'll be used "to understand the causes behind declining the vaccination...doubt or rejection". The register will also be proof that there's no error in the system and the persons were offered the vaccine.

news_headline: Viral pic shows 3 exhausted medics resting on floor next to COVID-19 patient
news_article: A viral picture shows three medical students in protective suits resting on the floor next to a COVID-19 patient at an hospital in Russia's Sosnovy Bor. "My utmost gratitude to Rasul, Katya and Lyosha for taking an extra shift in an emergency," the chief nurse said. "We were exhausted...The hazard suit doesn't breath at all," one of them said.

news_headline: Girlfriend of Nashville bomber told police in 2019 he was building bombs in a vehicle
news_article: The girlfriend of Anthony Warner who set off the Christmas Day explosion in US' Nashville told police in 2019 that he was making bombs in his recreational vehicle, as per Metropolitan Nashville Police Department documents. Her attorney Raymond Throckmorton had told police officers that Warner frequently talked about the military and bomb making. Warner was killed in the suicide bombing.

news_headline: 22 killed in explosion at Aden airport in Yemen, attack captured live on camera
news_article: At least 22 people were killed and over 50 wounded in an attack, which was captured live on camera, on Yemen's Aden airport on Wednesday. There was at least one explosion shortly after a plane carrying the war-torn country's newly formed government arrived. A second explosion was heard around Maasheq presidential palace where cabinet members had been taken to safety.

news_headline: Nurse turns home into ICU for COVID-19 +ve family members in Greece
news_article: A critical care nurse set up a makeshift ICU in the downstairs apartment of his family's two-storey home in Greece after his family members tested COVID-19 positive. Gabriel  Tachtatzoglou had to quarantine and could not go to work as his relatives had COVID-19. He rented, borrowed and modified the monitors, oxygen delivery machines and other equipment.

news_headline: Nurse in Indonesia strips off PPE to have sex with Covid patient in toilet, suspended
news_article: A nurse at the Wisma Atlet Emergency Hospital in Indonesia's Jakarta has been suspended after admitting to stripping off his PPE to have sex with a COVID-19 positive patient in the hospital toilet. The patient uploaded a screenshot of WhatsApp messages between them after which an investigation took place. The pair are currently both in independent isolation.

news_headline: UK MPs approve Brexit trade deal by 521 votes to 73
news_article: The UK MPs approved the Brexit trade deal to pave the way for the UK-EU agreement to come into force at 11 pm on December 31. The House of Commons backed the agreement struck between the UK PM and the EU by 521 votes to 73. The deal stretches to 1,246 pages and covers £660 billion worth of trade.

news_headline: Hindu temple vandalised, set on fire by mob of hundreds in Pakistan
news_article: A Hindu temple in Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province was vandalised and set on fire by a mob of hundreds on Wednesday following a dispute over the land occupied by it. Khyber Pakhtunkhwa CM Mahmood Khan termed the attack as "an unfortunate incident." "Legal action will be taken against all the people who took the law in their hands," police said.

news_headline: Thailand's Pattaya placed under COVID-19 lockdown
news_article: Thailand's tourist city of Pattaya and the surrounding district were placed under lockdown on Wednesday as 250 new cases of coronavirus, including 241 local transmissions, were reported. The closing of non-essential shops in Bang Lamung district in Chonburi province, which includes Pattaya, was ordered. Restaurants are allowed to serve only takeaway food.

news_headline: Over 1mn Sputnik V doses will be distributed in Russia by Dec 31: Min
news_article: Russia will have distributed over 1 million doses of Sputnik V coronavirus vaccine in the country by end of this year, Industry Minister Denis Manturov said. The country has produced over two million doses of Sputnik V vaccine so far, Manturov added. Russia, which began COVID-19 vaccination earlier this month, is the fourth-worst coronavirus-hit nation with over 31 lakh cases.

news_headline: Negative COVID-19 test mandatory for all arriving passengers: Canada
news_article: The Canadian government has said it'll implement the requirement for all arriving passengers to have a negative COVID-19 test three days before arrival. The pre-boarding testing will not eliminate the already existing 14-day quarantine period, Bill Blair, Minister of Public Safety, said. Travellers who break quarantine face up to six months in jail or up to CAD 750,000 in fines.

news_headline: Pakistan to buy 1.2 million doses of China's Sinopharm vaccine
news_article: Pakistan on Thursday said it will buy 1.2 million doses of China's Sinopharm COVID-19 vaccine, the first official COVID-19 vaccine purchase of the country. The vaccine will be provided for free to frontline workers in the first quarter of 2021, Science & Technology Minister Fawad Hussain said. Earlier, the Pakistan government had approved $150 million in funding to buy vaccines.

news_headline: China reports first case of new coronavirus variant found in UK
news_article: China on Wednesday reported its first case of the new coronavirus variant that emerged in the UK. A 23-year-old woman, who arrived from Britain on December 14, was hospitalised on arrival as she showed mild symptoms and further tests confirmed that it was the new variant. Last week, China had suspended all UK flights indefinitely due to new COVID-19 variant.

news_headline: Oxford vaccine approval a triumph for British science: UK PM
news_article: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson said that the approval of COVID-19 vaccine developed by the University of Oxford and AstraZeneca is a "triumph for British science". Johnson added that the country will now "move to vaccinate as many people as quickly as possible". The UK on Wednesday became the first country in the world to approve the Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine.

news_headline: Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine to be rolled out in UK from January 4
news_article: The Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine will be rolled out in the UK from January 4 as hundreds of thousands of doses will be ready for next week, Health Secretary Matt Hancock said. The vaccine was approved for use in the UK on Wednesday. The 100 million doses of the vaccine purchased by the UK will cover the whole adult population, Hancock added.

news_headline: China gives its first COVID-19 vaccine approval to Sinopharm
news_article: China's health authorities on Thursday approved COVID-19 vaccine from state-owned Sinopharm for general public use, making it the country's first approved shot. The rollout would begin soon at a significantly reduced cost, officials said. China has administered over 4.5 million doses to citizens using at least three different vaccines since it launched an emergency use programme in July.

news_headline: COVID-19 pandemic made my last year in office the toughest: Merkel
news_article: German Chancellor Angela Merkel, in her last New Year address to the nation, said that the COVID-19 pandemic made her last year in the office the "toughest". "The coronavirus pandemic was and is the political, social and economic challenge of the century," she added. Merkel further said the start of vaccinations against COVID-19 made 2021 a year of hope.

news_headline: Argentine Senate approves bill legalising abortion
news_article: Argentina's Senate on Wednesday voted 38-29 in favour of a bill to legalise abortion up to the 14th week of pregnancy. Until now, abortions in the country were only permitted in cases of rape or when the mother's health was at risk. The bill, proposed by President Alberto Fernández, had been approved by the Chamber of Deputies earlier this month.

news_headline: A consent to killing children: Bolsonaro on Argentina legalising abortions
news_article: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro has criticised Argentina's decision to legalise abortions up to 14th week of pregnancy, calling it as state "consent" to killing children. "I deeply regret the lives of Argentine children, now exposed to being cut from wombs of their mothers with the consent of the state," he said, adding that he would never allow abortions in Brazil.

news_headline: Russia opens new criminal probe against opposition leader Navalny
news_article: Russian state investigators on Tuesday opened a new criminal case against opposition leader Alexey Navalny, accusing him of "fraud". The investigators accused Navalny of using public donations to his organisations for personal needs. "They're trying to put me behind bars for failing to die and continuing to hunt my killers and for proving that Putin was behind it," Navalny said.

news_headline: Convicted US spy Pollard arrives in Israel, PM Netanyahu greets him
news_article: Jonathan Pollard, who served 30 years in US prison for spying for Israel, arrived at Israel on Wednesday. PM Benjamin Netanyahu welcomed Pollard and his wife at the airport before handing in an Israeli passport. "We're ecstatic to be home at last after 35 years," he said. Pollard was jailed in 1987 for leaking thousands of classified documents to Israel.

news_headline: America's 'most prolific' serial killer Samuel Little dies at 80
news_article: Samuel Little, a man described by the FBI as US' "most prolific" serial killer, died on Wednesday aged 80. Little, who was serving three life sentences for murder of three women, had confessed to killing 93 women between 1970 and 2005. Authorities said he appeared to have targeted mostly vulnerable young Black women, many of them prostitutes or drug addicts.

news_headline: China jails 29 Taiwan nationals deported from Spain in telecom fraud case
news_article: A Chinese court on Thursday sentenced 29 people from Taiwan, who were deported from Spain, for up to 14 years for telecom fraud. Taiwan has denounced deportations to China as an abuse of human rights. Meanwhile, China has defended the deportations, saying that the suspects should be tried in Chinese court because they're accused of defrauding the Chinese people.

news_headline: Biden names Kathleen Hicks as 1st woman Deputy Defence Secretary
news_article: US President-elect Joe Biden has nominated Kathleen Hicks to be Deputy Defence Secretary. Hicks, if confirmed by US Senate, would be the first woman to hold the number two position in the Pentagon. Hicks, who's heading Biden's transition team at the Pentagon, had served under ex-President Barack Obama as principal deputy undersecretary of defence for policy, strategy, plans and forces.

news_headline: Ex-PM Nawaz Sharif's passport to be cancelled on Feb 16: Pak Minister
news_article: Pakistan's Interior Minister Sheikh Rashid Ahmed said the government will cancel ex-PM Nawaz Sharif's passport on February 16. Sharif has been in London since November last year after he was granted permission to go abroad for four weeks for medical treatment. Sharif, who was convicted in two corruption cases, was recently declared a proclaimed offender by Islamabad High Court.

news_headline: Delhi Minister Gopal Rai in Mumbai for treatment, Sisodia gets his portfolios
news_article: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has been allocated all ministerial portfolios of Cabinet Minister Gopal Rai temporarily as the latter has gone to Mumbai for treatment of his spinal injury. Rai held the portfolios of Development, General Administration Department, Environment, Forest and Wildlife. Delhi Chief Minister's office said Rai will be in Mumbai for treatment for the next 20 days.

news_headline: What did Rajinikanth write in letter announcing decision to not enter politics?
news_article: Announcing his decision to not enter politics, Rajinikanth wrote a letter stating, "My hospitalisation was like a warning from God. My campaign will impact health amid the pandemic." "Now this coronavirus has changed form...If something happens to my health since I take immunosuppressants, then people who have...joined me will have to face several difficulties mentally and financially," he stated.

news_headline: Kerala Assembly passes resolution against Centre's 3 farm laws
news_article: Kerala Assembly on Thursday passed a resolution against the three central farm laws with the support of both LDF and UDF legislators. Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan had moved the resolution in the Assembly against the laws in a special session convened to discuss the farmers' issue. Farmers have been protesting against these laws in Delhi for over a month now.

news_headline: No meaningful outcome of talks with China, status quo remains: Rajnath
news_article: Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Wednesday said that no "meaningful solution" has come out of diplomatic and military level talks with China to resolve the standoff on the Line of Actual Control (LAC) in eastern Ladakh and there is "status quo". He added that if the status quo continues, there cannot be a reduction in the deployment of troops.

news_headline: All Kerala MLAs, including lone BJP MLA, approve anti-farm laws' resolution
news_article: The Kerala Assembly on Thursday passed a unanimous resolution demanding the repeal of all the three agricultural laws enacted by the Centre. The resolution was passed by voice vote with all 140 MLAs supporting it, including the lone BJP member in the House, O Rajagopal. "I supported the substance of the resolution in accordance with the democratic spirit," Rajagopal said.

news_headline: Farmer unions accept govt proposal for next round of talks on Dec 30
news_article: The Farmer unions on Tuesday wrote a letter to the Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers' Welfare accepting Centre's proposal to hold next round of talks on December 30. In the letter, the unions reiterated its four-point agenda, including modalities to repeal farm laws and a mechanism to bring a law for providing a legal guarantee on Minimum Support Price (MSP).

news_headline: I don't approve of conversion for marriage: Rajnath on anti-conversion law
news_article: Speaking on the misuse of anti-conversion law, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Wednesday said, "The practice of mass conversions should stop." He said, "I personally don't approve of conversion for marriage." He added, "In many cases, it has been seen that religious conversion is being done forcefully. There is a huge difference between natural marriage and forceful conversion for marriage."

news_headline: Slightly disappointing: Haasan on Rajinikanth's decision to not join politics
news_article: Actor-turned-politician Kamal Haasan said that although Rajinikanth's decision to not take the political plunge was "slightly disappointing", the 70-year-old's health is very important to him. "I am feeling the same way that his (Rajinikanth's) fans are feeling," said Haasan. He said he would have to talk to Rajinikanth to understand why he dropped his plans to join politics.

news_headline: NCP's Eknath Khadse skips ED visit, cites coronavirus symptoms
news_article: Senior NCP leader Eknath Khadse, who was summoned by the Enforcement Directorate over the Bhosari land deal case, on Wednesday stated that he could not appear before it as he had coronavirus symptoms. Stating that he would visit the ED office after the 14-day quarantine period, he added, "I have nothing to fear or hide regarding the land deal."

news_headline: PM of another country shouldn't discuss India's affairs: Rajnath on Trudeau
news_article: When asked about Canadian PM Justin Trudeau's comments on the farmers' agitation, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said, "First, I would like to say that the PM of another country should stop talking about India's internal affairs." Singh added, "India doesn't require any outside interference... It's our internal matter. No country has the right to comment on our internal affairs."

news_headline: 5 TMC MPs write to President Kovind, seek removal of WB Governor
news_article: Five TMC MPs have sent a memorandum to President Ram Nath Kovind demanding the immediate removal of West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar. They said the Governor has "failed to preserve, protect and defend the Constitution and repeatedly breached law declared by the Supreme Court." They added, "He...refuses to sign a number of bills passed by the West Bengal Legislative Assembly."

news_headline: LS Speaker seeks probe into K'taka Legislative Council Dy Chairman's death
news_article: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla has sought a high-level probe through an independent agency into the death of Karnataka Legislative Council's Deputy Chairman SL Dharmegowda. Birla said the recent incident involving Dharmegowda, where he was forcefully removed from the chair in the House was a "harsh blow to the dignity of democracy". Dharmegowda's body was found on railway tracks yesterday.

news_headline: We can't force Rajinikanth: Brother as he backs out from launching party
news_article: After Rajinikanth on Tuesday announced that he will not start a political party, citing his health issues, his elder brother R Sathyanarayana Rao supported the actor's decision. "We too believed that (he would launch the party). He has cited health reasons. So, we can't force him. It's his wish. Whatever decision he has taken, that's definitely right," Rao said.

news_headline: Ex-India spinner L Sivaramakrishnan joins BJP ahead of TN assembly polls
news_article: Former India leg-spinner Laxman Sivaramakrishnan joined BJP in Chennai on Wednesday. "I know I couldn't do justice to my talent and expectations of my fans as a cricketer. I will fulfill that commitment in politics," Sivaramakrishnan said. He made his India debut at 17 years and 118 days and was a member of the 1985 World Championship of Cricket-winning team.

news_headline: Agriculture can't be run by sitting in Delhi: Sharad Pawar to Centre
news_article: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Tuesday said, "Agriculture cannot be run by sitting in Delhi as it involves hard-working farmers in villages and a bigger responsibility for this subject lies with state governments." He added, "In politics and democracy, dialogue should take place. How can a government say...that it will not listen or it will not change its line?"

news_headline: BJP's attempts to bring down Maharashtra govt won't succeed: Pawar
news_article: NCP chief Sharad Pawar has said that Uddhav Thackeray-led Maha Vikas Aghadi government in Maharashtra is "stable" and BJP's attempts to bring it down will not succeed. He added that the Enforcement Directorate's action against leaders of the ruling alliance and their family members is "misuse of authority". "[ED] even tried to give me a notice...but later withdrew," Pawar said.

news_headline: Goyal, Tomar join farmers for langar amid talks at Vigyan Bhawan
news_article: Amid the sixth round of talks between the Centre and farmers on Wednesday, Union Ministers Piyush Goyal and Narendra Singh Tomar joined the farmer leaders for langar during lunch time at Vigyan Bhawan. The farmer unions on Tuesday had accepted the Centre's proposal to hold next round of talks over farm laws.

news_headline: Govt accepts farmers' demands on stubble burning, power subsidy
news_article: After over a month of farmers' protest at the Delhi border, the Centre agreed to decriminalise stubble burning and continue with the existing system of power subsidy for agricultural use. A farmer leader said that the government agreed to "two of our demands" but "main demands" of the repeal of farm laws and MSP guarantee are still pending.

news_headline: AIMIM's UP chief booked for holding press meet without permission
news_article: Police have booked around six members of the AIMIM, including party's UP President Shaukat Ali, for allegedly holding a press conference without permission in Balrampur on Sunday. Police said that those present at the press conference were not following the COVID-19 protocols either. Ali called the police's action as "the death of democracy and abuse of basic rights".

news_headline: Rahul consistently absent from India during significant occasions: BJP
news_article: BJP National Spokesperson Syed Shahnawaz Hussain has said that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has been consistently absent from India during significant occasions and has again left for abroad to celebrate the New Year 2021. "This shows his lack of seriousness and concern towards India and the issues faced by the people," Hussain added.

news_headline: AIMIM to tie up with BTP for Guj local bodies' polls: MP Jaleel
news_article: The All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen (AIMIM) will contest local bodies' elections in Gujarat in alliance with the Chhotubhai Vasava-led Bharatiya Tribal Party (BTP), AIMIM's Aurangabad Lok Sabha MP Imtiaz Jaleel said on Monday. "We do not have a state unit as yet in Gujarat but there are AIMIM supporters working in places like Ahmedabad and Bharuch," Jaleel said.

news_headline: Totally baseless: Nitish Kumar on RJD's claim of 17 MLAs leaving JD(U)
news_article: After RJD leader Shyam Rajak claimed that 17 MLAs from JD(U) are willing to shift to RJD, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said, "These kind of claims are totally baseless." JD(U) spokesperson Rajiv Ranjan further said, "There is no resentment in JD(U). RJD...should keep its house together as many of the legislators are unhappy with Tejashwi Yadav's style of functioning."

news_headline: SBI to issue electoral bonds from January 1 to 10: Govt
news_article: The government on Tuesday said that SBI will issue electoral bonds from January 1-10 through its 29 authorised branches. The electoral bonds shall be encashed by an eligible political party only through a bank account with the authorised bank. The government added that electoral bonds shall be valid for 15 calendar days from the date of issue.

news_headline: Anti-conversion laws in BJP states unconstitutional: AIMIM chief
news_article: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has said that ordinances issued by some BJP-ruled states against religious conversion violate the Constitution. "Why don't you [BJP] make a law on providing MSP to the farmers that's the need of the hour," he added. This comes after Uttar Pradesh and Madhya Pradesh cleared ordinances against religious conversion through fraudulent means, including those for marriage.

news_headline: BJP can't topple Maharashtra govt by using ED: Shiv Sena
news_article: Shiv Sena in its mouthpiece Saamana said the BJP should "come out of the superstition that it can use the ED to topple the Maharashtra government". "The action against Sharad Pawar, Sanjay Raut, Khadse, Sarnaik or other MVA leaders is perversity at its peak," it added. Earlier, the ED summoned MP Sanjay Raut's wife in the PMC bank scam case.

news_headline: Our child should be respectful of people, don't want to raise brats: Anushka
news_article: Actress Anushka Sharma, who is expecting her first baby, has said, "What's important to us is that our child be respectful of people. You have to create that value structure. We don't want to raise brats." While talking about raising the baby, she told Vogue magazine, "We don't see it as mum and dad duties, but as a family unit."

news_headline: No aspect ruled out till date: CBI on Sushant Singh Rajput case
news_article: The CBI on Wednesday stated that it's conducting the investigation into the death of Sushant Singh Rajput in a thorough and professional manner, "using latest scientific techniques". "No aspect has been ruled out as on date," CBI said in its reply to a letter written by BJP leader Subramanian Swamy to the PMO, asking for an update on the investigation.

news_headline: Healing is more exhausting than I imagined: Shruti after 'emergency surgery'
news_article: Actress Shruti Seth, who recently underwent an "emergency surgery", has said, "I'm back home...and I'm recuperating." "Healing is more exhausting than I had imagined...For now I'm just taking it easy and sleeping as much as possible to let my body get it's strength back," she added. "Will be back on my feet and on my yoga mat soon," she wrote.

news_headline: Gal Gadot posts pic of Bilkis Dadi, calls her 'My Personal Wonder Woman'
news_article: 'Wonder Woman' actress Gal Gadot posted a picture of Shaheen Bagh's Bilkis Dadi along with pictures of other women and girls, and wrote, "Saying farewell to 2020, with all my love to #MyPersonalWonderWomen." "Some are those closest to me...some are inspiring women I've loved discovering, and some are exceptional women I hope to meet in the future," she said.

news_headline: We do not want to raise a child in the public eye: Anushka Sharma
news_article: Actress Anushka Sharma, who is due to deliver her first child in January, has said she and her husband, Team India captain Virat Kohli, do not want to raise a child in the public eye. She added, "We don’t plan on engaging our child in social media. I think it’s a decision your child should be able to take."

news_headline: First few days were really bad: Tannaz Irani on battling COVID-19
news_article: Actress Tannaz Irani, who contracted coronavirus earlier this month, has tested negative for the virus. She said that the first few days were "really bad" because she had "immense body pain and a massive headache". "I'd often lose focus on things, but I continued to have 'haldi doodh' and 'kadha' along with...Vitamin C supplements regularly...That really helped me," said Tannaz.

news_headline: I still give auditions, there's nothing wrong about it: Hiten Tejwani
news_article: On being asked if he still auditions for his roles, actor Hiten Tejwani, who has starred in over 40 films and shows, said, "Yes I do." He added, "People have seen me in...particular role, and they want to see me in...role they want to offer...to see if I can look that part, it's equally important. There's nothing wrong in that."

news_headline: Odia music director Shantanu Mohapatra passes away aged 84
news_article: Odia music director Shantanu Mohapatra, who composed music for films like 'Suryamukhi', 'Chilika Tire' and others, passed away aged 84 due to age-related ailments. CM Naveen Patnaik condoled his death and tweeted, "The imprint he left...through his musical style [will] always be memorable." Odisha Governor Ganeshi Lal and Minister of Petroleum Dharmendra Pradhan also condoled Mohapatra's demise.

news_headline: The tag of sex symbol doesn't bother me: Milind Soman
news_article: Model-actor Milind Soman has said the tag of sex symbol doesn't bother him. "For a man to be regarded as...sex symbol is great...Men are...happy to be regarded as sex symbols because that's something extra for them," he added. "When a woman is regarded as...sex symbol, it might be everything that she's seen for, which isn't a good thing," Milind said.

news_headline: Women in my family weren't allowed in the balcony, do eyebrows: Rakhi
news_article: In an episode of 'Bigg Boss 14', Rakhi Sawant said that women in her family were "not allowed to stand in the balcony or do eyebrows". "We were not allowed to do any waxing or anything," she added. "I got so many proposals for marriage...they used to back out after getting to know that I'm a Bollywood dancer," Rakhi stated.

news_headline: It takes me back to my days of stunts: Akshay on debut series The End
news_article: Akshay Kumar will make his digital debut with action thriller web series 'The End'. Talking about the project, he said, "'The End' takes me back to my days of stunts. I've previously said...I'm a stuntman first and...actor second, so to go back to doing real-life, heart-raising action on set is so exciting." Reportedly, it'll go on floors in early 2021.

news_headline: Intensive probe being carried out: CBI on Sushant's death case
news_article: CBI on Wednesday said that an "intensive" probe using the latest scientific techniques is being carried out to investigate the death of actor Sushant Singh Rajput. CBI added that it has visited places of concern like Aligarh, Faridabad, Hyderabad, Mumbai, Manesar and Patna. This comes after BJP MP Subramanian Swamy wrote to PM Modi regarding an update on the probe.

news_headline: Naseeruddin didn't charge any money for 'Ramprasad Ki Tehrvi': Director
news_article: Director Seema Pahwa, while talking about her upcoming film 'Ramprasad Ki Tehrvi', said the cast instantly agreed to do the film. "I was sure...no one would say no...There might be budget issues as this is...small-budget film...I told them if they don't want to work, it's ok. But they...supported me," she added. "Naseer sahab (Naseeruddin Shah) didn't...charge any money," said Seema.

news_headline: It was physically, emotionally demanding to play Mary Kom: Priyanka
news_article: Actress Priyanka Chopra Jonas has said that it was "both physically and emotionally demanding" to play boxer Mary Kom in the 2014 biopic. The 38-year-old actress posted a video on Instagram, showcasing few scenes from the movie and wrote, "It's an experience I will never forget. An amazing team and an equally supportive Mary herself saw me through it all."

news_headline: Wish you were here: Riddhima shares pics of late father Rishi
news_article: Riddhima Kapoor Sahni took to Instagram to post throwback pictures of her late father Rishi Kapoor. She captioned the post, "You are missed everyday! Wish you were here with us. We love you." Rishi Kapoor passed away at the age of 67 in April this year after battling leukemia for more than two years.

news_headline: 1st time I didn't know how crew looked like: Arjun on shooting amid COVID-19
news_article: Actor Arjun Rampal has said it was extremely challenging to shoot for 'Nail Polish' amid the coronavirus pandemic. He added that all the necessary precautions were taken on the sets. "This was...first time when I didn't know how...crew looked like because...of...mask. One thing...I'll never forget was their eyes which were filled with gratitude to be back at work," said Arjun.

news_headline: Mr India inspired me to become actor, watched it 25-35 times: Nimrat
news_article: Actress Nimrat Kaur has said Anil Kapoor and Sridevi's 1987 film 'Mr India' inspired her to become an actor. "I've watched that film 25-35 times maybe," she added. Nimrat also talked about working with late actor Irrfan Khan in 2013 film 'The Lunchbox' and said, "I'm so blessed that I actually got to be in the same film with him."

news_headline: Ishaan, Tripti to star in Dharma's psychological thriller: Reports
news_article: Ishaan Khatter and Tripti Dimri will reportedly star in Dharma Productions' next psychological thriller film. Reportedly, Tripti will be playing a complex character in the film, which will be directed by Anubhuti Kashyap. The film is reportedly written by Sumit Saxena, who also worked on 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama' and 'Lust Stories'. It'll go on floors mid-next year, as per reports.

news_headline: Filmmaker Aanand L Rai tests positive for coronavirus
news_article: Filmmaker Aanand L Rai, known for directing films like 'Tanu Weds Manu', 'Raanjhanaa', 'Zero' and others, on Thursday tested positive for the coronavirus. "I don't feel any symptoms and I feel fine. I'm quarantining as instructed by authorities," he tweeted. Rai recently wrapped up the shooting of his movie 'Atrangi Re' which will star Akshay Kumar and Sara Ali Khan.

news_headline: Kerala censor board denies screening of film based on JNU protests
news_article: Central Board of Film Certification's Kerala regional office denied permission to screen the Malayalam film 'Varthamanam' set in the backdrop of students' protests in JNU in early 2020. Aryadan Shoukath, the film's producer and script-writer, said that the CBFC officials did not give any reason for denying the certification. Directed by Sidhartha Siva, the film stars actress Parvathy Thiruvothu.

news_headline: 2020 has been fulfilling professionally for me: Jacqueline
news_article: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez, who'll be seen in films like 'Bachchan Pandey', 'Bhoot Police', 'Cirkus' and 'Kick 2', said, "The year (2020) has been fulfilling professionally for me with back-to-back project announcements." She further said the year 2021 will be hectic for her, adding, "I am looking forward to the year and never wish to stop working."

news_headline: Salman to cameo as Prem of 'Maine Pyar...' in 'Laal Singh...': Reports
news_article: Salman Khan will reportedly have a cameo as Prem of his 1989 film 'Maine Pyar Kiya' in Aamir Khan's film 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. The shooting for the same will reportedly take place on January 8. "Aamir's character, then an Army man in his 20s, will be seen bumping into Salman," Mid-Day quoted a source as saying.

news_headline: Spending a month in jail has crushed Rhea's morale: Rumi Jaffery
news_article: Filmmaker Rumi Jaffery has said it has been a traumatic year for Rhea Chakraborty, who was arrested by NCB in a drug case linked to Sushant Singh Rajput's death case. "Can you imagine any girl from...well-to-do middle-class family spending a month in jail? It has crushed her morale completely," he added. Rumi further said she'll resume work from next year.

news_headline: Our safety innovations have saved over a million lives: Volvo
news_article: Volvo has said that the seatbelt, the speed limit and every other feature unique to its cars has contributed to saving millions of lives. "Volvo Cars has been a leader in the field of car safety for decades," the company added. Volvo further said that with the coming year 2021, it'll begin its journey to save a million more lives.

news_headline: 80-year-old man from Austria buys his 80th Porsche, pictures surface
news_article: Ottocar J, a resident of Austria's Vienna who recently bought a Boxster Spyder in blue colour, has bought 80 Porsche cars over the past several decades. He said his passion for Porsche started nearly 50 years ago. "I can drive a different one every day for a month, and two at the weekends," Ottocar, who currently owns 38 cars, said.

news_headline: Musk reveals he tried selling Tesla to Apple but Tim Cook refused a meeting
news_article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk revealed that he once approached Apple CEO Tim Cook to discuss the possibility of the iPhone maker acquiring Tesla for a tenth of its current value, indicating a valuation of about $60 billion. "He refused to take the meeting," he added. Musk said he had contacted Cook during the "darkest days" of development of Model 3.

news_headline: Tesla to start operations in India in early 2021, confirms Nitin Gadkari
news_article: Union Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari on Monday told The Indian Express that Elon Musk-led electric vehicle company Tesla will start operations in India in early 2021. He said Tesla will start operations first with sales and then maybe look at assembly and manufacturing. Some recent reports claimed that Tesla will launch Model 3 in India in June 2021.

news_headline: Why has Mumbai Police arrested car designer Dilip Chhabria of DC Design?
news_article: Mumbai Police revealed that car designer Dilip Chhabria, Founder of DC Design, has been arrested in DC Avanti car financing and forgery scam of at least ₹40 crore. Police said Chhabria was selling multiple cars with the same engine and chassis numbers. He's also accused of taking multiple loans on one car and then selling car to a third party.

news_headline: Mahindra's South Korean unit SsangYong files for bankruptcy
news_article: Mahindra & Mahindra's South Korean subsidiary SsangYong Motor Company has filed for bankruptcy after it defaulted on loan repayment of about ₹400 crore. SsangYong has also applied for an autonomous restructuring support programme, which gives the automaker up to three months to negotiate with stakeholders to resolve issues. Mahindra acquired SsangYong from near-insolvency in 2010.

news_headline: Car designer Dilip Chhabria of DC Design arrested in case of alleged cheating
news_article: Renowned car designer Dilip Chhabria has been arrested in connection with an alleged cheating and forgery case, Mumbai Police said on Monday. Chhabria is the Founder of Indian design firm DC Design that makes concept cars and custom special order vehicles. One of his cars was also seized and Crime Branch said that there were more accused in the case.

news_headline: COVID-19 was black swan event for CV segment: Tata Motors
news_article: COVID-19 was a "black swan event" for commercial vehicle (CV) segment as it followed axle load norms, low freight demand and BS-VI impact, Girish Wagh, President, Tata Motors CV Business Unit, said. "It aggravated the slowdown the segment was already going through," he added. However, Wagh said, the company expects fourth quarter sales to outperform fourth quarter of last year.

news_headline: Entertainment will be critical when cars drive themselves: Elon Musk
news_article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk, while discussing in-car gaming in autonomous vehicles, tweeted, "Entertainment will be critical when cars drive themselves." Tesla recently released an update that featured three new in-car video games. Musk said an online multiplayer version of one of the games will be added and asked people what Tesla should do with in-car gaming in an autonomous world.

news_headline: Tesla Model 3 deliveries to start in India by June: Report
news_article: Tesla will start delivering Model 3 Sedan in India by June next year, The Economic Times reported. The expected price of the electric sedan is about ₹55-60 lakh and its bookings will commence from next month. Earlier in October, Tesla CEO Elon Musk had confirmed Tesla's entry in India in 2021.

news_headline: Apple's self-driving car poses a real challenge: Volkswagen CEO
news_article: On reports of Apple launching its self-driving car by 2024, Volkswagen CEO Herbert Diess said, it poses "a real challenge—dimensions greater than those within our industry" such as Toyota. "The incredible evaluation and thus the virtually unlimited access to resources inspire us a great deal of respect," Diess said. "We are looking forward to new competitors," he further added.

news_headline: Volkswagen shares first glimpse of mobile EV charging robot
news_article: Volkswagen has shared the first glimpse of the prototype of a fully autonomous mobile electric vehicle (EV) charging robot. The robot starts up by either using an app or through communication with the car itself and independently steers the vehicle to be charged. The robot is also capable of charging several vehicles at the same time.

news_headline: Mustang EV's roof doesn't come off: Ford EV head in apparent dig at Tesla
news_article: Ford's electric vehicles head (EV) Darren Palmer, in an apparent dig at Elon Musk's Tesla, said his company's electric car Mustang Mach-E's "roof doesn't come off when you wash it". He said its "doors fit properly, the plastics and other materials color-match and the bumpers don't fall off". Earlier, roofs of Tesla Model Y vehicles flew off on two instances.

news_headline: BMW to build quarter of million more EVs than planned between 2021-23
news_article: BMW is "significantly increasing" the number of EVs and plans to build "a quarter of a million more electric cars than originally planned" between 2021-2023, CEO Oliver Zipse said. BMW wants roughly every fifth car it sells to be powered by an electric engine by 2023, Zipse added. He also stressed the need to speed up charging infrastructure's expansion.

news_headline: Tesla Model Y debuts as police patrol vehicle in New York
news_article: Tesla Model Y debuted as a police patrol car in New York. It is reportedly the first-ever Model Y to be equipped as a police vehicle worldwide. The Model Y will serve as the police car assigned to the Detective Division of police. It has been outfitted with lights, sirens and radio to aid the police in its activities.

news_headline: Apple aiming to produce self-driving car by 2024: Report
news_article: Apple is aiming for a 2024 launch for its self-driving passenger vehicle that could include its own breakthrough battery technology, Reuters reported. Apple's automotive unit, codenamed Project Titan, was started in 2014 with a former Tesla executive at its helm. Apple is also reportedly working on a new battery that would increase the vehicle’s range and also be "radically" cheaper.

news_headline: Honda India stops Civic, CR-V production after Gr Noida plant closure
news_article: Honda India Senior Vice-President Rajesh Goel confirmed that production of its Civic and CR-V models is ending after the closure of its production facility in Greater Noida. The company now has only one plant in India, at Tapukara in Rajasthan. He said the models have to be discontinued as the Tapukara plant is designed to manufacture only mid-size cars.

news_headline: Tesla signs five-year deal with Chinese company for lithium supply
news_article: China's Sichuan Yahua Industrial Group has signed a five-year deal with Tesla to supply battery-grade lithium hydroxide to the EV manufacturer. The total value of the contract was put at $630-880 million over 2021-25 in a filing to the Shenzhen Stock Exchange, Reuters reported. Ganfeng Lithium, one of the world's largest lithium producers, also supplies the commodity to Tesla.

news_headline: India's fuel demand falls again in November after one-month pause
news_article: India's fuel demand resumed its downward trajectory last month after rising for the first time in seven months in October, Petroleum Planning and Analysis Cell data showed. While the overall consumption for petroleum products in November declined by nearly 4% against last year, the demand for petrol rose over 5%. Kerosene and diesel consumption slipped by 18% and 7% respectively.

news_headline: Honda shuts 23-year-old car unit in UP's Greater Noida
news_article: Honda Cars India has decided to shut its plant in Uttar Pradesh's Greater Noida, which was set up in 1997, reports said. However, the plant will continue to have its research and development set-up, spare parts division and corporate office. The automaker will rely on its facility in Rajasthan to roll out its entire product range in India, reports added.

news_headline: Ola eyeing sites in India, Europe to build charging stations: Report
news_article: Ride-hailing platform Ola is looking for multiple sites across India and Europe to build a network of charging stations for electric two-wheelers, PTI reported quoting sources. The charging stations will allow customers to charge their vehicles and they'll address concerns around charging requirements. Ola recently said it'll invest ₹2,400 crore to set up an electric scooter factory in Tamil Nadu.

news_headline: Tesla shares fall 6% in first day of trading on S&P 500 index
news_article: Elon Musk-led Tesla's shares on Monday dipped as much as 6.3% in pre-market trading in its first day of trading on the S&P 500 index. Tesla, which is the most valuable company to be added to the benchmark index, will account for 1.69% of the S&P 500. Tesla's shares have soared over 700% so far in 2020.

news_headline: Bajaj Auto to set up ₹650 crore manufacturing unit in Maharashtra
news_article: Bajaj Auto has said that it will invest ₹650 crore to set up a manufacturing plant in Maharashtra's Chakan. The facility is expected to start production in 2023 and will be utilised for manufacturing high-end KTM, Husqvarna and Triumph motorcycles, and electric vehicles, the automaker added. Bajaj Auto signed an MoU with the state government for the same.

news_headline: Indian auto sector to see stronger growth in 2021: Nomura
news_article: Global brokerage firm Nomura expects India's auto industry to register stronger growth next year. The personal vehicle segment, however, will recover to pre-COVID-19 levels only in 2023-24, the brokerage said. The auto industry faced an unprecedented challenge owing to the pandemic during the first half of 2020-21, Automotive Component Manufacturers Association (ACMA) had said.

news_headline: Jeff Bezos names Blue Origin's landing ship after his mother
news_article: Jeff Bezos on Wednesday unveiled Blue Origin's latest landing ship and revealed that it has been named after his mother, Jacklyn Bezos. "New Glenn's first stage will come home to the Jacklyn after every flight," he wrote in an Instagram post. The 600-foot ship has been designed as a floating landing point for the first-stage booster of New Glenn rocket.

news_headline: Hyd startup successfully test fires solid propulsion rocket stage Kalam-5
news_article: Skyroot Aerospace has successfully test fired its solid propulsion rocket stage demonstrator called Kalam-5. According to the Hyderabad-based startup, Kalam-5 uses the same propellant, materials and interfaces as the three solid propulsion stages of Vikram-1 launch vehicle. Expected to be launched in 2021, Vikram-1 vehicle will become India's first privately designed, developed and tested rocket.

news_headline: Doctors hear Mexican song while checking pulse in 65-year-old US man's feet
news_article: A 65-year-old US man, who had undergone hip-replacement surgery, visited a hospital after experiencing a fall and dislocating his hip. When doctors assessed pulse in his feet using a Doppler device, they heard a Mexican song playing through the device's speaker. Doctors assume that Doppler might've picked up a radio signal that was being received by the patient's prosthetic hips.

news_headline: Meteor shower streaks across the night sky in UK on Christmas
news_article: A meteor shower shot across the night sky near UK's Essex on Christmas Day, pictures of which have surfaced on social media. Paul Rowe, who captured the pictures, said that it lasted for about 15 seconds. The annual display, known as the Ursids meteor shower, runs from about December 17 to 26 and was at its peak on December 22.

news_headline: 2011-2020 warmest decade on record: World Meteorological Org
news_article: The decade from 2011 to 2020 is the warmest recorded decade ever, according to the World Meteorological Organization (WMO). "This year is on track to be one of the three warmest on record and may even rival 2016 as the warmest on record. The six warmest years have all been since 2015," the WMO tweeted.

news_headline: New green mineral found in rock mined 220 years ago
news_article: A sample of rock that was collected from a mine in Cornwall around 220 years ago has turned out to be an entirely new species of mineral. It was catalogued as something else and kept in London's Natural History Museum (NHM) since 1964. The dark green mineral has been named 'Kernowite' after Kernow, the Cornish language word for Cornwall.

news_headline: Why is IMD asking people in North India to not drink alcohol during cold wave?
news_article: The India Meteorological Department has advised people in North India to avoid alcohol during cold wave as it "reduces body temperature". Experts claim alcohol can decrease body's core temperature and increase the risk of hypothermia during cold exposure. They also state that alcohol has psychological and behavioural effects, which can impact person's ability to correctly perceive how cold it is.

news_headline: India's highest meteorological centre opens in Leh at 3,500 m above sea level
news_article: Union Minister Harsh Vardhan on Tuesday inaugurated India's highest meteorological centre established at 3,500 m above sea level in Leh by the India Meteorological Department (IMD). It will provide specialised weather forecasts for traffic movement on highways, agriculture and defence personnel. After Itanagar in Arunachal Pradesh, the Leh centre is the second MC located in the Himalayas.

news_headline: NASA shares video of galaxies that 'appear to be locked in a cosmic dance'
news_article: The National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) has shared a video of two galaxies, NGC 3314A and NGC 3314B, in the constellation Hydra, saying, "The galaxies appear to be locked in a cosmic dance." "They're separated by tens of millions of light-years, with one closer to us than the other," NASA wrote.

news_headline: NASA takes pic of 'Wolf Moon'; shares the story behind the name
news_article: NASA shared a picture of 'Wolf Moon', the 13th and final full Moon of 2020 that will be visible for about three days. NASA said the Algonquin tribes of what is now the northern and eastern US named it 'Wolf Moon' as packs of wolves howled hungrily outside villages in winter. Another name for it is 'Ice Moon', NASA said.

news_headline: Intact Ice Age-era woolly rhino discovered in Siberia
news_article: Paleontologists have found one of the best-preserved specimens of an Ice Age-era woolly rhino to date in Siberia. The rhino is believed to have lived in the late Pleistocene era, anywhere between 20,000 and 50,000 years ago. It was discovered with all its limbs, some of its organs including part of the intestines, its tusk and a lump of fat.

news_headline: Star Trek-actor James Doohan's ashes were smuggled to space station
news_article: Ashes of Star Trek-actor James Doohan were smuggled to the ISS in 2008 by Richard Garriott, who went there as a private astronaut, the London Times reported. Garriott says he took Doohan's laminated picture and some of his ashes and put it under ISS' Columbus module's floor. Initial requests to carry Doohan's ashes to ISS were denied.

news_headline: Japanese university to develop wooden satellites to cut down space junk
news_article: Japan's Kyoto University is teaming up with Japanese forestry company Sumitomo to develop wooden satellites to shoot into orbit by 2023 in a bid to cut down on space junk. Kyoto University professor and astronaut Takao Doi said wooden satellites, while burning on re-entry after falling out of orbit, release less harmful particles than metal satellites.

news_headline: China launches remote sensing satellite 'Yaogan-33'
news_article: China has launched a new remote sensing satellite, Yaogan-33, aboard a Long March-4C rocket. The mission also sent a micro and nano technology experiment satellite into orbit. The two satellites will be used for scientific experiments, land resources survey, crop yield estimation and disaster prevention and reduction. It was reportedly Long March carrier rocket series' 357th flight mission.

news_headline: SpaceX will try to 'catch' boosters returning from space: Elon Musk
news_article: Elon Musk said that SpaceX will "try to catch" Super Heavy rocket boosters returning from outer space instead of making them land. This will be done with the help of a launch tower arm, he added. Currently, the return of Falcon 9 boosters involve touching down on a boat or a launchpad using "legs" that are built into the rocket.

news_headline: Developing green propulsion for human space mission 'Gaganyaan': ISRO
news_article: ISRO Chairman K Sivan said the space agency was developing "green propulsion" for its human space flight mission, 'Gaganyaan'. He also said it may be adopted for use in every stage of a rocket. Earlier, Sivan had said that Gaganyaan "will be delayed because of COVID-19". ISRO had previously planned to launch Gaganyaan by December 2021.

news_headline: ISRO to begin training 4 Bhutanese space engineers for satellite launch
news_article: ISRO will begin phase one of the training of four Bhutanese engineers for the launch of Bhutan's satellite scheduled for next year. Phase one of the training will last from December 28 to February 25 and will involve theoretical and technical aspects along with visits to labs and test facilities. The second phase will focus on developing the satellite.

news_headline: Highest levels of microplastics found in molluscs among seafood: Study
news_article: Researchers from the Hull York Medical School and the University of Hull have said mussels, oysters and scallops have the highest levels of microplastic contamination among seafood.  Molluscs collected off the coasts of Asia were the most heavily contaminated. The study looked at more than 50 studies between 2014 and 2020.

news_headline: 2021 to have 4 eclipses, 2 to be visible from India: Report
news_article: There will four eclipses in 2021, Ujjain-based Jiwaji Observatory's Superintendent Dr Rajendra Prakash Gupt told PTI. The first event, a lunar eclipse on May 26, will be seen in parts of West Bengal, coastal Odisha and in the Northeastern states, except Sikkim. A partial lunar eclipse on November 19 will be visible from Arunachal Pradesh and some parts of Assam.

news_headline: ISRO chief K Sivan's tenure extended by one year
news_article: The Centre on Wednesday extended the services of ISRO chief K Sivan as Space Secretary and Space Commission Chairman by a year. Sivan was provided the extension since the space programme's flagship projects, Gaganyaan and Chandrayaan-3, are still pending. His tenure will now be up to January 14, 2022, or until further orders, whichever is earlier.

news_headline: Possible process to convert CO2 into jet fuel developed: Oxford team
news_article: Oxford University researchers have developed an experimental process that might turn CO2 into jet fuel. If successful, the process could result in "net zero" emissions from aeroplanes. The experiment was conducted in a laboratory and still needs to be replicated at a larger scale. Researchers had heated a citric acid, hydrogen and an iron-manganese-potassium catalyst mixture during the experiment.

news_headline: 1.09 L previously unrecognised impact craters on Moon found: Study
news_article: Researchers have identified over 1.09 lakh unrecognised impact craters on the Moon using machine learning methods. The team used information from China's first and second lunar orbiters, Chang'e-1 and Chang'e-2. They also estimated the ages of 18,996 newly detected craters larger than 8 kilometres in diameter.

news_headline: 10 costliest disasters of 2020 caused $150B worth of damages: Report
news_article: The ten costliest weather disasters this year worldwide caused insured damages worth over $150 billion, NGO Christian Aid reported. They claimed at least 3,500 lives and displaced more than 13.5 million people. Five of the most costly extreme weather events were related to Asia's unusually rainy monsoon. Only 4% of economic losses from climate-impacted events in low-income countries were insured.

news_headline: Researchers discover new Indian Muraingrass species in Western Ghats
news_article: Researchers from Pune's ARI and the University of Goa claim to have discovered a species of Indian Muraingrass along the Western Ghats. They said the species has fought harsh conditions to survive in the ecologically-sensitive region. The species was identified after morphological studies of samples collected from laterite surfaces in the outskirts of Goa's Bhagwan Mahavir National Park.

news_headline: ESA-NASA's 'Solar Orbiter' probe completes its first Venus flyby
news_article: The joint ESA-NASA Solar Orbiter spacecraft completed its first flyby of Venus. Solar Orbiter reached its closest approach to Venus when the spacecraft was about 7,500 kilometres from Venus' cloud tops. During the flyby, Solar Orbiter gathered data that could provide insights into how Venus interacts with solar winds.
